faqs.answer: No specific age limit is mentioned in the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Can applicants from other states apply?
faqs.answer: No, only students with Andhra Pradesh domicile are eligible.

faqs.question: Can students availing benefits from other government schemes apply?
faqs.answer: Generally not, except for those under Archaka Welfare Trust.

faqs.question: Can students with backlogs apply?
faqs.answer: No, students must have cleared all subjects in previous years.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance disbursed?
faqs.answer: Directly into the student's bank account through online transfer.

faqs.question: What documents are needed for application?
faqs.answer: Aadhar card, income certificate, caste certificate, study certificates, and bank passbook.

faqs.question: How can I apply for BSE?
faqs.answer: Apply online at www.andhrabrahmin.ap.gov.in with required documents.

name: Mamta Taruni Abhiyan
description: DetailsUnder this program, free medical check-ups, iron and folic acid supplements, and deworming medication were provided to adolescent girls between the ages of 10 and 19 years, and pregnant women. The program also aimed to create awareness about menstrual hygiene, family planning, and nutrition among adolescent girls and pregnant women.The program was implemented through a network of health workers, including Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHAs), Auxiliary Nurse Midwives (ANMs), and Anganwadi workers. The Mamta Taruni Abhiyan was seen as a significant step towards improving maternal and child health in rural areas of Gujarat.﻿
benefits: BenefitsAccess to Health and Wellness Services: The scheme provides access to various health and wellness services
including health check-ups
antenatal care
postnatal care

and nutritional support.Improved Maternal and Child Health: The scheme aims to improve maternal and child health outcomes by providing timely and quality healthcare services to pregnant women and young girls.Health Education: The scheme also provides health education and awareness sessions to beneficiaries

which helps them make informed decisions about their health and well-being.Empowerment of Women and Girls: The scheme aims to empower women and girls by providing them with knowledge and skills related to health and nutrition
which helps them lead healthy and productive life.Financial Support: The scheme also provides financial support to pregnant women in the form of a cash incentive
which helps them meet their medical and nutritional needs.
eligibility_criteria: Eligibility Adolescent Girls: The scheme is open to all adolescent girls between the ages of 10 and 19 years who are residents of Gujarat.Pregnant Women: The scheme is open to all pregnant women who are residents of Gujarat.BPL Families: The scheme gives priority to women and girls belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.
required_documents: List of required documents Identification Documents: Beneficiaries must have identification documents such as a birth certificate
Aadhaar card

or any other valid government-issued identity proof.Medical Certificate: Pregnant women may be required to provide a valid medical certificate indicating their pregnancy status and health condition.Bank Account Details: Beneficiaries may need to provide their bank account details to receive financial support under the scheme.Income Certificate: Women and girls belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families may need to provide an income certificate as proof of their eligibility.Address Proof: Beneficiaries may need to provide an address proof such as a utility bill or a rent agreement to establish their residence in Gujarat.

faqs.question: Who can avail the benefits of the Mamta Taruni Abhiyan scheme in Gujarat?
faqs.answer: The scheme is open to adolescent girls and pregnant women who are residents of Gujarat. Women and girls belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families are given priority.

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides access to health and wellness services such as health check-ups, antenatal care, postnatal care, and nutritional support. It also provides health education and awareness sessions to beneficiaries and financial support to pregnant women in the form of a cash incentive

faqs.question: What is the cash incentive provided to pregnant women under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Pregnant women are provided a cash incentive of Rs. 6000 under the scheme to meet their medical and nutritional needs.

faqs.question: Is there any age limit for availing the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is open to all adolescent girls between the ages of 10 and 19 years and pregnant women.

faqs.question: Can I avail the benefits of the scheme if I am not a resident of Gujarat?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for residents of Gujarat.

faqs.question: What are the necessary documents needed?
faqs.answer:
1. Identification Documents.
2. Medical Certificate.
3. Bank Account Details.
4. Income Certificate.
5. Address Proof.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme ?
faqs.answer:
1. Visit the Nearest Health Center:
2. Fill out the Application Form.
3. Submit the Required Documents
4. Get Enrolled.
5. Receive Benefits and Services.

name: Maternity Benefit
description: The "Maternity Benefit'' scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, West Bengal, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall provide financial benefit during the period of maternity to the female beneficiary or wife in case of a male beneficiary who is registered for 1 year under the Board, subject to a maximum 2 times in his/ her whole life time.
benefits: Quantum of Assistance: ₹6
000/-.Note: The benefit shall be allowed for two times in beneficiarie's whole life time.﻿
eligibility_criteria: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:The applicant should be a resident of West Bengal.The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:The applicant should be a registered female member or wife of a male member Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of West Bengal.The applicant should be pregnant.
required_documents: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:Passport size photographs of the worker (Four copies).Attested copy of Proof of Age.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:Identity Card of the member.Medical Certificate.Any other document if required.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for registration as a beneficiary under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of West Bengal?
faqs.answer: The building worker must be at least 18 years old and not older than 60 years old.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: At present all Assistant Labour Commissioners and Inspectors posted at blocks and municipalities shall be responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Every building worker who is between the age of 18-60 years and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than 90 days during the preceding one year is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board of West Bengal.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for the registration?
faqs.answer: To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should collect and submit the Form-27 with all the mandatory documents (self attested, if required) and a fee of ₹20/- to the Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers.

faqs.question: Is there a specific form for the registration as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application for registration must be made in Form-27. You can obtain this form from the Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers in your area.

faqs.question: What happens after a construction worker is successfully verified for registration?
faqs.answer: Upon successful verification, the construction worker is registered, and an identity card and passbook are issued to him/her.

faqs.question: What are the fees associated with the registration process?
faqs.answer: The registration fee is ₹20/-, and the yearly subscription fee is ₹30/-. These amounts are noted in the passbook, and a receipt is issued.

faqs.question: How is the yearly subscription fee documented?
faqs.answer: The yearly subscription fee of ₹30/- is recorded in the passbook, and a receipt is issued for the payment.

faqs.question: What is the process for renewing the subscription after one year?
faqs.answer: After the expiry of one year, the subscription of the beneficiary is renewed upon payment of a renewal fee of ₹30/- and submission of an application made in Form-27A.

faqs.question: What happens if the subscription is not renewed after one year?
faqs.answer: If the subscription is not renewed, the registration of the beneficiary is cancelled after the expiry of one year.

faqs.question: Can a beneficiary reapply for renewal after cancellation?
faqs.answer: Yes, a fresh application for renewal can be submitted to the Assistant Labour Commissioner (ALC) for consideration.

faqs.question: What criteria must an applicant meet to be considered for this benefit?
faqs.answer: A registered female member or wife of a male member who is pregnant, shall be eligible for this benefit.

faqs.question: What is the maximum amount the Board may sanction for this benefit?
faqs.answer: The Board may sanction an amount of ₹.6,000/- to the beneficiaries under this scheme.

faqs.question: How many times can the beneficiary avail the benefits?
faqs.answer: The benefit shall be allowed for two times in his/her whole lifetime.

faqs.question: What form needs to be used to apply for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: The application must be made in the prescribed Form-XII. The form can be collected from Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers in your area.

faqs.question: Where do I submit the application for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Submit your welfare scheme application to the Assistant Labour Commissioners/ Beneficiary Registering Officers in your area.

name: Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme (HPBOCWWB)
description: In the scheme "Mentally Retarded Children Benefit" by the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Government of Himachal Pradesh, an amount of ₹20,000/- per annum is provided to the registered workers to take care of their mentally retarded/disabled children.
benefits: 000/- per annum
eligibility_criteria: For RegistrationThe applicant should be a resident of Himachal Pradesh.The applicant should be a Building or Construction Worker.The age of the applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.The applicant should have worked in building or construction activities for at least 90 days in the preceding 12 months.*The registration should be renewed annually.For ApplicationThe worker should be engaged in building or construction work under the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The worker should be registered with the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The worker's membership with the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board must be active.The child of the worker should be mentally retarded/disabled and dependent on the registered worker.
required_documents: Identity Proof I.e. Aadhaar Card
Voter CardBank Account Details/ Copy of Bank PassbookLabour CardID Proof of the Worker Issued by the Board

faqs.question: What is the Mentally Retarded Children Benefit Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme, introduced by the Himachal Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HPBOCWWB), provides annual financial assistance of ₹20,000 to support the care of mentally retarded or disabled children of registered construction workers.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A financial aid of ₹20,000 per year is provided for the care and well-being of the mentally retarded or disabled child.

faqs.question: Can both parents apply for assistance separately?
faqs.answer: No, the benefit is provided per eligible child and only one parent can apply for assistance under the scheme.

faqs.question: How can a worker register with HPBOCWWB?
faqs.answer:
A worker can register by:
Visiting the Labour Welfare Office in their jurisdiction.
Self-registering on the official portal of HPBOCWWB.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for HPBOCWWB registration?
faqs.answer:
To register, a worker must:
Be between 18 and 60 years old.
Have completed at least 90 days of construction work.
Be a resident of Himachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: Can a worker apply if they have more than one mentally retarded or disabled child?
faqs.answer: Yes, if a registered worker has more than one eligible child, they can apply separately for each child.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for applying for the benefit?
faqs.answer: There is no specific deadline, but the worker must have an active membership at the time of application. It is advisable to check with HPBOCWWB for any updates.

faqs.question: How can the financial assistance be used?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance is meant for the care and well-being of the mentally retarded or disabled child, including medical, educational, and other necessary expenses.

faqs.question: How is the amount disbursed to the beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance is directly transferred to the bank account of the registered worker.

faqs.question: Can a retired worker apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only active registered workers under HPBOCWWB are eligible for the scheme.

name: PURNA Scheme
description: The "PURNA Scheme" launched by the Women and Child Development Department, Gujarat, is a comprehensive initiative designed for adolescent girls aged 15-18 in Gujarat. It focuses on improving their nutritional status, health, and life skills while empowering them through education, vocational training, and exposure to public services. With no income limitations, the scheme ensures inclusivity by offering nutritional supplements, health check-ups, and life-skill training to all adolescent girls registered at Anganwadi centres. The scheme also promotes awareness of legal rights, self-competency, and social skills through engaging activities and field visits.﻿﻿﻿
benefits: Nutritional Support: Supplementary nutrition (PURNA Shakti) 4 packets (1kg/packet) on 4th Tuesday of every month which contains 9 micronutrients.Health Enhancement: Distribution of IFA tablets every Wednesday at schools and AWCs
along with health check-ups and referral services

is conducted in convergence with the Health Department.Educational Encouragement: Support out of school adolescent girls for school re-enrollment and vocational training.Life Skill Development: Knowledge of nutrition
health
and legal rights.Public Exposure: Visit at public places (Primary health centre
Bank

Post office and any government offices etc.) for their self-empowerment).Awareness Programs: Celebration of PURNA divas at Anganwadi centres on the 4th Tuesday of every month where various theme based activities are carried out based on health
nutrition and self -development of adolescent girls.Empowerment Kits: Distribution of PURNA kit at Anganwadi centres for awareness about nutrition
health and empowerment among adolescent girls.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a girl.The applicant must be aged between 15-18 years.Applicant must be enrolled at an Anganwadi center in Gujarat.﻿
required_documents: Age proof document (15-18 years).Address proof.Any other documents (if required).

faqs.question: What is the "PURNA Scheme"?
faqs.answer: The "PURNA Scheme" is an initiative aimed at reducing malnutrition, anemia, and early marriage among adolescent girls in Gujarat by educating them on health, nutrition, and life skills.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to participate in the "PURNA Scheme"?
faqs.answer: The "PURNA Scheme" is open to adolescent girls aged 15-18 years who are enrolled at an Anganwadi center in Gujarat.

faqs.question: Is there any income limitation for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme does not have any income limitations for participation.

faqs.question: How often are IFA tablets distributed?
faqs.answer: IFA tablets are distributed every Wednesday at schools and Anganwadi centers in coordination with the Health Department.

faqs.question: What health services are included in the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides health check-ups and referral services in collaboration with the Health Department.

faqs.question: What are PURNA Shakti packets?
faqs.answer: PURNA Shakti packets are monthly nutritional supplements containing nine micronutrients, distributed to eligible girls on the 4th Tuesday of each month.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of PURNA Divas?
faqs.answer: "PURNA Divas" is celebrated on the 4th Tuesday of every month at Anganwadi centers with theme-based activities focused on health, nutrition, and the empowerment of adolescent girls.

faqs.question: Can out-of-school girls participate in the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme encourages out-of-school adolescent girls to re-enroll in school or join vocational training programs.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the PURNA Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply by visiting their local Anganwadi center, providing the necessary documents such as age proof and enrollment details.

faqs.question: What kind of vocational training is supported under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme encourages enrollment in various vocational training programs such as ITI or KVK (Krishi Vigyan Kendra) to enhance self-empowerment.

faqs.question: Are there any fees to join the PURNA Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no fees to join the PURNA Scheme, as it is a government initiative aimed at empowering adolescent girls.

faqs.question: What is the significance of visits to public places?
faqs.answer: Visits to public places such as primary health centers, banks, post offices, and government offices are organized to empower girls and enhance their self-competency.

name: Home for Mentally Challenged Children
description: The scheme "Home for Mentally Challenged Children" by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry, aims to provide care for children facing mental challenges, i.e. low Intelligence Quotient (IQ). The scheme offers free boarding and lodging, uniform sets, daily living needs, and medical check-ups for the inmates. Additionally, it includes educational and recreational activities to enhance their overall well-being.
benefits: Free boarding and lodging for all the inmates.Free supply of 4 uniform sets to the inmates per year.Free supply of all daily living needs for the inmates.Free medical check-ups
including paediatric and psychiatric services

for all the inmates.Annual tours and local picnic trips to places of interest for the inmates.Annual Day for prize distribution to winners in sports events and cultural programmes.Non-formal education to assist and develop inmates in their day-to-day activities.Training in habits of discipline
cleanliness
good health
drawing
painting
yoga
and other extracurricular activities.﻿NOTE: Contact the authorities below in case of delay in disbursal of benefits:Puducherry: The Director
Directorate of Social Welfare
Saradhambal Nagar
Ellaipillaichavadhy
Puducherry. Karaikal: The Collector
Karaikal.Mahe/Yanam: The Regional Administrator
Mahe/Yanam.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should qualify as ANY ONE of the following:Boys in the age group of 7 to 17 years.Mild Mental Retardedness with an IQ level between 50-70.Moderate Mental Retardedness with an IQ level between 35-49.Severe Mental Retardedness with an IQ level between 20-34.Profound Mental Retardedness with an IQ level under 20.Unspecified Mental Retardedness with mental efficiency and sub-normality.
required_documents: Aadhaar Card.Voter ID.Address Proof.Ration Card.Age Proof.Disability Certificate.

faqs.question: What is the significance of the Annual Day in the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Annual Day serves as a platform for prize distribution to winners in sports events and cultural programmes, fostering a sense of achievement and recognition among the inmates.

faqs.question: Can you elaborate on the eligibility criteria for moderate mental retardation?
faqs.answer: Moderate mental retardation eligibility requires an IQ level between 35-49, ensuring that those falling within this range receive tailored support under the scheme.

faqs.question: What are the key educational components of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme includes non-formal education aimed at assisting and developing inmates in their daily activities, ensuring a well-rounded approach to their educational needs.

faqs.question: How does the scheme contribute to the recreational aspect of the inmates' lives?
faqs.answer: Annual tours and local picnic trips are organized to places of interest, providing recreational opportunities and fostering a positive environment for the inmates.

faqs.question: Besides medical services, what other forms of assistance are provided to the inmates?
faqs.answer: In addition to medical care, the scheme offers non-formal education to assist and develop inmates in their day-to-day activities, fostering their overall growth.

faqs.question: What is the frequency of uniform distribution under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Inmates receive four uniform sets annually, ensuring they have an adequate and regular supply for their daily needs.

faqs.question: What age group does the scheme target?
faqs.answer: The scheme is designed for boys aged 7 to 17 years who face varying levels of mental challenges, providing tailored support for their specific needs.

faqs.question: How does the scheme support inmates with unspecified mental retardation?
faqs.answer: The scheme caters to those with unspecified mental retardation by addressing mental efficiency and sub-normality, ensuring inclusive care for a diverse range of challenges.

faqs.question: Are there any cultural events included in the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme organizes an Annual Day for prize distribution to winners in sports events and cultural programmes, enhancing the cultural aspect of the inmates' lives.

faqs.question: What activities contribute to the overall well-being of the inmates?
faqs.answer: Apart from education, the scheme includes training in discipline, cleanliness, good health habits, as well as activities such as drawing, painting, and yoga for the inmates' holistic development.

faqs.question: What services are provided during the medical check-ups for the inmates?
faqs.answer: The medical check-ups encompass paediatric and psychiatric services to ensure comprehensive healthcare for mentally challenged children.

faqs.question: What are the specific benefits covered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefits include free boarding, 4 sets of uniforms annually, daily living essentials, medical check-ups, annual tours, local trips, and non-formal education for overall development.

name: Minimata Mahtari Jatan Yojana
description: The Labor Department of Chhattisgarh introduced the "Minimata Mahtari Jatan Yojana" on March 4, 2010, through the "Building and Construction Workers Welfare Board." This initiative is designed to provide benefits to registered female construction workers during pregnancy. The scheme applies to both male and female beneficiaries who are registered and possess a beneficiary identity card at least 90 days before the scheme application date.﻿Note: The name of this scheme was changed from "Bhagini Prasuti Sahayata Yojana" to "Minimata Mahtari Jatan Yojana" on May 12, 2022.﻿
benefits: A lump sum amount of ₹20
000/- will be provided to the registered female construction worker after the birth of the child.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Chhattisgarh.The applicant should be a woman worker.The applicant should be registered  Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The benefit will only be provided for only first two children.The applicant should be registered as a construction worker 90 days in advance.﻿Note: In case of the death of the beneficiary female worker during delivery
the payment of the Assistance Scheme will be payable to her husband (full amount).
required_documents: Certificate issued by self or Maternal and Child Card issued by ANMBank passbook photocopiesBirth certificateRegistration CertificateSelf-declaration certificateAadhaar CardSelf-declaration certificate in the prescribed form issued by the government in respect of the employer.

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: The "Building and Construction Workers Welfare Board" of the Chhattisgarh Government provided financial assistance to women construction workers on March 4, 2010.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: A lump sum assistance amount of ₹ 20,000/- will be given to the eligible beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits?
faqs.answer: All registered construction worker individuals from Chhattisgarh State.

faqs.question: What is the official website to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: URL : https://cglabour.nic.in/

faqs.question: Is this scheme for women?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for Registered female construction workers.

faqs.question: How late can a applicant apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicant can apply up to 90 days after the birth of the child

faqs.question: For how many children can the applicant avail the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Only upto 2 children.

faqs.question: How will the beneficiary get the benefit?
faqs.answer: Beneficiary will get the benefit through the RTGS/NEFT in her bank account.

faqs.question: Who will get the benefit if a woman dies during childbirth?
faqs.answer: Benefits will be provided to her husband.

faqs.question: How does one apply for assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible mothers can apply for assistance under this scheme through online portals.

name: Khushi Scheme
description: The Department of Health and Family Welfare, Government of Odisha had introduced a scheme named "Khushi" which aims to provide Free sanitary napkins to all girls in Government and aided schools from class 6th to 12th. Khushi (meaning "Happiness" in Odia) is a female health and hygiene program run by the Government of Odisha to provide free sanitary pads to girl students in Odisha. Khushi scheme of Odisha aims to provide good menstrual hygiene care to women of the state. The initiative aims to promote health and hygiene among school-going adolescent girls leading to higher retention in school and greater empowerment of women. The scheme provides free sanitary pads to girls in government and government-aided schools and also offers subsidized sanitary napkins to rural women. The scheme's goals include reducing the dropout rate among girls, improving academic performance, and empowering women. The Odisha State Medical Corporation Limited is the implementing agency of this scheme.ObjectivesPromote Menstrual Hygiene: The scheme seeks to increase awareness about menstrual hygiene and provide access to sanitary products.Reduce School Dropout Rates: By ensuring that girls have access to menstrual hygiene products, the scheme aims to reduce school absenteeism and dropout rates among adolescent girls.Economic Empowerment: The scheme also has elements designed to economically empower women and girls through the promotion of local production and distribution of sanitary products.
benefits: The Khushi Scheme offers several key benefits aimed at improving menstrual hygiene and overall well-being for women and girls in the state.1. Free or Subsidized Napkins: The scheme provides free or affordable sanitary napkins to women and girls
especially in rural and underserved areas where access to such products is limited.2. Education and Awareness: Through educational campaigns
the scheme raises awareness about menstrual hygiene practices
helping women and girls maintain better health and hygiene.3. Support for Adolescent Girls: By providing sanitary products and creating awareness
the scheme helps reduce school absenteeism and dropout rates among adolescent girls
ensuring they stay in school and continue their education.4. Employment: The scheme often includes components that support the local production of sanitary napkins
which create employment opportunities and contribute to the local economy.5. Prevention of Health Issues: By promoting the use of sanitary products and proper menstrual hygiene practices
the scheme helps in preventing health issues related to menstruation
such as infections and rashes.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Odisha.All school girls from classes 6th to 12th are eligible.
required_documents: Aadhaar CardProof of ResidenceSchool ID Card

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for girls?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for girls

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The school-going girls from class 6th to 12th are eligible under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The purpose of this scheme is to improve the health and Hygiene of the girls with respect to their menstrual cycles, and to also retain them in the school even after they reach puberty.

faqs.question: Is there any such benefit for grown up women in Odisha?
faqs.answer: Yes, The government of Odisha is also providing sanitary napkins to rural women at subsidised rates of Rs. 6 for six napkins through ASHA workers.

faqs.question: Is there any application procedure to get free sanitary napkins under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the school takes care of the distribution of the sanitary pads to the girls, no application is needed for this.

faqs.question: How do they keep track of the stocks and distribution and ensure proper monitoring of this scheme?
faqs.answer: To address that, an app called "Khushi" has been created which helps them monitor and keep track of this scheme.

name: Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram
description: A scheme by Ministry of MoHFW for pregnant women who access government health facilities for their delivery. to absolutely free and no expense delivery, including caesarean section. Essential care is provided to the mother and her neonate within 48 hours. Reasons like high out of pocket expenditure ondiagnostics/investigations, blood, drugs, food and user charges institutional delivery JSSK was launched in June 2011 to eliminate out-of-pocket expenses for institutional delivery of pregnant women and treatment of sick infants. In 2014, the programme was extended to all antenatal & postnatal complications of pregnancy and similar entitlements have been put in place for all sick newborns and infants (up to one year of age) accessing public health institutions for treatment.
benefits: For pregnant women-Free and cashless deliveryFree C-SectionFree drugs and consumablesFree diagnosticsFree diet during stay in the health institutionsFree provision of bloodExemption from user chargesFree transport from home to health institutionsFree transport between facilities in case of referralFree drop back from Institutions to home after 48hrs stay﻿For sick newborns till 30 days after birth (now been expanded to also cover sick infants) - Free treatmentFree drugs and consumablesFree diagnosticsFree provision of bloodExemption from user chargesFree Transport from Home to Health InstitutionsFree Transport between facilities in case of referralFree drop Back from Institutions to home
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a pregnant woman.The applicant must be admitted in a government health facility.
required_documents: Aadhaar NumberAddress proofDomicile certificateRation cardJanani Suraksha Card

faqs.question: What medicines / consumables for a sick newborn provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The complete list of the medicines / consumables can be found in Annexure-II of the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: Which tests are covered under free diagnostics?
faqs.answer: Blood, Urine Tests and Ultrasonography etc.

faqs.question: For how many days will the pregnant women be provided free diet?
faqs.answer: 3 days for normal delivery and 7 days for C-section.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: I am expecting twins, am I also eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, you are eligible to avail the benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: I was admitted into the public health facility when I was eight months into pregnancy. Does it in any affect way to my entitlements under this scheme?
faqs.answer: You are equally eligible to receive the benefits in this scheme.

faqs.question: I am expecting twins, am I also eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, you are eligible to avail the benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the Maternity Benefit Scheme for Female Workers?
faqs.answer: The Maternity Benefit Scheme provides financial assistance to eligible registered female construction workers during maternity. It can be availed up to two times in a worker’s lifetime.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: How many times can a worker avail the Maternity Benefit?
faqs.answer: A registered female worker can avail the Maternity Benefit up to two times in her lifetime.

faqs.question: What is the amount provided under the Maternity Benefit Scheme?
faqs.answer: The financial benefit amount may vary based on state policies. You can check the exact benefit amount on the JKBOCWWB website or contact the board.

faqs.question: How do I register as a construction worker under JKBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: To register, visit the official JKBOCWWB website, apply through the "Labour Registration" section, and follow the steps to fill out your details, upload documents, and submit the form online.

faqs.question: What documents are required for registration as a construction worker?
faqs.answer: Documents like Aadhaar Card, proof of residence, bank passbook, passport-size photograph, age certificate, and employment certificate are needed for registration.

faqs.question: Can I apply for multiple welfare schemes under JKBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Yes, registered construction workers can apply for multiple welfare schemes, including maternity benefits, medical assistance, and education assistance, as long as they meet the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: How can I apply for welfare schemes under JKBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Log in to your account on the JKBOCWWB website, click on "Scheme Registration," select the scheme you wish to apply for, fill in the required information, upload documents, and submit your application.

name: Grant of Financial Assistance to Poor Scheduled Caste Pregnant & Lactating Women
description: The scheme “Grant of Financial Assistance to Poor Scheduled Caste Pregnant & Lactating Women” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry. The objective of the scheme is to provide assistance for the well-being of Pregnant and Lactating mothers and their children.
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹12
000/- as follows:The pre-natal assistance shall be ₹ 2
000 in cash per month for three months prior to the month of delivery.The post-natal assistance shall be ₹ 2
000 in cash per month for three months following delivery. * The grant of financial assistance is made available only for 2 deliveries.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should belong to the Union Territory of Pondicherry by virtue of birth or continuous residence of not less than 3 years.The applicant should be from Scheduled Caste.The applicant should be a woman.The applicant should be pregnant.The applicant should apply from 6 months of pregnancy and within 3 months from the date of delivery.The annual income of the applicant and spouse should not exceed ₹ 2
000/-.The grant of financial assistance is made available only for 2 deliveries.
required_documents: Residence-cum-nativity Certificate.Aadhaar Card.Caste Certificate.Recent passport-size photograph.Discharge Summary/ Birth Certificate.Certificate Issued by the Medical Superintendent of Maternity Hospital/Medical Officer in-charge of the Primary Health Centre
Sub-centre or Any Other Peripheral Maternity/Health Centre of the Union Territory of Pondicherry. Ration Card.Bank Passbook.

faqs.question: Can non-Scheduled Caste individuals apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is specifically designed for individuals belonging to the Scheduled Caste.

faqs.question: What department within the Government of Puducherry oversees the implementation of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry, is responsible for the implementation and management of the scheme.

faqs.question: What role does the annual income of the applicant and spouse play in determining eligibility?
faqs.answer: To qualify for the scheme, the combined annual income of the applicant and spouse should not exceed ₹2,00,000.

faqs.question: Is continuous residence in the Union Territory of Pondicherry a mandatory criterion?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants need to have continuous residence in the Union Territory of Pondicherry for a minimum of 3 years to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the division of financial assistance during the prenatal and postnatal periods?
faqs.answer: The scheme allocates ₹2,000 in cash per month for three months before delivery as prenatal assistance and ₹2,000 in cash per month for three months after delivery as postnatal assistance.

faqs.question: When should applicants ideally apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants should apply within 6 months of pregnancy and up to 3 months from the date of delivery to be eligible for the financial assistance.

faqs.question: Can the financial assistance be availed for more than two deliveries?
faqs.answer: No, the financial assistance is restricted to a maximum of 2 deliveries per eligible beneficiary.

faqs.question: What are the specific financial benefits offered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a financial assistance of ₹12,000 in cash, distributed as ₹2,000 per month for three months prior to delivery and ₹2,000 per month for three months post-delivery, for a maximum of 2 deliveries.

faqs.question: Who introduced the scheme "Grant of Financial Assistance to Poor Scheduled Caste Pregnant & Lactating Women," and what is its primary objective?
faqs.answer: The scheme was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry, with the aim of providing assistance for the well-being of Pregnant and Lactating mothers and their children.

faqs.question: Are there any specific provisions for persons with disabilities under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No provisions for persons with disabilities are mentioned in the guidelines of this scheme.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States/UTs Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, this scheme is exclusively available to permanent residents of the Puducherry. Applicants from neighboring States/UTs, among others, are not eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: The guidelines do not mention any provision for compensation in the event of delayed disbursement of scheme benefits. Applicants should note that compensation for delays is not part of the scheme's framework.

name: Maternity Benefit (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The “Maternity Benefit” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall provide financial assistance in the form of maternity benefits to the female beneficiaries subject to a maximum of two children who are registered beneficiaries for a period of more than one year under the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.﻿
benefits: Quantum of Assistance: ₹8
000/- per Child.For eligible beneficiaries under “Mamata” being implemented by W&CD Department: ₹15
000/- under OB&OCWW Board and ₹5
000/- under “Mamata”).Note: Assistance shall be given for a maximum of two children.﻿
eligibility_criteria: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:The applicant should be a resident of Odisha.The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:The applicant should be female.The applicant should be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The applicant should be registered for a period of one year or more under the board.The applicant should be pregnant.
required_documents: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:Aadhaar Linked Bank Passbook Front Page Copy (Allowed file types: PNG
JPG
PDF. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).Passport Size Photo (Allowed type: PNG
JPG. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).Aadhaar Card (Allowed file types: PNG
JPG
PDF. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).Signature of Applicant (Allowed type: PNG
JPG. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).Employment certificate (Allowed file types: PNG
JPG

PDF. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:Registration ID card of the member.Proof of deposit of annual contribution of the member.Medical Certificate.Any other documents if required.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for registration as a beneficiary under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Odisha?
faqs.answer: The building worker must be at least 18 years old and not older than 60 years old.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors are acting as Registering Officers for the registration of beneficiaries under the Board.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Every building worker who is between the age of 18-60 years and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than 90 days during the preceding one year is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board of Odisha.

faqs.question: Can Odia migrant workmen be registered as beneficiaries under the Odisha Building & Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, Odia migrant workmen engaged in building and other construction works in other states can be registered as beneficiaries under the Odisha Building & Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for the registration?
faqs.answer:
To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download Form-XXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (self attested, if required) and a fee of ₹20/- to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.
Alternatively, registration can also be done through the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board: https://nirmanshramik.odisha.gov.in/obocwwb/public/cwLogin .

faqs.question: Is there a specific form for the registration through offline mode as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application for registration must be made in Form-XXVII. You can obtain this form from the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors in your area.

faqs.question: How much is the fee associated with the registration process?
faqs.answer: The registration fee is ₹20/- which is payable during the registration.

faqs.question: What happens after I pay the application fee?
faqs.answer: After you pay the application fee of  ₹20/-, your application will be reviewed by the registering officer. The decision to approve or reject your application will be based on the merits of your application.

faqs.question: Who decides whether my application will be approved or rejected?
faqs.answer: The registering officer is responsible for deciding whether your application will be approved or rejected based on its merits.

faqs.question: Can my application be rejected even if I have paid the application fee?
faqs.answer: Yes, your application can be rejected even if you have paid the application fee. The final decision is made by the registering officer based on the merits of your application.

faqs.question: How much is the fee associated with the renewal of the registration?
faqs.answer: The renewal fee is ₹50/- which is payable during the renewal process of the registration.

faqs.question: What criteria must an applicant meet to be considered for this benefit?
faqs.answer: Female beneficiaries who are registered under the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board for a period of more than one year are eligible for this benefit and for up to two children.

faqs.question: What kind of assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance provided under this scheme ranges from ₹8,000/- to ₹10,000/- per child.

faqs.question: How many children of a member can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers a maximum of two children per eligible female beneficiary.

faqs.question: What form needs to be used to apply for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: The application must be made in the prescribed Form-XLI. The form can be downloaded from https://bocboard.labdirodisha.gov.in/Building/homecontent/BeneficiaryForms/MATERNITY%20BENEFIT%20FORM.pdf or can be collected from the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.

faqs.question: Where do I submit the application for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Application can be submitted online on: https://nirmanshramik.odisha.gov.in/obocwwb/public/cwLogin . Alternatively , the offline application for this welfare scheme should be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors in your area.

faqs.question: What happens if the application is rejected?
faqs.answer: In case of rejection, the applicants would be intimated about such rejection, with due intimation to the Board.

faqs.question: What are the consequences of submitting fraudulent documents for assistance?
faqs.answer: In case of receipt of assistance on the basis of fraudulent documents, the amount released towards any assistance would be recovered from the applicant under the provisions of the OPDR Act, and his/ her membership would be ceased.

name: Financial Incentives To Mothers Who Deliver A Girl Child (Mamta)
description: The scheme "Financial Incentives to Mothers who Deliver a Girl Child (Mamta)" is a scheme of Financial Assistance by the Directorate of Women And Child Development, Govt. of Goa. The objective of the Mamta Scheme is aimed at improving the Female Child Sex Ratio in the State. The scheme is open to all mothers who deliver a live Girl Child (max. 02 deliveries) in a registered medical institution. ﻿Implementing AgencyThe scheme shall be implemented through the ICDS i.e. Child Development Project Officer, Mukhya Sevikas, and Anganwadi Worker at Taluka/Block Level and Viliage Level respectively.
benefits: 000/- as a one-time financial incentive (at the birth of the child).Those beneficiaries who had applied for the 1st Installment of ₹ 5
000/- (as on the date of this Amended Scheme published in the Official Gazette) shall be eligible for ₹ 10
000/- as per the amended scheme.﻿NOTE 1: Those beneficiaries who were paid the 1st Installment of ₹ 5
000/- under the existing scheme shall be eligible for only the balance amount (2nd instalment) of ₹ 5
000/- (to apply within 45 days from the date of the Amended Scheme published in the official Gazette).﻿Mode of DisbursalThe benefits are directly credited to the declared Bank Account.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a mother who has delivered a live Girl Child in a registered medical institution.The applicant should be a resident of Goa for at least three years. ORThe applicant should be married to a resident of Goa.The application for the scheme should have been made within 45 days of the delivery.NOTE: The scheme is available to all mothers
irrespective of their social/economic status.
required_documents: Certified/Self-Attested Copy of Aadhaar Card.Certified/Self-Attested Copy of Birth Report/Certificate from Registered Institution.Proof that the Applicant (the Mother) has been a Resident of Goa for at least 3 years OR Proof that the Applicant (the Mother) has been married to a resident of Goa (Marriage Certificate

and Residential Certificate of Husband).Pre-Receipt in duplicate (Annexure-2) (For New Beneficiaries).Pre-receipt in duplicate in (Annexure-3) (for those beneficiaries who were paid the 1st Installment under the old Scheme).

faqs.question: How Are The Financial Incentives Paid To The Beneficiaries Under The "MAMTA" Scheme, And What Verification Process Is Followed?
faqs.answer: The financial incentives are paid to the beneficiaries through various electronic systems like ECS, NEFT, APBS, or ACH. Accounts are opened in nationalized banks for the expected mothers. Verification is conducted to ensure funds availability and legitimacy of the applicants.

faqs.question: Can You Explain The Declaration Process For Beneficiaries Who Have Received The 1st Installment Under The "MAMTA" Scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries who have received the 1st installment of Rs. 5000 are eligible for the balance amount (2nd installment) of Rs. 5000. They need to sign a declaration stating their eligibility and consent to repay any excess amount with interest if mistakenly paid.

faqs.question: What Are The Details Required In The Application Form For The "MAMTA" Scheme?
faqs.answer: The application form for "MAMTA" requires information such as the mother's name, age, residential address, contact number, bank account details, caste, religion, delivery date, weight of the girl child at birth, among other particulars.

faqs.question: Can You Elaborate On The Role Of The Anganwadi Centre In The "MAMTA" Scheme Application Process?
faqs.answer: The application form includes the name of the Anganwadi Centre where the beneficiary's child is registered, which likely serves as a reference point for the authorities.

faqs.question: How Does The "MAMTA" Scheme Ensure That Financial Incentives Reach The Beneficiaries Promptly?
faqs.answer: By preparing lists of expected mothers beforehand and maintaining detailed records, the scheme facilitates swift sanction and payment of financial incentives, ensuring timely assistance to beneficiaries.

faqs.question: What Steps Are Taken By The Government To Inform Beneficiaries About Any Amendments Or Modifications To The "MAMTA" Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Government makes the amended "MAMTA" scheme effective from a specified date, usually communicated through official notifications or public announcements to inform beneficiaries of any changes.

faqs.question: Can You Elaborate On The Purpose Of The Detailed Record-Keeping By Child Development Project Officers In The "MAMTA" Scheme?
faqs.answer: Maintaining detailed records of applications, payments, and beneficiary information helps track the progress of the scheme, monitor its impact, and ensure transparency and accountability in the implementation process.

faqs.question: Can You Provide Examples Of Other Children's Details That Applicants Need To Furnish In The "MAMTA" Scheme Application Form?
faqs.answer: The application form may require details such as the names, ages, and genders of other children in the household to assess the family's circumstances and needs.

faqs.question: Can You Clarify What Is Meant By A _Registered Medical Institution_ In The Eligibility Criteria For The _MAMTA_ Scheme
faqs.answer: A "registered medical institution" refers to a medical facility that is officially recognized and authorized by the relevant health authorities or government to provide medical services and carry out deliveries.

name: Thayi Bhagya Scheme(comprehensive Maternal Healthcare)
description: The scheme has been designed so that women belonging to BPL families can avail totally cashless treatment in these private hospitals.Under this scheme, the pregnant woman belonging to BPL family can avail delivery services free of cost in the registered private hospital near her house. She is not required to pay any charges right from the point of admission to discharge. The benefit is limited to the first two live deliveries.The beneficiaries are identified through the ANC cards issued to them.The scheme has been introduced in the six "C" category districts of Gulbarga, Bidar, Raichur, Koppal, Bijapur and Bagalkot and the backward district Chamarajanagar.﻿i. Shortage of specialist doctors, especially the gynecologists, anesthetists and pediatricians at Taluk hospitals and CHCs, The posts of these specialists are mostly vacant in Government Hospitals.ii. Though there are very large number of government health care institutions in the state, the shortage of these specialists is a big draw back in providing proper maternal and child health care.iii.There are considerable number of specialist doctors in urban private hospitals.iv. By entering into Public-Private partnership with these hospitals, rural women can be provided with facilities for proper institutional deliveries.﻿The hospitals having requisite facilities will be registered under the programme with the approval of District Health Society. The Hospitals will then sign an MOU with the Department. Government Hospitals can also participate in this scheme.﻿Such registered hospitals will be paid Rs. 3.00 lakhs per 100 deliveries, which include normal delivery, complicated deliveries, caesarian, forceps deliveries etc. These hospitals will be paid 10% ie., Rs.30,000 advance on participation in the scheme. This is to encourage more and more private hospitals to participate in the programme.The Government Hospitals will be paid Rs. 1.50 lakhs for every 100 deliveries, out of which 50,000 goes to the Health Care Committee and the remaining is shared among the Hospital doctors, nurses and staff as per Yeshaswini guidelines.​﻿﻿
benefits: The scheme provides benefits in the form of delivery services free of costs and others. Women belonging to BPL families can avail totally cashless treatment in theses private hospitals or can avail delivery services free of cost in the registered private hospital near her house.Registered private hospital will be available near her house.Candidate is not required to pay any charges right from the point of admission to discharge.Free checkup and medicines will be provided.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The benefit is limited to the first two deliveries.The candidate women must be residents of Karnataka governmentThe hospital should have minimum 10 inpatient beds.Should have proper functional Operation Theater and Delivery room.24 hrs availability of gynecologists

anesthetists and pediatricians.Should have link with Blood banks.The DHO has to identify such hospitals and invite them for partnership. Interested hospitals can sign the MOU.﻿﻿Such registered hospitals will be paid Rs. 3.00 lakhs per 100 deliveries
which include normal delivery
complicated deliveries
caesarean
forceps deliveries etc. These hospitals will be paid 10% ie.
Rs.30

000 advance on participation in the scheme. This is to encourage more and more private hospitals to participate in the program.The Government Hospitals will be paid Rs. 1.50 lakhs for every 100 deliveries
out of which 50
000 goes to the Health Care Committee and the remaining is shared among the Hospital doctors
nurses and staff as per Yeshaswini guidelines.​
required_documents: Domicile certificateBPL card or Ration cardCaste certificateAadhar CardANC registration number along with noting whether it is first or second delivery﻿﻿

faqs.question: Who is the Thayi Bhagya Scheme for?
faqs.answer: Pregnant women belonging from BPL family.

faqs.question: Which type of help the government provides in this Scheme?
faqs.answer: Benefits in the form of delivery services free of costs and others.

faqs.question: How many kids can a woman avail of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefit is limited to the first two deliveries.

faqs.question: Are there any other benefits than free delivery?
faqs.answer: Free checkups and medicines will be provided.

faqs.question: What facilities will be provided by the hospital?
faqs.answer: The registered hospital will have proper functional Operation Theater and Delivery room, 24 hrs availability of gynecologists, anesthetists and pediatricians.

faqs.question: Is the application process online?
faqs.answer: No

faqs.question: Whom to approach for applying to this scheme?
faqs.answer: The pregnant women will have to register their names with the Junior Female Health Assistant of the area.

name: Women In Science and Engineering-Societal Challenges with Opportunities Fellowship
description: The “Women In Science and Engineering-Societal Challenges with Opportunities (WISE-SCOPE) Fellowship” Program was started by the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India to provide opportunities to Women Scientists and Technologists who have completed Ph.D. and want to utilize their Science & Technology knowledge and expertise for the benefit of society. This program promotes projects that directly deal with challenges at the grassroots level and address them through Science & Technology interventions. Projects under WISE-SCOPE (WISE-Societal Challenges with Opportunities) should provide Science & Technology solutions to our social problems, livelihood generation, drudgery reduction, health and nutrition-related issues, management of natural resources, sustainable agriculture, climate change, disaster management, etc. The project proposal should include the development of viable technology/technique with the possibility of lab-to-land transfer, adaptation and scaling up for the benefit of society under the following identified broad thematic areas.Energy, Water and Waste Management (EWWM)Engineering and Technology Development (ETD)Environment, Climate and Sustainable Development (ECSD)Agriculture and Allied Sciences (AAS)Health, Food, and Nutrition (HFN)Project Tenure: The project tenure shall be up to 3 years.
benefits: Under this Program
a fellowship amount of ₹55
000/- and HRA (as per norms) per month will be given to the eligible candidates.The selected fellow will also be eligible for a Research Grant of ₹2.00 Lakhs per year
a Field Demonstration
etc. of ₹1.00 Lakh (for project tenure)
and the cost of small equipment (up to a maximum of ₹2.00 Lakhs) along with Institutional overhead charges as per DST norms.
eligibility_criteria: Employment:Candidates in regular employment are not eligible for WISE-SCOPE.Note 01: The women scientists who are temporarily employed in research or academics may apply to this program but they have to leave earlier assignments
if
selected for the WISE-SCOPE program.Note 02: The position of the applicant in any project
as Post-Doctoral Fellow
Research Associate

etc. will be considered a temporary assignment.Age:The minimum age to apply is 27 years and the maximum is 60 years as of the date of submission.Educational Qualification:Women Scientists who have completed a Ph.D. in Basic or Applied Sciences or have equivalent degrees like MD/MS/MDS are eligible for the WISE-SCOPE fellowship.
required_documents: 1.	CV of Mentor2.	Conflict of Interest Policy Document3.	Endorsement from the Head of the Institute4.	Complete Project Proposal5.	Highest Degree Certificate6.	Consent Letter from Mentor7.	Undertaking8.	HRA declaration certificate9.	Date of Birth Proof

faqs.question: What is the aim of this program?
faqs.answer: The aim of the program is to provide opportunities to Women Scientists and Technologists who have completed Ph.D. and want to utilize their Science & Technology knowledge and expertise for the benefit of society.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this program?
faqs.answer: Department of Science & Technology, Government of India

faqs.question: Who can apply for the Fellowship?
faqs.answer: Women Scientists who have completed a Ph.D. in Basic or Applied Sciences or have equivalent degrees like MD/MS/MDS are eligible for the WISE-SCOPE fellowship.

faqs.question: What are the thematic areas covered under this Fellowship?
faqs.answer:
1. Energy, Water and Waste Management (EWWM)
2.	Engineering and Technology Development (ETD)
3.	Environment, Climate and Sustainable Development (ECSD)
4.	Agriculture and Allied Sciences (AAS)
5.	Health, Food, and Nutrition (HFN)

faqs.question: What is the nature of support for the Fellow?
faqs.answer:
1. Under this Program, a fellowship amount of ₹55,000/- and HRA (as per norms) per month will be given to the eligible candidates.
2.	The selected fellow will also be eligible for a Research Grant of ₹2.00 Lakhs per year, a Field Demonstration, etc. of ₹1.00 Lakh (for project tenure), and the cost of small equipment (up to a maximum of ₹2.00 Lakhs) along with Institutional overhead charges as per DST norms.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion to apply under the program?
faqs.answer: The minimum age to apply is 27 years and the maximum is 60 years as of the date of submission.

faqs.question: Can a candidate having regular employment apply under the program?
faqs.answer: No, the candidates in regular employment are not eligible for WISE-SCOPE fellowship.

faqs.question: What shall be tenure of the project?
faqs.answer: The project tenure shall be up to 3 years.

faqs.question: Can a woman scientist who is temporarily employed apply to this program?
faqs.answer: Yes, the women scientists who are temporarily employed in research or academics may apply to this program but they have to leave earlier assignments, if, selected for the WISE-SCOPE program.

faqs.question: What is the last date for receipt of Application?
faqs.answer: The online Application portal is open throughout the year for proposal submission.

faqs.question: How to apply under the program?
faqs.answer: The call is open for proposal submission under WISE-SCOPE at ePMS (https://onlinedst.gov.in).

name: Indo-French Visiting/Mobility Programme for Women in Science
description: The “Indo-French Visiting/Mobility Programme for Women in Science (PROWIS-II)” is dedicated to the young women scientists of both India and France. This programme will encourage women candidates to work with the Indian/French scientific communities with an aim to accelerate their talented instincts towards carrying out advanced studies and research in the frontier areas of Science & Technology.Duration of Programme:The duration of the Programme will be for two weeks.
benefits: Return airfare (economy class)
accommodation & per diem allowances
local travel in India/France
airport transfer
insurance
and visa charges shall be given to the selected candidates.
eligibility_criteria: Women applicants must be Indian or French citizens (citizens residing in France) from a recognized university or research institution in India/France.Indian applicants should hold a PhD degree & sanctioned/tenured post in a scientific/academic institution and be willing to undertake collaborative research projects in French institutions/universities.French women applicants holding a PhD degree and currently completing a postdoctoral project & willing to undertake collaborative research projects in Indian institutions/universities.The mobility should take place during the employment period of the applicant in the concerned institution.The applicant should not have availed of any visiting fellowship in France/India during the last 5 years.This fellowship cannot be availed simultaneously with any other fellowship.Note 01: Preference will be given to those candidates who don't have any international exposure.Note 02: CEFIPRA may relax the eligibility conditions in case of potential candidates.
required_documents: 1.	Invitation/hosting letter from Indian/French scientist/researcher/faculty/institution2.	Visiting proposal under the STEM and allied S&T areas (one page)3.	No objection certificate from the employer4.	Recent Photograph5.	Passport6.	Educational Certificates7.	Any other document
as required

faqs.question: What is the aim of Programme?
faqs.answer: This programme will encourage women candidates to work with the Indian/French scientific communities with an aim to accelerate their talented instincts towards carrying out advanced studies and research in the frontier areas of Science & Technology.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this Programme?
faqs.answer: Indo-French Centre for Promotion of Advanced Research/Centre Franco-Indien pour la Promotion de la Recherche Avancée

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for applying the Programme?
faqs.answer:
•	Indian applicants should hold a PhD degree & sanctioned/tenured post in a scientific/academic institution and be willing to undertake collaborative research projects in French institutions/universities.
•	French women applicants holding a PhD degree and currently completing a postdoctoral project & willing to undertake collaborative research projects in Indian institutions/universities.

faqs.question: Who is not eligible to apply under the Programme?
faqs.answer: The applicant who has availed of any Postdoctoral fellowship in France/India during the last 5 years is not eligible to apply under the programme.

faqs.question: Who will get the preference under this programme?
faqs.answer:
•	Preference will be given to those candidates who don't have any international exposure.
•	CEFIPRA may relax the eligibility conditions in case of potential candidates.

faqs.question: What are the natures of supports provided to the fellows under the programme?
faqs.answer: Return airfare (economy class), accommodation & per diem allowances, local travel in India/France, airport transfer, insurance, and visa charges shall be given to the selected candidates.

faqs.question: What is the duration of programme?
faqs.answer: The duration of the programme will be for a period of two weeks.

faqs.question: How to apply for the fellowship?
faqs.answer: The eligible candidates need to register and apply at https://www.cefipra.org/ or log on to: https://cefipra.org/prowiss/

name: Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa - Vulnerable Women
description: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa - Vulnerable Women" was launched by the Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education, Government of Tripura. The scheme provides a monthly pension of ₹2,000/- to the vulnerable women, such as Widows, Deserted Women, Unmarried Women, and also to the women who are in need of special care, support or protection because of their age, disability or risk of abuse or neglect.
benefits: Pension Amount: ₹2000/- per month.Mode of Disbursal: The sanctioned grant will be transferred directly to the individual bank account of the applicant.The list of beneficiaries will be made available on the official website of the Social Welfare & Social Education Department
Govt. of Tripura.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Tripura.The annual income of the family of the applicant should not exceed ₹1
000/-.The age of the applicant should be between 18 to 59 years.In the case of unmarried women
the age should be 45 years or above.If the family has children in the age group of 6 to 14 years

those children must be enrolled in a school recognized by the Government of Tripura.NOTE: The assistance under this scheme will be stopped in the following cases:1.   Death of Beneficiary.2.   Fulfillment of any exclusion criteria during the lifetime of the beneficiary:Remarriage of a widow.A member of the family of the beneficiary getting a government Job.The annual family income of the beneficiary exceeding ₹1
required_documents: Income Certificate from SDM (Sub Divisional Magistrate).Age Proof Certificate (Birth Certificate/ School Certificate/ Madhyamik Admit).Aadhaar Card.Permanent Resident of Tripura Certificate (PRTC).Ration Card (Issued by the Food & Civil Supplies Department).Death Certificate of husband (In case of claiming pension under "Widow" sub-category)Divorced Certificate issued by the Court (In case of Divorced Women Under "Deserted Women" for claiming pension)Un-Married Women Certificate from Gram Panchayat (GP)/Nagar Panchayat (NP)/AMC/Village Committee (VC) Chairman in case of claiming pension under the "Unmarried Women" sub-category.﻿﻿Non-Government Employee Certificate from Panchayat Secretary/Ward Secretary/Gazetted Officer.After Selection:Life Certificate & Income Certificate are to be submitted to the CDPO in November every year.﻿

faqs.question: Who launched the "Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa-Vulnerable Women" scheme?
faqs.answer: The "Mukhyamantri Samajik Sahayata Prakalpa- Vulnerable Women" scheme was launched by the Education (Social Welfare & Social Education) Department Agartala, Government of Tripura.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide substantial financial benefits and support to vulnerable women in Tripura who require special care, protection, or assistance due to age, disability, or risk of abuse or neglect.

faqs.question: How much is a monthly pension provided to vulnerable women?
faqs.answer: The pension amount provided to beneficiaries is ₹2000/- per month.

faqs.question: How often is the financial assistance disbursed?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance is disbursed on a monthly basis.

faqs.question: How will the sanctioned grant be disbursed to beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The sanctioned grant will be transferred directly to the individual bank account of the applicant.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to receive financial assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible individuals include vulnerable women (Widow, Deserted Women, Unmarried Women) in Tripura.

faqs.question: Can women from other states apply for assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the annual income of the family should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Can I still receive benefits under this scheme if I remarry after being widowed or divorced?
faqs.answer: No.

faqs.question: Where can the beneficiaries check the list of beneficiaries for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The list of beneficiaries is available on the official website of the Social Welfare & Social Education Department, Govt. of Tripura.

faqs.question: Are there any specific criteria for children in the family to be eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Children in the age group of 6 to 14 years must be enrolled in a school recognized by the Government of Tripura for the family to be eligible.

faqs.question: How often should the Life Certificate and Income Certificate be submitted after selection?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries need to submit the Life Certificate & Income Certificate to the CDPO in November every year after selection.

faqs.question: What is the maximum annual income limit for the family of the applicant?
faqs.answer: The annual income of the applicant's family should not exceed ₹1,00,000.

name: Maternity Assistance Scheme- Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
description: The “Maternity Assistance Scheme” was launched by the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board, Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat. Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to female workers and the wives of workers to cover expenses incurred for health check-ups, medicine, nutritious diet, etc., during the maternity period.
benefits: Under this scheme
financial assistance of ₹10
000/- is provided to female workers and the wives of workers to cover expenses incurred during the maternity period.
eligibility_criteria: The workers who are working in the organized sector in the state of Gujarat will be eligible to get the benefit of this scheme.The workers should have been working continuously with the Factory/Company/Organization for one year and his/her Labour Welfare Fund should have been deposited in the board.Application has to be made within 1 (one) year from the date of delivery.The benefit of this scheme is available to either female workers or the wives of workers for only one delivery.Note: Assistance will not be provided if there is a change in the name of the pregnant woman mentioned in the birth certificate/document and the name of the pregnant woman mentioned in the bank passbook.
required_documents: 1.	Passport-size Photograph2.	A copy of the identity card issued by the contractor to the worker/labour3.	Aadhaar Card of Labour4.	Labour Welfare Fund Account Number5.	Proof of pregnancy/Medical report6.	Birth certificate of child7.	Aadhaar card of the beneficiary8.	Bonafide certificate﻿9.	Bank account details/Bank Passbook 10.	Any other documents as required

faqs.question: Who is eligible to receive benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Workers employed in the organized sector in the state of Gujarat are eligible for benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any specific requirements for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, eligible workers must have worked continuously with the Factory/Company/Organization for at least one year, and their Labour Welfare Fund should have been deposited with the board.

faqs.question: When should the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: Applications must be submitted within one year from the date of delivery to avail of the benefits.

faqs.question: Is the benefit limited to only one delivery?
faqs.answer: Yes, the benefit of the scheme is available for only one delivery per eligible worker or their spouse.

faqs.question: What happens if there is a change in the name mentioned in the documents?
faqs.answer: Assistance will not be provided if there is a discrepancy between the name of the pregnant woman mentioned in the birth certificate/document and the name in the bank passbook.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A financial assistance of ₹10,000/- is provided to cover expenses incurred during the maternity period.

faqs.question: What expenses are covered by the financial assistance?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance covers expenses related to health check-ups, medicine, nutritious diet, and other maternity-related costs.

faqs.question: Where can I apply for the scheme benefit?
faqs.answer: You can apply for the scheme benefit through the Sanman Portal at https://sanman.gujarat.gov.in/.

name: Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana- Madhya Pradesh
description: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana" was started by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh in 2006. The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance for the mass marriage of girls, widows, and abandoned women from destitute or poor families in the state.
benefits: Under this scheme
the following assistance is provided:Each eligible bride (including girls
widows
or abandoned women) participating in the mass marriage ceremony will receive a total of ₹49
000/- through an Account Payee Cheque
on the day of the mass marriage ceremony.The organizing body that conducts the mass marriage ceremony will receive ₹6
000/- per beneficiary.Note: A total of ₹55
000/- is provided per beneficiary under the scheme.
eligibility_criteria: The parents of the bride/groom should be natives of Madhya Pradesh.Financial assistance will be provided to girls
widows
and abandoned women from destitute or poor families in the state at the time of their marriage.The bride should be at least 18 years old
and the groom should be at least 21 years old.The applicant should belong to the General
Other Backward Class
Scheduled Caste

or Scheduled Tribe category.There are no income restrictions for receiving assistance under the scheme.The bride and groom should participate in the mass marriage ceremony organized on the prescribed dates.The benefit of this scheme will not be available for single marriage ceremonies.Note 1: Abandoned women who have been legally divorced are only eligible under the scheme.Note 2: If the groom is from outside the state
the bride will still be eligible for the benefits of the scheme. However
if the parents of either the bride/groom are not natives of the state

the benefits under the scheme will not be available.Note 3: The bride should not have been previously married. This means that the marriage of the bride and groom must take place solely during a mass marriage ceremony organized under the scheme

and they should not have been married through a single or any other mass marriage ceremony before.Note 4: A mass marriage ceremony will be organized only if applications are received from a minimum of 5 couples.
required_documents: 1.	Certificate proving that the bride or groom's guardian is a native of Madhya Pradesh.2.	Samagra ID. If the composite ID is not available
it will be provided by the concerned authority where the applicant resides. If the groom is not a resident of Madhya Pradesh

the Samagra ID will not be mandatory.3.	Photocopies of Aadhaar cards for both the bride and groom.4.	Age certificates for both the bride and groom.
