One of the following documents should be provided:•	School Certificate (TC)•	Marksheet with date of birth•	Birth certificate issued by a competent authority•	Voter list or voting identity card showing age or date of birth•	Age certificate issued by a government medical expert•	Job Card from the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme•	Other legally acceptable documents to prove age5.	Two passport-sized photographs of both the bride and groom.6.	Mobile numbers for both the bride and groom (if available).7.	Mobile number of the bride's or groom's parents (if available).8.	For widows (Kalyanis)
the death certificate of the husband.9.	For abandoned women
the court order for legal divorce.10.	If the beneficiary is a registered laborer under the Madhya Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

a photocopy of the labor registration card is required. This is necessary because the amount spent on a maximum of 2 daughters of such registered laborers will be obtained from the Madhya Pradesh Building and Construction Workers Welfare Board.11.	Any other documents as required.

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Each eligible bride (including girls, widows, or abandoned women) participating in the mass marriage ceremony will receive ₹49,000/- through an Account Payee Cheque on the day of the ceremony. The organizing body will receive ₹6,000/- per beneficiary. A total of ₹55,000/- is provided per beneficiary under the scheme.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants must be natives of Madhya Pradesh, belong to the General, Other Backward Class, Scheduled Caste, or Scheduled Tribe categories, and be from destitute or poor families. The bride should be at least 18 years old, and the groom must be at least 21 years old.

faqs.question: Are there any income restrictions for receiving assistance?
faqs.answer: No, there are no income restrictions for receiving benefits under the Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivah Yojana.

faqs.question: Can the scheme be availed for single marriage ceremonies?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme only applies to mass marriage ceremonies organized on prescribed dates. Single marriage ceremonies are not eligible for benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: What are the requirements for the bride and groom regarding their previous marital status?
faqs.answer: The bride should not have been previously married. The marriage must occur during a mass marriage ceremony organized under the scheme.

faqs.question: What happens if the groom is from outside Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The bride will still be eligible for benefits if the groom is from outside the state. However, if either the bride's/groom's parents are not natives of Madhya Pradesh, the benefits under the scheme will not be available.

faqs.question: What should the bride and groom do to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bride and groom must jointly apply in the prescribed form to the concerned body (Municipal Corporation, Municipality, City Council, or District Panchayat) 15 days before the scheduled date of the mass marriage ceremony.

faqs.question: What if an application under the scheme is rejected?
faqs.answer: If an application is rejected, the appeal can be submitted to the concerned Sub-Divisional Revenue Officer. Appeals will be resolved within 30 days.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for organizing the mass marriage ceremonies?
faqs.answer: In urban areas, the mass marriage ceremonies are organized by the Urban Body (Municipal Corporation, Municipality, or Municipal Council). In rural areas, the District Panchayat is responsible.

faqs.question: What is the minimum number of couples required for a mass marriage ceremony to be organized?
faqs.answer: A minimum of 5 couples must apply for a mass marriage ceremony to be organized.

faqs.question: How are the dates and number of mass marriages determined?
faqs.answer: The dates and number of mass marriages are determined by the minister in charge of the district. These dates are entered on the marriage portal by the District's Joint/Deputy Director, Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department.

faqs.question: Is there a specific form required for application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the bride and groom must jointly apply using the prescribed form provided by the concerned body.

name: Balika Samrithi Yojana
description: The scheme “Balika Samrithi Yojana” by the Department of Women & Child Development, Government of Pondicherry was introduced to improve the status of the girl child and provide nutritious food to the girl child. Through this scheme, assistance of ₹500 in the form of a National Savings Certificate is provided to lactating mothers. The target beneficiaries are girl children born on or after 15-8-97.
benefits: Assistance of ₹500 in the form of a National Savings Certificate.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a girl child born on or after 15-8-97.The annual income of the family of the applicant should not exceed ₹15
000.The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should be a native of the Union Territory of Pondicherry by birth or continuous residence for not less than 3 years.
required_documents: 1. Aadhaar Card.2. Residence Certificate from the Revenue Department.3. Income Certificate from the Revenue Department.4. Passport-sized Photograph.5. Declaration/Undertaking (if any).6. Birth Certificate from the Municipality/Commune.﻿In the absence of an Aadhaar Card; the applicant is required to provide his/her Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with ANY ONE of the following documents - 1. Bank or Post Office Passbook with Photo.2. Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card.3. Passport.4. Ration Card.5. Voter Identity Card.6. MGNREGA Card.7. Kisan Photo Passbook.8. Driving license issued by the Licensing Authority under the Motor Vehicles Act
1988 (59 of 1988).9. Certificate of identity having a photo of such person issued by a Gazetted Officer or a Tehsildar on an official letterhead.10. Any other document as specified by the Department.

faqs.question: Can an applicant use a driving license as an alternative to an Aadhaar Card?
faqs.answer: Yes, a driving license issued by the Licensing Authority is accepted as an alternative document if an Aadhaar Card is not available.

faqs.question: What role does the Revenue Department play in the application process?
faqs.answer: The Revenue Department issues necessary certificates such as residence and income certificates required for the application.

faqs.question: What does the scheme aim to provide to lactating mothers?
faqs.answer: Lactating mothers receive assistance in the form of a ₹500 National Savings Certificate under the BALIKA SAMRITHI YOJANA.

faqs.question: How can individuals contact the authorities for further information about the scheme?
faqs.answer: For additional information, individuals can visit https://wcd.py.gov.in/contact-us.

faqs.question: Can an applicant residing in Pondicherry for two years apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, continuous residence in Pondicherry for at least three years is a prerequisite for eligibility.

faqs.question: Are there any special provisions for applicants without an Aadhaar Card?
faqs.answer: Yes, alternative documents such as bank passbook, PAN card, or ration card can be submitted in the absence of an Aadhaar Card.

faqs.question: Can a voter identity card be used as an alternative to an Aadhaar Card?
faqs.answer: Yes, a voter identity card is accepted as an alternative document in the absence of an Aadhaar Card.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for submitting applications to the BALIKA SAMRITHI YOJANA?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not specify a deadline for application submission.

faqs.question: What actions can be taken through the provided Grievance Redressal link?
faqs.answer: Grievances related to the scheme can be addressed through the Central Public Grievance Redressal and Monitoring System at https://wcd.py.gov.in/ta/central-public-grievance-redress-and-monitoring-system.

faqs.question: How can applicants track the status of their BALIKA SAMRITHI YOJANA application?
faqs.answer: Application status can be tracked online at https://edistrict.py.gov.in/User/TrackApplication.aspx.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance provided to eligible mothers?
faqs.answer: Assistance is given in the form of a National Savings Certificate, valuing ₹500.

faqs.question: Who are the targeted beneficiaries under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiaries are girl children born on or after 15-8-97.

name: Grant of Financial Assistance for Performance of Marriage of Poor Brides Living Below Poverty Line
description: The scheme "Grant of Financial Assistance for Performance of Marriage of Poor Brides Living Below Poverty Line" is a financial assistance scheme by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Puducherry. This scheme aims to provide financial assistance to poor brides living below the poverty line to meet their marriage expenses. The assistance amount is ₹15,000, and it is granted for the first marriage of the bride. The scheme is implemented through the Department of Women and Child Development.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹25
000 for marriage expenses.
eligibility_criteria: The annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹75

000 per annum.The parents/guardian of the bride should be a citizen of India and a native of the Union Territory of Pondicherry by birth or by continuous residence of 5 years or more.The assistance is payable only for the first marriage of the bride.The marriage should be performed in accordance with the law in force on the date of marriage.The assistance is given for the performance of the marriage of one daughter only.The bride should have attained the age of 18 years
and the bridegroom 21 years on the date of marriage.
required_documents: 1. Aadhaar Card of Bride.2. Aadhaar Card father.3. Aadhaar Card Mother.4. Anganwadi Certificate (format).5. Applicant photo.6. Birth Certificate / TC of Bride.7. Birth Certificate / TC of Bride Groom.8. Certificate by MLA or Gazetted officer.9. Form IV (format).10. Gazetted Form.11. Income Certificate (from the Revenue Department) (format).12. Marriage Invitation.13. Marriage Photo.14. Marriage Registration Certificate (obtained from the registration department/Municipality/Commune Panchayat).15. Ration Card.16. Residence Certificate (from the Revenue Department) (format).17. Undertaking Form (format).18. Voter Card of Bride.19. Voter Card of Father.20. Voter Card of Mother.21. Xerox Copy of the first page of the bank passbook of the Applicant.22. Aadhaar Number.23. Declaration (format).﻿In the absence of an Aadhaar Number; the applicant is required to provide his/her Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with and ANY ONE of the following documents - Bank or Post office Passbook with PhotoPermanent Account Number (PAN) CardPassportRation CardVoter Identity CardMGNREGA CardKisan Photo PassbookDriving license issued by the Licensing Authority under the Motor Vehicles Act
1988 (59 of 1988).Certificate of identity having a photo of such person issued by a Gazetted Officer or a Tehsildar on an official letterhead.Any other document as specified by the Department.

faqs.question: How does the scheme address the financial needs of poor brides living below the poverty line for their marriage expenses?
faqs.answer: The scheme addresses the financial needs by providing a fixed financial assistance amount of ₹25,000 for the marriage expenses of eligible brides.

faqs.question: Is the financial assistance amount the same for every eligible beneficiary, or does it vary based on specific criteria?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance amount is fixed at ₹25,000 for every eligible beneficiary.

faqs.question: What is the significance of the Citizen's Charter, and where can interested applicants find it for reference?
faqs.answer: The Citizen's Charter provides detailed information, and interested applicants can refer to it at https://wcd.py.gov.in/sites/default/files/citizens-charter-english.pdf.

faqs.question: How is the marriage date related to the application submission process for offline applicants?
faqs.answer: Offline applicants must submit the application form along with documents at least 30 days before the proposed marriage date.

faqs.question: Can you specify the official website for the e-District Portal of the Government of Puducherry for online applications?
faqs.answer: The official website for online applications is https://edistrict.py.gov.in/.

faqs.question: How does the scheme define the eligibility regarding the age of the bride and groom at the time of marriage?
faqs.answer: The bride should be at least 18 years old, and the groom should be at least 21 years old on the date of marriage.

faqs.question: Can you clarify the conditions under which financial assistance is granted for the first marriage of the bride?
faqs.answer: The assistance is payable only for the first marriage of the bride, and the marriage should be performed in accordance with the prevailing law on the date of marriage.

faqs.question: What is the significance of the Aadhar Number in the list of required documents, and is there an alternative if the applicant doesn't possess one?
faqs.answer: The Aadhar Number is essential; however, if unavailable, the applicant can provide Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with specified alternative documents like Voter Identity Card or PAN Card.

faqs.question: How are applicants notified about their selection or rejection, and who is responsible for this communication?
faqs.answer: The selection process is periodic, and applicants are informed about their status by the Anganwadi Worker or through a formal letter.

faqs.question: Could you explain the detailed application process for offline applicants, especially concerning submission timelines?
faqs.answer: Offline applicants must submit the filled and signed application form, along with documents, to the Deputy Director or Child Development Project Officer at least 30 days before the proposed marriage date.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance amount disbursed to the beneficiaries, and what is the mode of disbursement?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance of ₹25,000 is directly disbursed to the beneficiary.

faqs.question: Can you elaborate on the eligibility criteria regarding the citizenship of the bride's parents or guardian under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The parents or guardian of the bride should be a citizen of India and a native of the Union Territory of Pondicherry by birth or by continuous residence of 5 years or more.

name: Marriage Grant to War Widows’ Daughters of Ex-Servicemen
description: The "Marriage Grant to War Widows’ Daughters of Ex-Servicemen" scheme is implemented by the Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹21,000/- is provided to the war widows for the marriage of their dependent daughters, for up to two daughters who are at least 18 years old.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹21
000/- is given to the war widows for the marriage of their dependent daughters.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a bonafide resident of Haryana.The applicant should be the widow of an ex-serviceman who died in the war.The daughter should be at least 18 years old.The widow can receive the benefit for up to two of her daughters.
required_documents: Copy of Ex-serviceman/Widow of Ex-serviceman Identity CardParivar Pehchan PatraOriginal Discharge Book of Ex-serviceman (Complete)Domicile Certificate of HaryanaCopy of Bank Passbook linked with Aadhaar CardApplicant’s Photo ID Proof (Ration Card/Driving Licence/ Voter ID Card/PAN Card etc.)P.P.OBattle Casualty Report from Military AuthorityAadhaar CardAge Proof- Matric Exam Certificate for Date of Birth verification (attested)Wedding CardAny other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the amount of financial assistance provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹21,000/- for the marriage of each eligible daughter.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant must be a bonafide resident of Haryana, a widow of an ex-serviceman who died in the war.

faqs.question: How many daughters can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: The widow can receive the benefit for up to two daughters.

faqs.question: Is there an age requirement for the daughters?
faqs.answer: Yes, the daughters must be at least 18 years old.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply online through the Official Portal- Antyodaya-SARAL Portal. The link to apply is https://saralharyana.gov.in/.

faqs.question: Can the assistance be availed for more than two daughters?
faqs.answer: No, the benefit is restricted to a maximum of two daughters.

faqs.question: How can applicants track their application status?
faqs.answer: You can track your application through the Official Antyodaya-SARAL Portal by entering your Department Name, Scheme Name, and Application Reference ID at https://status.saralharyana.nic.in/.

faqs.question: Can the Marriage Grant be availed by war widows who are residing outside Haryana?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only available to bonafide residents of Haryana.

name: Grant of Incentive to the Family having One Girl/Two Girl Children and Parents who have undergone Family Planning
description: The scheme "Grant of Incentive to the Family having One Girl/Two Girl Children and Parents who have undergone Family Planning" is a financial assistance scheme by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Puducherry. This scheme aims to create awareness among parents about the desirability of the girl child and elevate the status of the girl child in the family. The scheme provides an amount of ₹30,000/- deposited in the name of the girl child, and in the case of two girl children, ₹15,000/- is deposited in the name of each. The maturity value is given to the girl child/children when she attains the age of 18 years.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹30
000/- for one girl child
and ₹15
000/- for each of two girl children.The incentive amount is deposited in the name of the girl child/children and matures when the child reaches 18 years of age.
eligibility_criteria: The parents should be citizens of India.Either of the parents should be a native of Puducherry by virtue of birth or continuous residence of not less than five years.The annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹75

000/- per annum.The age of the parents should not be below 21 years for the father and 18 years for the mother at the time of their marriage.Either of the parents should have undergone Family Planning in a Central/State Government Hospital/ Private (Registered).The parents should have only one girl child/two girl children.The marriage of the applicant should be registered in the Registration Department/Municipality/Commune Panchayat.
required_documents: Residence Certificate from the Revenue Department.Income Certificate from the Revenue Department.Certificate of Marriage Registration of Parents.Certificate of Sterilization of Either of the Parents.Age Proof (Birth Certificate / TC) of Parents.Certificate of Birth of Girl Child/Children.Copy of the Family Ration Card & Election ID.Photograph of the Family.Aadhar Card of Parents and Children.Ration Card.Recent Passport Size Photograph.Sterilization Certificate.Voter ID Card of Father.Voter ID Card of Mother.﻿In the absence of an Aadhaar Number; the applicant is required to provide his/her Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with ANY ONE of the following documents - 1. Bank or Post Office Passbook with Photo.2. Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card.3. Passport.4. Ration Card.5. Voter Identity Card.6. MGNREGA Card.7. Kisan Photo Passbook.8. Driving license issued by the Licensing Authority under the Motor Vehicles Act

1988 (59 of 1988).9. Certificate of identity having a photo of such person issued by a Gazetted Officer or a Tehsildar on an official letterhead.10. Any other document as specified by the Department.﻿

faqs.question: Can the applicant choose to track the status of their application, and if so, how?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants can track their application status through the official e-district portal.

faqs.question: In the absence of an Aadhaar Number, what alternative documents can be provided along with the Aadhaar Enrolment ID?
faqs.answer: Bank or Post Office Passbook with Photo, PAN Card, Passport, Ration Card, Voter Identity Card, MGNREGA Card, Kisan Photo Passbook, Driving license, Certificate of identity issued by Gazetted Officer or Tehsildar, or any other specified document.

faqs.question: Which department issues the Income and Residence Certificate?
faqs.answer: The Revenue Department issues the Income and Residence Certificate.

faqs.question: How is the number of girl children determined for eligibility, and what documents are needed for this?
faqs.answer: The parents should have only one girl child/two girl children, and the Certificate of Birth of Girl Child/Children is required.

faqs.question: What documents are needed to verify the age of the parents applying for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Age proof documents such as Birth Certificate/TC of parents are required.

faqs.question: What documents are required to prove the eligibility criteria of annual income not exceeding ₹75,000/- per annum?
faqs.answer: Income and Residence Certificate from the Revenue Department is required.

faqs.question: How is the citizenship requirement defined for parents applying for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The parents should be citizens of India, and either of them should be a native of Puducherry by birth or continuous residence of not less than five years.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria regarding the parents' age and Family Planning?
faqs.answer: The parents should be at least 21 years old (father) and 18 years old (mother) at the time of marriage, and either of them should have undergone Family Planning.

faqs.question: Can you explain the maturity conditions for the incentive amount under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The deposited amount matures when the girl child reaches 18 years of age.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided for one girl child and each of two girl children?
faqs.answer: ₹30,000/- is provided for one girl child, and ₹15,000/- is deposited in the name of each of two girl children.

faqs.question: Can the parents or legal guardians have any control over the deposited amount until the girl child reaches 18 years of age?
faqs.answer: No, the deposited amount is intended for the exclusive benefit of the girl child and cannot be controlled or accessed by parents or guardians.

faqs.question: Does the scheme provide any additional benefits or bonuses along with the initial financial assistance?
faqs.answer: The scheme primarily provides the specified financial assistance and does not include additional bonuses or benefits.

name: Widow Daughter Marriage Scheme
description: Department of WCD, Delhi Government is implementing various Financial Assistance Schemes for the benefit of different sections of the society through Financial Assistance Cell. Department of Women and Child Development is running Widow’s Daughter Marriage(WDM) Scheme for the benefit of widows/women in distress. AIMS AND OBJECTIVETo provide financial assistance to the poor widows for performing the marriage of their daughters(up to two daughters). To provide financial assistance to the guardians including Homes/Institutions or foster parents of an orphan girl for her marriage. This is a one-time grant.
benefits: The Quantum of assistance for this scheme is ₹30
000/- only.
eligibility_criteria: The financial assistance can be granted for performing marriage up to two daughters only. Residence of a minimum of 5 years in Delhi before the date of application. The income of the applicant should be less than Rs 1
000/-Per year from all sources (including rent
interest/dividends on savings & investments
earnings from the farm
property sale proceeds

etc.) of the applicant. Applicant should have an Aadhar number. The Applicant should have a single-operated Aadhaar-linked account with any bank in the National Capital Territory (NCT) of Delhi only. The applicant should not be in receipt of any assistance from the discretionary fund of the Lt. Governor or the Chief Minister of Delhi for the same purpose. The girl for whose marriage the Financial Assistance is sought
should be major on the date of marriage i.e.
above 18 years of age.The application must be submitted within a period of sixty days
before or after the date of marriage being solemnized. The applicant should not be receiving any pension from Central Govt./State Govt./MCD and/or NDMC or any other source for this purpose.
required_documents: Widow as an applicant want to apply for marriage of her girl under the scheme

then Aadhaar card of widow as applicant is mandatory and Aadhaar card of girl whose marriage is being performed is optional.  Orphan Girl as applicant want to apply for her marriage under the scheme then Aadhaar card of orphan girl as applicant is mandatory. Proof of Identify (anyone of the following):-  Voter ID card. Pan card. Driving License. Aadhar Card. Passport. Insurance Policy Documents. Electricity Bill/ Water Bill/ Telephone Bill/ Gas Connection receipt.  Bank passbook. Caste Certificate issued in Delhi. Service identify card of public/private sector company/established concerned. Property Document. Any other document which clearly shows at least 5 years of residence in Delhi.

faqs.question: What is Financial Assistance for the Marriage of Daughters of Poor Widows and Orphan Girls (WDM)?
faqs.answer:
Financial Assistance for the marriage of daughters of poor widows and orphan girls is the welfare scheme of Govt. of NCT of Delhi to provide financial assistance to the poor widows for performing the marriage of their daughters (up to two daughters) and to provide financial assistance to the guardians including Homes/Institutions or foster parents of an orphan girl or an orphan girl for her marriage.  
The quantum of Assistance is one time Rs. 30,000 (Rs. Thirty Thousand only per application) up to two daughters only

faqs.question: What are the documents required to avail WDM benefits?
faqs.answer:
1. An application for the financial assistance under this scheme shall be submitted online on e-district portal https://edistrict.delhigovt.nic.in  or offline to the District WCD Officer concerned in the prescribed Form, which may be obtained from any of the offices of the District WC&D Offices.  
2. The application shall contain the recommendation from the Member of Legislative Assembly of National Capital Territory of Delhi or the Member of Parliament of the area concerned. 
3. The application shall be submitted at least Sixty days, before or after the date of marriage. 
4. The following self attested documents shall be scanned and uploaded/attached with the application:- 
a. In case of Widow applicant a copy of the death certificate of her husband issued by the Registrar- Births & Deaths; 
b.  A copy of Ration card or voter identity card or any proof of residence; 
c. A self declaration with regard to the income of the applicant  
d. Age proof of girl in the form of school leaving certificate or date of birth certificate issued by Registrar of Births & Deaths  
e. In case of orphan girl grown up on her own, an affidavit on stamp paper duly attested by a Metropolitan or Executive Magistrate or a Notary or a certificate from a Gazetted Officer to the effect that she is an orphan. 
f. In case of girl brought up by a guardian or foster parent or the relative, such persons or guardian should submit the affidavits to the effect that the girl is an orphan and he/they have brought her up. 
g. A marriage invitation card of the marriage for which the financial assistance is sought. 
h. Self-declaration to the effect that no financial assistance has been received by the applicant from any other Govt. organization, Non-Govt. organization, Municipal Corporation of Delhi or New Delhi Municipal Corporation or any other statutory or non-statutory agency for this purpose. 
i. Aadhar Card  
j. Residence proof of last 5 year residence in Delhi. 
k. Bank account details (Single –operated Aadhar linked) in Delhi only. 
l. Bank passbook / statement for last one year. 
m. In case of SC/ST applicant, caste certificate in the name of the applicant issued by competent authority and in case of minority applicants selfdeclaration of the religion of the applicant duly verified from the religious institution has to be submitted.
n. One passport size photo of applicant. 
o. One photograph of Marriage Ceremony.

faqs.question: Is Aadhaar number necessary for applying for WDM?
faqs.answer: Single operated Aadhar linked bank account of any bank in Delhi only

faqs.question: What are documents required for  proof of Age for Girl whose Marriage is being Performed?
faqs.answer:
• Birth Certificate issued by MCD/Registrar-Births & Deaths 
• School leaving certificate of class last attended 
• Matriculation/10th Certificate 
• Hospital discharge slip at the time of birth of the child 
• Voter ID card 
• Pan card 
• Driving License 
• Aadhar Card 
• Passport 
• Age assessment medical certificate 
• Any document issued by the Government/Govt. recognized body stating date and place of birth.

faqs.question: Can an applicant apply for financial assistance under WDM who is not resident of Delhi?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for the residents of Delhi, residing from last 5 years

faqs.question: Is there any annual income limit for getting financial assistance WDM Scheme?
faqs.answer: Income of applicant should be less than Rs 1,00,000/ per year from all sources of the applicant.

faqs.question: What is the quantum of financial assistance under WDM Scheme?
faqs.answer: Rs 30,000/- One time

faqs.question: Is any recommendation or attestation required?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application should be attested from Gazetted Officer or area MP/MLA

faqs.question: What is procedure to change address? If applicant shifted within Delhi.
faqs.answer: Application has to be given along with documentary proof of changed address to the concerned District W&CD Office.

faqs.question: Is there any provision of punishment? If anyone try to get Financial Assistance through forged documents
faqs.answer: If the assistance was sanctioned on furnishing of false documents, penal action will be initiated and appropriate liability levied against the beneficiary for furnishing false documents. Recovery of the amount shall also be done.

faqs.question: What is the Prescribed Timeline of acceptance/ rejection and sanctioning for payment of application form?
faqs.answer: 60 Days for sanction of application at District Level.

faqs.question: Is there any verification required before getting WDM scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Yes, the District Officer, WCD will verify the documents and if required home visit will be done before sanction of assistance or beneficiary may be called for document verification in District Office (if needed). SIR Report to be submitted on e-district at district level.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to change the bank account details?
faqs.answer: Application to be given to concerned District Office, WCD to change the Bank Account. However, Department is remitting Direct Benefit Transfer (Aadhar Based) payment. Payment of Widow Pension is remitted in Aadhar linked bank account only

name: Mukhyamantri Noni Sashaktikaran Sahayata Yojana
description: In 2022, Chhattisgarh State Government started the "Mukhyamantri Noni Sashaktikaran Sahayata Yojana" for the girl child of the family. With this scheme, daughters of workers will be able to get education, employment and self-employment.
benefits: Financial Benefits: ₹ 20
000/- only first two girl child.
eligibility_criteria: The girl's father or mother or both should be registered as a construction worker in the Board for a period of at least one year.The daughter for whom application has been made should not be registered in any division under the Labor Department.Only two daughters of registered construction workers will be eligible for incentive amount.The age of the daughter should be at least 18 years and should not be more than 21 years. Daughter should be unmarried.The daughter must have passed at least 10th class. There should be a running bank account in the name of the daughterThe Parents of the daughter must have been working as a construction worker for at least 90 days in the period of one year preceding the date of application.For payment of incentive amount

self-declaration form will be mandatory regarding verification of the beneficiary being a construction worker and the information given by the applicant in the application.Those girls beneficiaries who have already received assistance under Minimata Kanya Vivah Yojana/Rajmata Vijayaraje Kanya Vivah Assistance Yojana operated under the Board
will be not eligible for this scheme.﻿
required_documents: Labor registration card.Daughter's Aadhaar card.Daughter's bank passbook photocopy.Age Certificate.Class 10th marksheet.

faqs.question: What is the scheme?
faqs.answer: Chhattisgarh State Government started "Mukhyamantri Noni Sashaktikaran Sahayata Yojana" for the girl child of the family.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: Financial Benefits: ₹ 20,000/- only for first two girl child.

faqs.question: May same beneficiary will get the benefits twice?
faqs.answer: No.

faqs.question: Who will get the benefits?
faqs.answer: Daughter of construction workers parents.

faqs.question: What is the eligible age to get the benefits?
faqs.answer: Daughter age should be between 18 to 21 years old.

faqs.question: How many daughter can get the benefits of same parents?
faqs.answer: Only two daughter.

faqs.question: Can parents get the benefits of married daughter?
faqs.answer: No. Daughter should be unmarried.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer:
1. Applicant have to visit the official website. 
2. Click on apply now under the  Building and other construction.
3. Now applicant have to provide the few detail.
4. Now select the scheme name here. 
5. Fill out the online form. 
6. Upload required documents.
7. Click on submit.

faqs.question: What documents are required ?
faqs.answer:
1. Labor registration card.
2. Daughter's Aadhaar card.
3. Daughter's bank passbook photocopy.
4. Age Certificate.
5. Class 10th marksheet.

faqs.question: What is the official website to apply ?
faqs.answer: URL : https://cglabour.nic.in/ShramAyuktHome.aspx

name: Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-I
description: The 'Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-I' was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme provides financial assistance to the orphan girls for their marriage. The bride should have completed 18 years of age at the time of marriage.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹25
000/-.One sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam. Mode of Disbursal: Through Electronic Clearing Service.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a girl.The applicant should be an orphan.The bride should be 18 years or above at the time of marriage.
required_documents: 1. Death Certificate of Father & Mother or Orphan Certificate (Issued by a Member of Parliament (MP)/ Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA)).2. Income Certificate from Tahsildar.3. Marriage Invitation.4. Age Proof of the Bride.5. Bride’s Photograph.6. Bills towards the Purchase of Marriage Articles for ₹1
000/-.7. Any other document as required by the Department.﻿

faqs.question: What is the objective of the Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls?
faqs.answer: The objective is to provide financial assistance to orphan girls for their marriage.

faqs.question: What assistance is provided under scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹25,000 is provided through Electronic Clearing Service along with 1 Sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit for eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit for eligibility.

faqs.question: What is the time limit for submitting an application before the marriage date?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted 40 days before the marriage date. In exceptional circumstances, it can be submitted one day prior to the marriage date.

faqs.question: Who should be contacted for assistance regarding this scheme?
faqs.answer: District Social Welfare Officers and Extension Officers (Social Welfare) should be contacted for assistance.

faqs.question: What is the probable time limit for processing applications?
faqs.answer: Applications are processed within 15 days from the date of receipt.

faqs.question: Will applications submitted after the marriage date be accepted?
faqs.answer: No, applications received on or after the date of marriage will not be entertained.

faqs.question: Where should grievances be reported at the district level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the District Collector/District Social Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: Where should grievances be reported at the state level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the Director of Social Welfare, 2nd Floor, Panagal Maaligai, Saidapet, Chennai – 600015, with phone number 044-24351885.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for extending the time limit for submitting applications in exceptional circumstances?
faqs.answer: Yes, in exceptional circumstances, applications can be submitted one day prior to the marriage date.

faqs.question: Are there any penalties for late submission of applications?
faqs.answer: Penalties for late submission of applications are not specified in the scheme guidelines.

name: Child Adoption - Tamil Nadu
description: The scheme "Child Adoption - Tamil Nadu" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a family for orphaned, abandoned, destitute and neglected children. According to Central Adoption Resource Authority (CARA), “adoption is a process by which a child who is abandoned / separated from biological parents, becomes the legitimate child of a new set of parents referred to as adoptive parents, with all the rights, privileges and responsibilities that are attached to this relationship”.
benefits: Accommodation
food

and health care to the babies till they are given in adoption.A family to the destitute child and a child to childless parents.Special concessions are given to female government employees to adopt children:Special adoption leave of 270 days is extended to female government servants of the state government who adopt a child below one year. The leave is eligible only from the date of legalization of adoption.
eligibility_criteria: The parents must have at least two years of a stable marital relationship.The single prospective adoptive parents should be between 30-55 years of age. An unmarried/single male persons are not eligible to adopt a girl child.The parents should have adequate financial resources to upbring the child.Age Criteria:For a child up to 4 years old:Maximum composite age of the Prospective Adoptive Parents: 90 years.For a single Prospective Adoptive Parent: Minimum age 25 years
maximum age 45 years.For a child above 4 years up to 8 years old:Maximum composite age of the Prospective Adoptive Parents: 100 years.For a single Prospective Adoptive Parent: Minimum age 25 years
maximum age 50 years.For a child above 8 years up to 18 years old:Maximum composite age of the Prospective Adoptive Parents: 110 years.For a single Prospective Adoptive Parent: Minimum age 25 years
maximum age 55 years.﻿﻿﻿﻿
required_documents: PAN Card/Passport.Proof of Residence (Aadhaar Card/Voter ID card/Passport /Driving License/ Electricity Card).Proof of Income of Last Year (Pay Bill/ Income Tax Certificate).Copy of Marriage Certificate & Photograph.Copy of Birth Certificate of the Prospective Adoptive Parents.Medical Certificate. Letter of Identification (from their friends/relatives).

faqs.question: What kind of assistance is provided to children under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides accommodation, food, and healthcare to the babies until they are adopted, and also facilitates the process of providing a family to the destitute child and a child to childless parents.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for prospective adoptive parents?
faqs.answer: Prospective Adoptive Parents must have a stable marital relationship of at least two years. Age and marital status criteria vary depending on the age of the child to be adopted.

faqs.question: What is the definition of child adoption according to CARA?
faqs.answer: According to the Central Adoption Resource Authority (CARA), adoption is a process by which a child who is abandoned or separated from biological parents becomes the legitimate child of a new set of parents (adoptive parents), with all the rights, privileges, and responsibilities attached to this relationship.

faqs.question: Which legal acts govern the process of adoption in India?
faqs.answer: The Hindu Adoption and Maintenance Act, 1956 (HAMA) and the Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, 2015 govern adoption.

faqs.question: How is the child adoption process regulated?
faqs.answer: The adoption process is regulated by Non-Governmental Organisations and involves various authorities and agencies to ensure a thorough and legal process.

faqs.question: How many institutions are involved in implementing the adoption scheme?
faqs.answer: There are 23 institutions involved in implementing the adoption scheme.

faqs.question: Who should be contacted for information about adoption?
faqs.answer: Contact the State Adoption Resource Agency, the Directorate of Social Defence in Chennai, the concerned Probation Officer, or the 23 Licensed Specialized Adoption Agencies.

faqs.question: What documents need to be submitted for adoption?
faqs.answer: Documents include PAN Card/Passport, Proof of Residence, Proof of Income, Marriage Certificate and Photograph, Birth Certificate of the Prospective Adoptive Parents, Medical Certificate, and a Letter of identification from friends or relatives.

faqs.question: What happens if a prospective adoptive parent is found ineligible after submission of documents?
faqs.answer: If found ineligible, the prospective adoptive parent(s) will not be allowed to proceed with the adoption process and will be informed accordingly.

faqs.question: Are single males allowed to adopt a girl child?
faqs.answer: No, an unmarried or single male person is not eligible to adopt a girl child.

name: Mukhyamantri Nikah Yojana
description: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Nikah Yojana" was started by the Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh in the year 2012. The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to needy girls, widows, and abandoned women from destitute or poor Muslim families in the state at the time of their marriage (In case of mass marriage).
benefits: Under this scheme
the following assistance is provided:Each eligible bride (including girls
widows
or abandoned women) participating in the mass marriage (Nikah) ceremony will receive a total of ₹49
000/- through an Account Payee Cheque.The organizing body that conducts the mass marriage (Nikah) ceremony will receive ₹6
000/- per beneficiary.Note: A total of ₹55
000/- is provided per beneficiary under the scheme.
eligibility_criteria: The parents of the bride and groom should be natives of Madhya Pradesh.Financial assistance will be provided to needy girls
widows
and abandoned women from destitute or poor Muslim families in the state at the time of their marriage.The bride and groom should belong to Muslim families.The bride should be at least 18 years old

and the groom must be at least 21 years old.There are no income restrictions for receiving assistance under the scheme.The bride and groom should participate in the mass marriage (Nikah) ceremony organized on the prescribed dates.The benefit of this scheme will not be available for single marriage (Nikah) ceremonies.Note 1: Abandoned women who have been legally divorced are only eligible under the scheme.Note 2: If the groom is from outside the state
the bride will still be eligible for the benefits of the scheme. However
if the parents of either the bride or groom are not natives of the state

the benefits under the scheme will not be available.Note 3: The bride should not have been previously married. This means that the marriage of the bride and groom must take place solely during a mass marriage (Nikah) ceremony organized under the scheme

and they should not have been married through a single or any other mass marriage (Nikah) ceremony before.Note 4: A mass marriage (Nikah) ceremony will be organized only if applications are received from a minimum of 5 couples.
required_documents: 1.	Certificate proving that the bride or groom's guardian is a native of Madhya Pradesh.2.	Samagra ID. If the composite ID is not available
it will be provided by the concerned authority where the applicant resides. If the groom is not a resident of Madhya Pradesh

the Samagra ID will not be mandatory.3.	Photocopies of Aadhaar cards for both the bride and groom.4.	Age certificates for both the bride and groom. One of the following documents should be provided:•	School Certificate (TC)•	Marksheet with date of birth•	Birth certificate issued by a competent authority•	Voter list or voting identity card showing age or date of birth•	Age certificate issued by a government medical expert•	Job Card from the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme•	Other legally acceptable documents to prove age5.	Two passport-sized photographs of both the bride and groom.6.	Mobile numbers for both the bride and groom (if available).7.	Mobile number of the bride's or groom's parents (if available).8.	For widows (Kalyanis)
the death certificate of the husband.9.	For abandoned women
the court order for legal divorce.10.	If the beneficiary is a registered laborer under the Madhya Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

a photocopy of the labor registration card is required. This is necessary because the amount spent on a maximum of 2 daughters of such registered laborers will be obtained from the Madhya Pradesh Building and Construction Workers Welfare Board.11.	Any other documents as required.

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective is to offer financial support to Muslim girls, widows, and abandoned women from poor families during their marriage, especially in mass marriage ceremonies.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Each eligible bride receives ₹49,000/- through an Account Payee Cheque, and the organizing body of the mass marriage ceremony receives ₹6,000/- per beneficiary. The total benefit provided per beneficiary is ₹55,000/-.

faqs.question: Who can apply for benefits under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Needy girls, widows, and abandoned women from destitute or poor Muslim families in Madhya Pradesh can apply.

faqs.question: Are there any age requirements for the bride and groom?
faqs.answer: Yes, the bride should be at least 18 years old, and the groom must be at least 21 years old.

faqs.question: Are there income restrictions for receiving the assistance?
faqs.answer: No, there are no income restrictions for receiving benefits under the Mukhyamantri Nikah Yojana.

faqs.question: Can the groom be from outside Madhya Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Yes, the groom can be from outside the state. However, the parents of either the bride or groom must be natives of Madhya Pradesh for the benefits to be available.

faqs.question: Can the bride have been previously married?
faqs.answer: No, the bride must not have been previously married. The marriage must take place during the mass marriage ceremony organized under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is the scheme applicable to single marriage ceremonies?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme does not provide benefits for single marriage (Nikah) ceremonies.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bride and groom must jointly apply in the prescribed form to the concerned body (Municipal Corporation, Municipality, City Council, or District Panchayat) 15 days before the scheduled date of the mass marriage.

faqs.question: Where can the application form be obtained?
faqs.answer: The application form can be collected free of cost from the concerned body, such as the Municipal Corporation, Municipality, or City Council.

faqs.question: Which institutions are authorized to organize mass marriage ceremonies under this scheme?
faqs.answer: In urban areas, the mass marriage ceremony can be organized by the Urban body (Municipal Corporation, Municipality, or Municipal Council). In rural areas, the District Panchayat is authorized to organize such ceremonies.

faqs.question: How are the dates for mass marriage ceremonies determined?
faqs.answer: The dates are determined by the minister in-charge of the district, and they are entered on the marriage portal by the District's Joint/Deputy Director of the Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities Department.

faqs.question: How can interested couples know the dates for mass marriage ceremonies?
faqs.answer: Dates will be widely publicized to ensure that interested couples can apply on time.

name: Chief Minister’s Girl Child Protection Scheme-I
description: The 'Chief Minister’s Girl Child Protection Scheme-I' was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to girl children of poor families as well as to promote girl child education, small family norms, increase the child sex ratio, discourage the preference for male child & eradicate female infanticide.
benefits: A fixed deposit (FD) of ₹50
000/- in the name of the girl child (A copy of the FD receipt is given to the family).Renewal of FD after five years.An annual incentive of ₹1

800/- from the 6th year of the FD.The amount deposited along with accrued interest is given to the girl child when she attains 18 years of age.NOTE: The matured amount will be given to the girl child only if she appears for the 10th standard public exam.
eligibility_criteria: The assistance is provided only for one girl child of the family.The annual income of the parents of the girl child should not exceed ₹72
000/-.One of the parents must have undergone sterilization before turning 40 years old.The family should have only one female child and no male child. In the future

no male child should be adopted.The parents/grandparents should be a native of Tamil Nadu by birth or continuous residence of not less than ten years at the time of applying to this scheme.The scheme is also applicable to the girl children of Sri Lankan Tamil Refugees in the Refugee Camps in Tamil Nadu.
required_documents: Birth Certificate (issued by Corporation/Taluk Office/ Municipality Office).Parent's age proof (Birth Certificate/School Certificate/Government Doctor's Certificate).Sterilisation Certificate (issued by Government/Private Hospital).Income Certificate (issued by Taluk Office).No Male Child Certificate (issued by Extension Officer (SW)
Rural Welfare Officer
or Supervisor/ Taluk Office (Chennai District only)).Residential Certificate (issued by Tahsildar).Community Certificate (issued by the Revenue Department).﻿﻿﻿﻿

faqs.question: When can the deposited amount be accessed by the girl child?
faqs.answer: The deposited amount, along with accrued interest, will be given to the girl child upon reaching 18 years of age.

faqs.question: Can families with more than one female child avail of scheme?
faqs.answer: No, scheme is specifically for families with only one female child and no male child.

faqs.question: Who can I contact for more information about scheme?
faqs.answer: For more information, you can contact the District Social Welfare Officer or Extension Officer (Social Welfare).

faqs.question: Is there any time limit for submitting the application for scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application should be submitted before the child completes 3 years of age.

faqs.question: What happens if the girl child does not appear for the 10th standard exam?
faqs.answer: The amount deposited with accrued interest will be remitted into the government account.

faqs.question: Can the deposited amount be withdrawn before the girl child turns 18?
faqs.answer: No, the deposited amount can only be accessed by the girl child upon turning 18 years old.

faqs.question: Is there any penalty for not adhering to the conditions of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-compliance with the scheme's conditions may lead to forfeiture of the deposited amount.

faqs.question: Can families with adopted male children avail of scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only families with one female child and no male child are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for families with disabled girl children under scheme?
faqs.answer: There's no specific provision mentioned for disabled girl children.

faqs.question: What happens if the girl child's family moves out of Tamil Nadu before she turns 18?
faqs.answer: The scheme is applicable only to families domiciled in Tamil Nadu, so moving out of the state may result in ineligibility.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for families with more than one female child due to twins or triplets under scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme caters only to families with one female child.

faqs.question: Can families with a male child from a previous marriage avail of scheme?
faqs.answer: No, families with any male child are not eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: How is the interest on the fixed deposit calculated?
faqs.answer: The interest is calculated based on the fixed deposit rate provided by the Tamil Nadu Power Finance and Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited.

name: Financial Assistance for Self-Marriage of Registered Women Workers (HBOCWWB)
description: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Self-Marriage of Registered Women Workers” is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to registered women workers for arranging their own marriage. Women workers who are registered members for at least one year and have not received marriage assistance for their own marriage from any other government department/board/corporation are eligible to avail the benefits of this scheme.
benefits: Under this scheme
financial assistance of ₹50
000/- is provided to registered women workers for arranging their own marriage.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a woman and engaged in building or construction work.The applicants should be registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The registered woman worker must have a minimum one-year regular membership.The registered woman worker must have an active membership with the Board.The registered woman worker shall submit an undertaking/self-declaration that she has not received and will not receive this assistance from any other Government Department/Board/Corporation.
required_documents: Documents required for registration under HBOCWWB:Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card

Voter CardPassport-size photographAttested work experience documentProof of ResidenceRation CardBank account detailsCaste Certificate (If applicable)Proof of age Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID)Disability certificate (If applicable)Any other documents as requiredDocuments required for Scheme Benefits:Identity proof/ID Card of WorkerMarriage registration certificateAn undertaking/self-declaration that she has not received and will not receive this assistance from any other Government Department/Board/Corporation.Any other documents as required

faqs.question: What does the scheme offer?
faqs.answer: It offers financial assistance to registered women workers for arranging their own marriage.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A financial assistance of ₹50,000/- is provided to registered women workers.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Women engaged in building or construction work, registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and having at least one year of regular membership are eligible.

faqs.question: What is the minimum membership duration required for eligibility?
faqs.answer: A minimum of one year's regular membership with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board is required.

faqs.question: What declaration is necessary for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Applicants must submit an undertaking/self-declaration stating they have not received and will not receive similar assistance from any other Government Department/Board/Corporation.

faqs.question: Where can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply through the official website of the Labour Department, Haryana. https://hrylabour.gov.in/

faqs.question: Are there any documents required for the application?
faqs.answer: Required documents may include proof of registration with the Board, identity proof, marriage certificate and the undertaking/self-declaration form.

faqs.question: Can applicants check the status of their application?
faqs.answer: Yes, Workers can track their application status online through the official website of the Labour Department Haryana. Relevant updates will be sent to the registered mobile number. https://hrylabour.gov.in/login/bocw

name: Financial Assistance To Women And Girl Acid Attack Victims
description: Launched on 26th Feb 2019, the social security scheme “Financial Assistance to Women and Girls Acid Attack Victims” by the Social Justice & Empowerment Department, Govt. of Haryana, provides financial assistance in the form of a monthly pension to the women/girls residing in Haryana who have suffered disfigurement of any part of the body or have become disabled due to acid attack or similar corrosive substance. The scheme aims to restore, to an extent the right to live with dignity for the woman/girl victims of acid attack.
benefits: The Financial Assistance will be in the multiples of the monthly pension under the "Divyang Pension" scheme of the Govt. of Haryana:2.5 times the monthly Pension
if the Percentage of Disability is between 40% and 50%.3.5 times the monthly Pension
if the Percentage of Disability is between 51% and 60%.4.5 times the monthly Pension
if the Percentage of Disability is greater than 61%.*The Financial Assistance will become applicable from the month of application.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.The applicant should be a woman/ girl.The applicant should have suffered disfigurement of a part of her body or should have become disabled due to an attack by acid or a similar corrosive substance.The acid attack should have happened on or after 2nd May 2011.The applicant should have been residing in Haryana for at least 3 years since the acid attack.
required_documents: Medical certificate issued by the Medical Board at the District level where the application is being made by or on behalf of the victim.Copy of the FIR/Complaint.Copy of application made to or benefit received from Women & Child Development Department.

faqs.question: Who Is Eligible For The Financial Assistance Scheme For Women And Girl Acid Attack Victims?
faqs.answer: Women and girl acid attack victims who are residents of Haryana and have been attacked in the state are eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Age Limit To Avail Of The Benefits Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no age limit to avail of the benefits of this scheme.

faqs.question: What Are The Documents Required To Apply For This Scheme?
faqs.answer:
The following documents are required to apply for this scheme:
Proof of residence in Haryana
Copy of FIR/Complaint
Medical report
Income certificate
Identity proof

faqs.question: How Can An Acid Attack Victim Apply For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The acid attack victim can apply for this scheme by submitting the required documents to the District Social Welfare Officer of their district.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee To Apply For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no application fee to apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: What Is The Last Date For Applying For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no last date for applying for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Income Limit For The Applicant To Be Eligible For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit for the applicant to be eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Can An Acid Attack Victim Who Has Already Received Financial Assistance From Other Sources Still Apply For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, an acid attack victim who has already received financial assistance from other sources can still apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: Can An Acid Attack Victim Who Has Not Reported The Attack To The Police Still Apply For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, an acid attack victim who has not reported the attack to the police cannot apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: What Is The Purpose Of Providing Financial Assistance To The Acid Attack Victims Under This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The purpose of providing financial assistance to the acid attack victims under this scheme is to help them in their rehabilitation and to provide them with financial support for their medical treatment and livelihood.

faqs.question: Can The Financial Assistance Provided Under This Scheme Be Used For Any Purpose?
faqs.answer: No, the financial assistance provided under this scheme can only be used for the treatment and rehabilitation of the acid attack victim.

faqs.question: Can An Acid Attack Victim Apply For This Scheme Multiple Times?
faqs.answer: No, an acid attack victim can only apply for this scheme once.

faqs.question: Is There Any Provision For Review Or Appeal Of The Decision Of The District Social Welfare Officer?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant can file a review or appeal with the Director, Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Haryana, within 30 days of receiving the decision of the District Social Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: Can An Acid Attack Victim Who Is Not A Resident Of Haryana Apply For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only acid attack victims who are residents of Haryana can apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is The Financial Assistance Provided Under This Scheme Taxable?
faqs.answer: No, the financial assistance provided under this scheme is not taxable.

faqs.question: Is There Any Provision For The Renewal Of The Financial Assistance Provided Under This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no provision for the renewal of the financial assistance provided under this scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Provision For The Payment Of The Financial Assistance In Instalments?
faqs.answer: No, the financial assistance is provided in a lump sum amount.

name: Dr. Dharmambal Ammaiyar Ninaivu  Widow Remarriage Assistance Scheme-I
description: The "Dr. Dharmambal Ammaiyar Ninaivu Widow Remarriage Assistance Scheme" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme's objective is to encourage widow remarriage and to rehabilitate widows by giving financial assistance along with 1 sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin. Interested applicants should apply Offline or via CSC.
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹ 25
000/-.One sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam.﻿Mode of Disbursal:₹15
000/- through Electronic Clearing Service and ₹10
000/- as a National Savings Certificate.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a widow.The bride (widow) should be 20 years or above in age.The bridegroom should be less than 40 years or above in age.
required_documents: Death Certificate of the First Husband.Widow Certificate From Tahsildar.Remarriage Photos.Age Proof of the Bride.Age Proof of the Bridegroom.Certificate to Prove First Marriage of the Bridegroom From Tahsildar or MLA.Marriage Invitation.

faqs.question: What are the objectives of the Dr. Dharmambal Ammaiyar Ninaivu Widow Remarriage Assistance Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objectives are to encourage widow remarriage and rehabilitate widows.

faqs.question: What is the quantum of assistance provided under scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹50,000 is provided along with 1 Sovereign (8gm) 22 carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam,

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the scheme?
faqs.answer: Widows who remarry are eligible to benefit from the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit for eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income ceiling for eligibility.

faqs.question: What is the time limit for submitting an application after remarriage?
faqs.answer: Applications must be submitted within 6 months from the date of remarriage.

faqs.question: Which officers should be contacted for assistance?
faqs.answer: District Social Welfare Officers and Extension Officers (Social Welfare) should be contacted for assistance.

faqs.question: What is the probable time limit for processing applications?
faqs.answer: Applications are processed within 15 days from the date of receipt.

faqs.question: Where should grievances be reported at the district level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the District Collector/District Social Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: Where should grievances be reported at the state level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the Director of Social Welfare, 2nd Floor, Panagal Maaligai, Saidapet, Chennai – 600015, with phone number 044-24351885.

faqs.question: Can the assistance provided under this scheme be used for any specific purposes related to the remarriage or general rehabilitation?
faqs.answer: The assistance provided under the scheme is typically intended to support remarriage and rehabilitation efforts. However, specific usage guidelines may vary depending on the scheme's objectives.

name: Mukhyamantri Bhagyalaxmi Bond Scheme (GBOCWWB)
description: The “Mukhyamantri Bhagyalaxmi Bond Scheme” is implemented by the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board (GBOCWWB), Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme has been implemented with the objective of "Beti Bachao Beti Padhao" to prevent female foeticide and to meet the education and marriage expenses of the daughter of a construction worker. Under the scheme, a bond is provided in the name of the first girl child, of age up to 1 year of age, of the registered Building and Other Construction Workers.
benefits: Under the scheme
a bond of ₹25
000/- or of the amount as resolved from time to time
with maturity at 18 year of the age of the girl child
upto one girl is given to the registered Building and other Construction workers.The amount can be withdrawn by the daughter after completing 18 years of age.
eligibility_criteria: The construction workers registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board will be eligible to get the benefit of this scheme.The construction workers are eligible to avail the benefits of the scheme in the event of the birth of a girl child.The benefit of the scheme is given upto one girl child.The application form should be made within 12 months from birth.
required_documents: Documents required for ‘E-Nirman Card’ under the GBOCWWB:Photograph of the workerAadhaar CardRation CardCaste Category certificate

if applicableProof of age (Birth certificate/Driving Licence/PAN Card/Voter ID Card)﻿Self-declaration certificate ﻿Employer CertificateBank PassbookAny other documents as requiredDocuments required for Scheme Benefit:Identity card of construction workerPassport size photographBirth certificateAadhaar card of the beneficiary﻿Bank form for obtaining the bondBank Passbook of the beneficiaryRation Card/Voter ID Card/PAN CardBonafide CertificateAny other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme has been implemented with the objective of "Beti Bachao Beti Padhao" to prevent female foeticide and to meet the education and marriage expenses of the daughter of a construction worker.

faqs.question: How does the scheme work?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, a bond is provided in the name of the first girl child, up to one year of age, of registered Building and Other Construction Workers. This bond matures when the girl child reaches 18 years of age.

faqs.question: What is the value of the bond provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bond amount is ₹25,000/- or as resolved from time to time by the authorities.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to receive benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Construction workers registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: When can construction workers avail of the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Construction workers can avail of the benefits in the event of the birth of a girl child in their family.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the number of girl children eligible for benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefit of the scheme is provided for up to one girl child per registered construction worker.

faqs.question: What is the timeframe for applying to the scheme after the birth of a girl child?
faqs.answer: The application form should be submitted within 12 months from the birth of the girl child.

faqs.question: Can the bond be withdrawn before maturity?
faqs.answer: No, the amount can only be withdrawn by the daughter after she completes 18 years of age.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits under the scheme, the applicant may visit the Sanman Portal: https://sanman.gujarat.gov.in/

name: Marriage Grant for the Marriage of the Daughter of War Disabled Ex-Servicemen above 50% Disability
description: The "Marriage Grant for the Marriage of the Daughter of War Disabled Ex-Servicemen above 50% Disability" scheme is implemented by the Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹21,000/- is provided for the marriage of each dependent daughter of war-disabled ex-servicemen whose disability has been assessed above 50%, for up to two daughters who are at least 18 years old.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹21
000/- is given for the marriage of each dependent daughter of war-disabled ex-servicemen whose disability has been assessed as over 50%.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a bonafide resident of Haryana.The applicant should be a war-disabled ex-serviceman with a disability assessed above 50%.The daughter should be at least 18 years old.The applicant can receive the benefit for up to two daughters only.
required_documents: Copy of Identity Card of Ex-servicemanParivar Pehchan PatraOriginal Discharge Book of Ex-serviceman (Complete)Domicile Certificate of HaryanaCopy of Bank Passbook linked with Aadhaar CardApplicant’s Photo ID Proof (Ration Card/Driving Licence/Voter ID Card/PAN Card etc.)P.P.OBattle Casualty Report from Military AuthorityAadhaar CardAge Proof- Matric Exam Certificate for Date of Birth verification (attested)Wedding CardAny other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the primary benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary benefit is financial assistance of ₹21,000 for the marriage of each dependent daughter of eligible war-disabled ex-servicemen.

faqs.question: How many daughters can receive this benefit under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefit is provided for up to two daughters of the eligible war-disabled ex-servicemen.

faqs.question: What is the minimum age requirement for the daughters to receive the marriage grant?
faqs.answer: The daughter must be at least 18 years old.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for the war-disabled ex-servicemen?
faqs.answer: The ex-serviceman should have a disability assessed above 50%.

faqs.question: Does the applicant need to be a resident of Haryana?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a bonafide resident of Haryana.

faqs.question: How can an eligible applicant apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant can apply online through the Official Portal- Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/

faqs.question: Can applications be tracked?
faqs.answer: Yes, applications can be tracked through the Official Antyodaya-SARAL Portal by entering the Department Name, Scheme Name, and Application Reference ID at https://status.saralharyana.nic.in/

faqs.question: Can the scheme benefit be availed for the marriage of sons?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is specifically for the marriage of daughters.

name: Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance To Destitute Widows
description: The “Abhayakiranam Scheme-Financial Assistance to Destitute Widows” scheme was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. This scheme aims to provide a safe and better living environment for destitute and homeless widows. Under this scheme, monthly financial assistance will be given to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them. In the initial phase, the State Government has accorded Administrative Sanction for providing financial assistance to 200 persons at ₹1,000/- each for 6 months.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹1000/- per month will be provided to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State.The age limit of the applicant (destitute widow) must be above 50 years.The annual family income should be below ₹1
000/-.The applicant should not be receiving a service pension or family pension.The applicant should not be a beneficiary of schemes implemented through the Social Justice Department (Aswasakiranam
Samashwasam).﻿
required_documents: Passport size photoAttested copy of SSLC certificate/Election ID card/ Aadhaar card for age proof.Certificate from the concerned Village officer showing that the applicant is a widow and is under the protection of a relative.Attested copy of Ration card/Income certificate from Village office/BPL certificate Bank account details﻿

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The aim of this scheme is to provide a safe and better living environment for destitute and homeless widows.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The destitute widows of Kerala State are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for destitute widows?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for destitute widows.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of ₹1000/- per month will be provided to the close relatives of destitute widows who provide protection and shelter to them.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for the applicant to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The age limit of the applicant (destitute widow) must be above 50 years.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The annual family income should be below ₹1,00,000/-.

faqs.question: Can an applicant be eligible to apply if she is receiving a service pension or family pension?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant should not be receiving a service pension or family pension.

faqs.question: Where can I get the application form?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit the nearest District Social Justice Office and collect the application form. The application form can also be downloaded from the official website of the Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala. http://sjd.kerala.gov.in

faqs.question: Where shall I submit the application form?
faqs.answer: The duly filled application form along with supporting documents has to be submitted to the concerned District Social Justice Office.

name: The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Allowance to Destitute Women Scheme
description: The scheme “The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Allowance to Destitute Women Scheme” is implemented by the Directorate of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands to provide financial assistance to the poorest and destitute women in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
benefits: The quantum of Allowance to Destitute Women shall be ₹2500/- per month subject to eligibility.Payment of allowance shall be made through Bank Account on a monthly basis.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands or have resided in the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands for more than 10 years at the time of making the application.The applicant should be a poor and destitute woman.The household income of the applicant does not exceed ₹4000/- per month.The applicant should not be availing of any kind of assistance or pension from the government.
required_documents: 1.	Passport-size photograph2.	Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card3.	Local certificate/ domicile certificate 4.	Category/community certificate
if applicable5.	Bank account details/Copy of passbook6.	Proof of income issued by the competent authority7.	Any other document as required

faqs.question: How much financial assistance does the scheme provide?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a monthly allowance of ₹2500/- per month to eligible beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How is the allowance disbursed?
faqs.answer: How is the allowance disbursed?

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the Scheme?
faqs.answer: To be eligible for the scheme, the woman applicant must either be a permanent resident of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands or have resided there for more than 10 years at the time of application.

faqs.question: How is the income eligibility determined for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The household income of the applicant should not exceed ₹4000/- per month to meet the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Can applicants receiving government assistance or pension still apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants who are currently availing any form of government assistance or pension are not eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Where can one obtain the application form for this scheme?
