faqs.answer: The application form is available free of cost at the Directorate of Social Welfare, Port Blair, and the sub-divisional offices of Child Development Project Officers (CDPOs). Additionally, it can be downloaded from the official website.

faqs.question: Who should the application be submitted to?
faqs.answer: The application form, along with the required documents, should be submitted to the offices of the concerned Child Development Project Officer.

faqs.question: The application form, along with the required documents, should be submitted to the offices of the concerned Child Development Project Officer.
faqs.answer: A beneficiary is required to inform the Director of Social Welfare about any change of address or employment status within 15 days of the change.

faqs.question: What happens if a beneficiary fails to inform about a change of address or employment status within the stipulated time?
faqs.answer: Failure to inform about changes within 15 days will result in an inquiry by the Director of Social Welfare, and if necessary, the recovery of the allowance paid as arrears of land revenue.

faqs.question: Is there any fee for obtaining the application form?
faqs.answer: No, the application form is available free of cost.

name: Mukhyamantri Mahila Utkarsh Yojana
description: DetailsUnder the scheme, the government provides interest-free loans of up to Rs. 1 lakh to women entrepreneurs who wish to start a new business or expand their existing one. The loans are provided without any collateral security, and the repayment period is up to five years.The scheme also provides training and skill development programs to women entrepreneurs to help them build their business acumen and enhance their knowledge of entrepreneurship. The Mukhyamantri Mahila Utkarsh Yojana is a great initiative to promote women's entrepreneurship and to empower them to become financially independent. over the scheme name, launch date, ministry/dept. name, target beneficiary, benefits, etc.)﻿Objectives:The main objectives of the scheme are:To promote women's entrepreneurship and provide them with financial assistance to start or expand their businesses.To provide interest-free loans to women entrepreneurs to promote their business ventures.To provide training and skill development programs to women entrepreneurs to enhance their knowledge of entrepreneurship.To create employment opportunities for women in the state.﻿Features of the Scheme:Interest-Free Loans: Under the scheme, women entrepreneurs can avail of interest-free loans of up to Rs. 1 lakh to start or expand their businesses. The loans are provided without any collateral security.Repayment Period: The repayment period for the loan is up to 5 years.Training and Skill Development: The scheme provides training and skill development programs to women entrepreneurs to help them build their business acumen and enhance their knowledge of entrepreneurship.﻿Subsidy: The government also provides a subsidy of 6% per annum to women entrepreneurs who repay their loans on time.No Processing Fee: The scheme does not charge any processing fee for the loan application.No Income Limit: There is no income limit for women entrepreneurs to apply for the scheme.﻿
benefits: BenefitsInterest-Free Loans: Women entrepreneurs can avail of interest-free loans of up to Rs. 1 lakh to start or expand their businesses. The loans are provided without any collateral security.Subsidy: The government also provides a subsidy of 6% per annum to women entrepreneurs who repay their loans on time.No Processing Fee: The scheme does not charge any processing fee for the loan application.Repayment Period: The repayment period for the loan is up to 5 years

giving entrepreneurs sufficient time to repay the loan.Skill Development: The scheme provides training and skill development programs to women entrepreneurs to help them build their business acumen and enhance their knowledge of entrepreneurship.Employment Generation: The scheme promotes the creation of employment opportunities for women in the state
leading to the overall economic growth of the state.Financial Independence: The scheme empowers women entrepreneurs and enables them to become financially independent
contributing to their personal and professional growth.No Income Limit: There is no income limit for women entrepreneurs to apply for the scheme
making it accessible to women from all income groups.﻿
eligibility_criteria: Eligibility The applicant should be a woman who is a permanent resident of Gujarat.The applicant should be 18 years of age or above.The applicant should have passed at least the 8th standard.The applicant should have a valid Aadhaar card.﻿
required_documents: List of required documents The applicant should have a valid Aadhaar card.Any government-issued identity proof such as Voter ID
Driving License
or PAN Card.Any government-issued address proof such as Voter ID
Driving License
or Passport.The applicant should provide a certificate of having passed at least 8th standard.The applicant should submit a detailed business plan
including the type of business
the investment required
and expected revenue.The applicant should provide the bank account details for the loan disbursement.Recent passport-size photographs of the applicant.﻿

faqs.question: Can the loan be used for any type of business?
faqs.answer: Yes, the loan can be used for any type of business, including manufacturing, service, or trading

faqs.question: Is there any income limit for women entrepreneurs to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit for women entrepreneurs to apply for the scheme. It is open to women from all income groups

faqs.question: Is collateral security required for the loan?
faqs.answer: No, collateral security is not required for the loan. The loan is provided without any collateral security.

faqs.question: What is the repayment period for the loan?
faqs.answer: The repayment period for the loan is up to 5 years, giving entrepreneurs sufficient time to repay the loan

faqs.question: Can women entrepreneurs who have already taken loans from other schemes or financial institutions apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, women entrepreneurs who have already taken loans from other schemes or financial institutions can also apply for the scheme, provided they meet the eligibility criteria mentioned above.

faqs.question: Is the scheme open only to women residents of Gujarat?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is open only to women residents of Gujarat who meet the eligibility criteria mentioned above.

faqs.question: Is there any age limit for women entrepreneurs to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be 18 years of age or above to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the minimum educational qualification required to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should have passed at least 8th standard to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is the scheme open to women entrepreneurs from all income groups?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is open to women entrepreneurs from all income groups. There is no income limit for applying for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to have a business plan to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is mandatory to submit a detailed business plan along with the application form. The plan should include the type of business, investment required, and expected revenue

faqs.question: Is there any application fee for applying to the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no application fee for applying to the scheme

faqs.question: Can an applicant submit multiple applications for the same business idea?
faqs.answer: No, an applicant can submit only one application for the same business idea.

faqs.question: Is it necessary to have a registered business to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, it is not necessary to have a registered business to apply for the scheme. However, the applicant should have a detailed business plan, including the type of business, the investment required, and expected revenue.

name: Scheme for Maternity Benefit
description: The Scheme for Maternity Benefit was launched by the Tripura Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, under the Labour Department of Tripura. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to registered female construction workers or the wife of a male registered construction worker after delivery or in case of miscarriage, with a maximum of two claims per lifetime for each beneficiary.
benefits: Financial Assistance for Delivery:Amount ₹8
000/- to female registered construction workers after delivery or the wife of a male registered construction worker.Maximum twice in a lifetime.﻿Financial Assistance for Miscarriage:Amount ₹4

000/- to female registered construction workers or the wife of registered construction workers.Maximum twice in a lifetime.﻿Maternity Leave with Pay:Maximum 3 months for female registered construction workers who have been working for not less than one year.NOTE: As per the unskilled minimum rate of wages for the building and other construction workers notified by the Labour Department
Govt. of Tripura.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a female registered construction worker or wife of a male construction worker. The registered construction worker must be a beneficiary for not less than one year continuously to get a maternity benefit and paid maternity leave.The registered construction worker can get this assistance only twice. The registered construction workers should not have any dues payable to the Board.The registered women construction workers or wife of male construction worker already have two children are not eligible to get assistance. ﻿﻿﻿
required_documents: Bank Account Details.Copy of BOC Worker Registration Card.Birth Certificate of Child (issued by a government or private hospital in Tripura duly signed by the doctor concerned from the institution).Affidavit for Second Child.Ration Card.Miscarriage Certificate (In case of miscarriage the certificate is issued by the registered Medical Practitioner/Doctor).Any Other Documents if required.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the financial assistance?
faqs.answer: Female registered construction workers and the wives of male registered construction workers who have been registered for not less than one year continuously.

faqs.question: How many times can the assistance be claimed?
faqs.answer: The assistance can be claimed a maximum of two times in a lifetime.

faqs.question: What is the amount of assistance for delivery and miscarriage?
faqs.answer: Delivery: ₹8000/- only & Miscarriage: ₹4000/- only assistance will be provided.

faqs.question: What are the requirements for maternity leave with pay?
faqs.answer: The female registered construction worker must have been working for not less than one year.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The registered beneficiary must apply electronically using the prescribed form. The application will be processed and verified by the concerned Labour Inspector and reviewed and approved by the Labour Officer.

faqs.question: Who verifies the application?
faqs.answer: The application is verified by the concerned Labour Inspector.

faqs.question: What is the deadline to submit the application?
faqs.answer: The application must be submitted within 6 months of delivery.

faqs.question: Are there any conditions related to the number of living children?
faqs.answer: Yes, the assistance is not provided if the registered worker already has two living children.

faqs.question: Is there any additional benefit from other government schemes?
faqs.answer: The assistance provided by this scheme is in addition to any other benefit received from any other government scheme in this regard.

faqs.question: Can a registered construction worker with dues to the Board apply?
faqs.answer: No, the registered construction worker must have no dues payable to the Board to be eligible for the assistance.

faqs.question: What if the worker has not been registered for one year continuously?
faqs.answer: The worker would not be eligible for the maternity benefit or paid maternity leave if they have not been registered for at least one year continuously.

name: Laadli Laxmi Scheme
description: Laadli Laxmi Scheme was launched on 6th July 2012 as one of the flagship programmes of the Department of Women & Child Development, Government of Goa with the intention to address the undesirable tendency of female foeticides and with an aim towards erasing the general perception that the birth of a girl in the family is the burden on her parents/guardian during her marriage. The objective of the scheme is to financially empower the girl child to meet educational and other expenses on becoming a major of age and to improve the female sex ratio in the State.
benefits: For Unmarried Beneficiaries (beneficiaries who attain the age of majority i.e. 18 years on or after 01-04-2012)Financial Assistance of ₹ 1
by means of a bank fixed deposit
jointly in the name of the Director (DoWCD) and the applicant.The fixed deposit shall be renewed annually automatically on maturity
along with the amount of interest accrued

till the date of claim by the applicant as per the scheme or until the age of 45 years whichever is earlier.﻿For Married Beneficiaries ( beneficiaries who have already attained the age of 18 years before 01-04-2012 and are in the age group of 19 to 45 years prospectively from 1st April
2016)Financial Assistance of ₹ 1
by means of cash payment.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a Girl.The applicant should be born in the State of Goa OR should be a resident of Goa for the last fifteen years.In case
the applicant is a resident of Goa for the last fifteen years
she should have been educated in Goa for a minimum period of 7 years (continuous).The parental income of the applicant does not exceed ₹ 3

000 per annum.The applicant should qualify for ANY ONE of the following three criteria:             a)   At least one of the parents of the applicant is born in Goa and is also a resident of Goa for the last fifteen years.             b)   One of the parents of the applicant is residing in Goa for the last twenty-five years.﻿NOTE: In case the applicant is an affected person of Tillari Irrigation Project (a joint venture of the Government of Goa and the government of Maharashtra) and was rehabilitated in the State of Goa
her application shall be sanctioned if she produces a certificate issued by the Collector
North Goa District relaxing the condition of 10/15 years domicile in the State of Goa for various purposes for her family.
required_documents: 1.    Birth Certificate (Self-Attested)2.    Any document as proof (Self-Attested) of 15 years of residence of the applicant in the State of Goa.NOTE: In lieu of the Residence Certificate

the previous School Leaving Certificate and the current Bonafide Student Certificate issued by the recognized Educational Institution in which the girl is presently studying can also be produced. However
in the case of girls who discontinued education at the school level
the gap period i.e.
from the time of discontinuation of education till completion of 18 years of age/marriage as the case may be
may be proved by the production of residence certificate. In the case of graduates
the Certificates of passing of Xth
XIIth and Graduation are adequate evidence.3.    Residence Certificate of the Parent(s) (15 years or 25 years) as the case may be. NOTE: In lieu of the Residence Certificate
any documentary evidence to prove the residence for the specified period can also be produced which may include the:                   (a) The land records i.e. tenancy rights
mundcarial rights
occupancy rights

etc;                   (b) Employment certificate; or                   (c) Any such records to the satisfaction of the Committee.                   (d) In case of a girl whose father/mother is in service either with the State Government or the Central Government or the public sector undertakings
in lieu of the certificate of residence such applicant may produce the service certificate of 25 years issued by the Head of the Department. However

the girl should be born in Goa and should have studied in Goa up to class 10th.4.    Birth Certificate of the parent(s). NOTE: If no birth certificate is available one of the following documents can be produced showing the details namely the date and place of Birth of the parent(s):                   (a) Baptism certificate;                   (b) School leaving certificate of the parent(s) etc;                   (c) Any document which establishes that one of the grandparents of the girl has lived in Goa around the time of the date of birth claimed by the parent(s);                   (d) Any such records
which establish the date of birth of the parent(s).5.    Aadhaar card (for the applicants after 01-04-2013). However
the Government by separate Order may relax the requirement of producing the Aadhaar card and such other certificate(s)
for a further period of time

as may be prescribed in the said Order.6.    A Self-Declaration in the format as given in “Annexure II” to this scheme.7.    Annual Income Certificate of parents of the immediate previous financial year at the time of submission of application

issued by the Competent Authority. The Income Certificate shall include the annual income of the mother and father of the applicant taken together and not the income of the family.﻿NOTE: If the applicant fulfils all the criteria and has submitted all her documents required as per the scheme but is unable to furnish her parent's documents due to the death of both parents

such an application shall be sanctioned if the applicant submits her 15 years of residence certificate and birth certificate along with death certificates of both parents. Submission of parental income certificate in case of such applicants shall be waived off.﻿Additional DocumentsIn case of those beneficiaries who have already attained the age of 18 and above before 01-04-2012 and have got/are getting married hereinafter

may apply along with the attested copy of the Civil Marriage Registration Certificate (which may also include the first registration certificate) provided the certificate is dated on or after 01-04-2012 only.

faqs.question: How will the operation of the scheme be conducted through the bank/financial institution? Can you explain the key terms and conditions mentioned in the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)?
faqs.answer: A1: The operation of the scheme through the bank/financial institution will be governed by a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU), which outlines the terms and conditions related to the bank account, fixed deposit account/certificate, interest accrual, payment authorization procedure, and payment terms by the Government. The MoU also covers the process of crediting the Government on closure of individual accounts.

faqs.question: Who Is Responsible For Deciding The Eligibility Of Applicants Under The Scheme
faqs.answer: The Committee responsible for deciding the eligibility of applicants under the scheme consists of the Secretary to the Government of Goa in charge of the Department of Women and Child Development as Chairperson, a Social Worker appointed by the Government as Member, an Additional/Joint Secretary to Government of Goa in charge of the Department of Finance as Member, and the Director of the Directorate of Women and Child Development as Member Secretary.

faqs.question: Are The Decisions Made By The Committee Regarding Eligibility Final And Binding
faqs.answer: Yes, the decisions made by the Committee regarding eligibility are final and binding. The scheme does not allow any appeal or request for reconsideration of the Committee's decision.

faqs.question: What Types Of Applications Are Referred To The Committee For Decision
faqs.answer: The Committee reviews applications from girl children who are orphans, destitute children, born outside a legitimate wedlock, adopted girl children, or any other cases that fall under the objective of the scheme. If the application is made by the guardians or the institutions/organizations taking care of the child, it is referred to the Committee.

faqs.question: How Does The Scheme Address Situations Where Applicants Are Unable To Produce Necessary Documents Due To Their Parent's Opposition To Their Marriage
faqs.answer: In cases where applicants are unable to produce documents related to their parent's birth, residence, etc. due to their parent's opposition to their marriage, such applications are placed before the Committee for a decision.

faqs.question: Where Can Eligible Applicants Obtain The Application Form For The Scheme
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can obtain the application form (Annexure-I) from the designated Offices notified by the Director of Women and Child Development or designated branches of the bank concerned. The scheme strictly accepts applications in the specified format, and reprographic copies or forms in any other format are not accepted.

faqs.question: What Happens To The Financial Assistance In Case The Beneficiary Passes Away After Marriage But Before Claiming The Benefit
faqs.answer: In the unfortunate event of the beneficiary's death after marriage but before claiming the benefit, the financial assistance will be released to the parents. If both the parents of the beneficiary have passed away, the assistance will be released to the guardian whose name is mentioned in the Laadli Laxmi application of the expired beneficiary.

faqs.question: Under What Circumstances Can The Money Under The Fixed Deposit Be Withdrawn From The Bank/Financial Institution? What Documentation Is Required For The Withdrawal Process?
faqs.answer: The money under the fixed deposit can be withdrawn from the bank/financial institution when the beneficiary produces the withdrawal order/letter from the Director of Women and Child Development or any other authorized official. Additionally, the beneficiary needs to personally present herself before the bank officials for the withdrawal process.

faqs.question: What Happens If The Beneficiary Does Not Claim The Benefit Until Attaining The Age Of 45 Years
faqs.answer: If the beneficiary does not claim the benefit until attaining the age of 45 years, the fixed deposit will be closed, and the amount, along with the interest accrued, will be credited back to the Government. In such a scenario, no further assistance of any nature will be provided to the concerned beneficiary.

faqs.question: What Are The Consequences For Individuals Who Avail Financial Assistance Under The Scheme Based On False Information Or By Concealing Material Information
faqs.answer: Individuals who avail financial assistance under the scheme by providing false information, submitting false declarations, or concealing material information may face criminal prosecution. In addition to any criminal prosecution, such individuals will also be debarred for life from receiving any benefits or assistance under any other schemes of the Government.

faqs.question: How Is The Scheme Being Implemented Through The Bank/Financial Institution? Can You Explain The Process In Detail, Including The Steps Involved In Executing The Memorandum Of Understanding (MoU)?
faqs.answer: The scheme is being implemented through the bank/financial institution by executing a detailed Memorandum of Understanding (MoU). This MoU outlines the terms and conditions governing the operation of the bank account, fixed deposit account/certificate, interest calculation, payment authorization procedures, terms of payment by the Government to the bank/financial institution, and the process of crediting the Government upon closure of individual accounts. The MoU ensures a smooth and transparent process for handling financial assistance to the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Can You Elaborate On The Committee Responsible For Deciding Eligibility Doubts? How Does This Committee Ensure Fairness And Impartiality In Its Decisions?
faqs.answer: A12: The Committee consists of key officials, including the Secretary to Government of Goa in charge of the Department of Women and Child Development as Chairperson, a Social Worker appointed by the Government as Member, an Additional/Joint Secretary to Government of Goa in charge of the Department of Finance as Member, and the Director of the Directorate of Women and Child Development as Member Secretary. This multi-member Committee ensures fairness and impartiality in its decisions by evaluating each case thoroughly and considering all relevant factors before reaching a conclusion.

faqs.question: What Are Some Specific Cases That Might Require The Committee's Consideration Regarding Eligibility Doubts? Can You Provide Examples Of Scenarios That Fall Under The Scheme's Objectives?
faqs.answer: The Committee reviews cases of girl children who are orphans, destitute children, born outside a legitimate wedlock, or adopted. Additionally, any other cases that align with the objective of the scheme are also considered by the Committee. For instance, situations where the applicant's guardians or institutions/organizations submit the application due to specific circumstances are referred to the Committee for a decision.

faqs.question: Are There Any Provisions For Applicants Who Face Challenges In Producing Necessary Documents Related To Their Parent's Background Due To Family Opposition? How Does The Committee Handle Such Cases?
faqs.answer: In cases where applicants are unable to produce documents pertaining to their parent's birth, residence, etc., due to their parent's opposition to their marriage, such applications are carefully examined by the Committee. The Committee ensures a fair and compassionate approach in evaluating these cases, considering the unique circumstances involved.

faqs.question: Can You Provide More Information About The Application Form (Annexure-I) And Its Issuance? Are There Specific Designated Offices Or Bank Branches Responsible For Distributing The Application Forms?
faqs.answer: The application form (Annexure-I) is serially numbered and issued by designated Offices notified by the Director of Women and Child Development or designated bank branches. Applicants can obtain the application form from these specified locations. It is essential to use the correct format of the application form, as forms in any other format or reprographic copies will not be accepted under the scheme.

faqs.question: How Does The Scheme Handle Situations Where Beneficiaries Pass Away After Marriage But Before Claiming The Benefit? What Measures Are Taken To Ensure The Rightful Recipients Receive The Financial Assistance?
faqs.answer: In unfortunate cases where beneficiaries pass away after marriage but before claiming the benefit, the financial assistance is released to the parents. If both parents of the beneficiary are deceased, the assistance is provided to the guardian whose name is mentioned in the Laadli Laxmi application of the deceased beneficiary. This approach ensures that the financial support reaches the appropriate recipients in such circumstances.

name: Cycle Distribution Scheme
description: The scheme "Cycle Distribution Scheme" is implemented by the Tribal Affairs Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh, aims to provide cycles to village girls students to continue their education. Under this scheme, tribal girl students in Class 11th who travel more than 2 km to reach school and did not receive a bicycle in Class 9th are given a cash amount equivalent to the cost of a bicycle.Objective:The objective of the scheme is to reduce the dropout rate and promote the continuation of education for scheduled tribe girls in higher secondary schools. It aims to ensure that all scheduled tribe girls in the state continue their education beyond class 10, even if they need to enroll in higher secondary schools located in other villages.
benefits: Under this scheme
a cash amount equal to the cost of the cycle credited directly to the bank account of the applicant.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a girl student.The girl student should be a native of Madhya Pradesh.The girl student should be studying in Class 11.The girl student should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category.The girl student who did not receive a cycle in Class 9 is eligible under the scheme.The girl student should travel more than 2 km to reach her school.There is no restriction on the annual family income of the student.
required_documents: Passport-size PhotographAadhaar cardDomicile certificate of Madhya PradeshCaste certificate Samagra IDPrevious class passing marksheetBank account details/Bank PassbookOther necessary documents if required

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the Cycle Distribution Scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective is to reduce the dropout rate and promote the continuation of education for scheduled tribe girls in higher secondary schools.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible students must be girl students who are natives of Madhya Pradesh, studying in Class 11, belong to the Scheduled Tribe category, did not receive a cycle in Class 9, and travel more than 2 km to reach their school.

faqs.question: Is there any restriction on the annual family income for eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, there is no restriction on the annual family income for eligibility under this scheme.

faqs.question: How is the benefit of the scheme provided?
faqs.answer: The benefit is provided in the form of a cash amount equal to the cost of a cycle, credited directly to the bank account of the applicant.

faqs.question: How can eligible students apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible students can contact the District Convener/Assistant Commissioner, District Office of the Tribal Welfare Department, or the Principal of the concerned school/institution.

faqs.question: Who has the authority to approve financial assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The District Collector has the right to approve financial assistance to eligible girl students under the cycle supply scheme.

faqs.question: Can students from other states apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only girl students who are natives of Madhya Pradesh are eligible.

faqs.question: Can a student who received a cycle in Class 9 apply again in Class 11?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is specifically for students who did not receive a cycle in Class 9.

name: Pension for Journalists’ Family
description: The "Pension for Journalists’ Family" was launched by the Tamil Development, Religious Endowments, and Information Department, Government of Tamil Nadu in 1998. The scheme aims to give a monthly pension to the wife of a deceased journalist pensioner.
benefits: Pension Amount of ₹2
000/- per month.
eligibility_criteria: The benefit of the scheme will be given only on the death of the journalist.The applicant must be the spouse of the deceased journalist.The deceased journalist must contributed to the journalist pension.
required_documents: Two Passport-size Photographs (Attested by Govt. Registered Officer).Death Certificate of the Journalist.Marriage Proof (the applicant is the spouse of a retired journalist).Educational Certificate.Succession Certificate (from appropriate revenue department office).

faqs.question: What is the Journalists Family Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Journalists Family Pension Scheme is a state-sponsored program launched by the Government of Tamil Nadu in 1998 to provide financial assistance to the wives of deceased journalists who were receiving pensions.

faqs.question: How much is the pension amount under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The pension amount under the Journalists Family Pension Scheme is ₹2000/- per month.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the Journalists Family Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is eligible for the spouse of a deceased journalist who was receiving a pension at the time of their death.

faqs.question: When was the Journalists Family Pension Scheme introduced?
faqs.answer: The scheme was introduced in the year 1998.

faqs.question: Which department is responsible for overseeing the Journalists Family Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department is responsible for overseeing the scheme.

faqs.question: Where should applicants submit their application for the Journalists Family Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applications should be submitted to the Director, News Public Relations Department, Head Secretariat, Chennai-9.

faqs.question: Is there a specific format for the application form?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a specific format provided for the application form, which must be duly filled and submitted with all required documents.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for the applicant?
faqs.answer: No specific age limit for the applicant is mentioned.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for submitting the application?
faqs.answer: No specific deadline for submitting the application is mentioned.

faqs.question: What other benefits are associated with the Journalists Family Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme specifically provides a monthly pension benefit, and no other benefits are mentioned.

name: Incentive to Widow's Remarriage
description: The scheme "Incentive to Widow's Remarriage (IWR)" is a social welfare scheme by the Department of Women & Child Development, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to encourage and support widows to remarry and lead a normal life in society. Through this scheme, eligible individuals receive financial assistance of ₹50,000/- in the form of a National Saving Certificate. The bridegroom should be a bachelor or a widower.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹50
000/- in the form of a National Saving Certificate.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should be a Widow.The applicant should be a native of the Union Territory of Puducherry by birth or by continuous residence of not less than 5 years.The applicant should not be carrying a child.The applicant's annual income should not exceed ₹75
000/- per annum.The bridegroom should be a bachelor or a widower.The Bride and the Bridegroom should be of legal marriage age
i.e. 18 years for the Bride and 21 years for the Bridegroom.
required_documents: 1. Residence Certificate from the Revenue Department.2. Marriage Invitation.3. Age Proof (Birth Certificate / TC) of the Bride and Bridegroom.4. Death Certificate of the Bride's First Husband.5. Marriage Registration Certificate.6. Aadhaar Card of the Birde and the Bridegroom.7. Declaration of the bride as not carrying a child.8. Certificate from MLA/MP confirming the bridegroom's bachelor or widower status.9. Income Certificate from the Revenue Department.10. Marriage Photo.11. Ration Card.12. Voter ID Card of Bride & Bridegroom.﻿In the absence of an Aadhaar Number; the applicant is required to provide his/her Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with ANY ONE of the following documents - 1. Bank or Post Office Passbook with Photo.2. Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card.3. Passport.4. Ration Card.5. Voter Identity Card.6. MGNREGA Card.7. Kisan Photo Passbook.8. Driving license issued by the Licensing Authority under the Motor Vehicles Act
1988 (59 of 1988).9. Certificate of identity having a photo of such person issued by a Gazetted Officer or a Tehsildar on an official letterhead.10. Any other document as specified by the Department.

faqs.question: Could you elaborate on the financial assistance format provided under the IWR scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance is provided in the form of a National Saving Certificate, offering a secure investment for the beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How does the IWR scheme address the residency requirement for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants should be native to Puducherry by birth or continuous residence of not less than 5 years, ensuring a connection to the community.

faqs.question: Can an applicant provide alternative documents if they don't have an Aadhaar Number?
faqs.answer: Yes, alternative documents such as Bank Passbook, PAN Card, Passport, or other specified documents are acceptable in the absence of an Aadhaar Number.

faqs.question: What measures are in place to confirm the bridegroom's status as a bachelor or widower?
faqs.answer: A certificate from an MLA/MP confirming the bridegroom's status is required, ensuring accuracy in the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Can you clarify the condition regarding the bridegroom's marital status under the IWR scheme?
faqs.answer: The bridegroom should be a bachelor or a widower, ensuring eligibility for financial assistance under the scheme.

faqs.question: How can an applicant track their application status for the IWR scheme?
faqs.answer: The application status can be tracked through the official portal at https://edistrict.py.gov.in/User/TrackApplication.aspx.

faqs.question: Can a widow from any part of India apply for the "Incentive to Widow's Remarriage (IWR)" scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant must be a native of the Union Territory of Puducherry by birth or have continuous residence of not less than 5 years.

faqs.question: Is there an upper limit on the annual income of the IWR scheme applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, the annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹75,000/-, ensuring the financial assistance reaches those who need it most.

faqs.question: Are there specific criteria regarding the legal age for marriage under the IWR scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the bride should be 18 years old, and the bridegroom should be 21 years old, aligning with legal marriage age requirements.

faqs.question: Can a widow with a deceased husband from any cause apply for the IWR scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, as long as the widow meets the other eligibility criteria, the cause of her first husband's death is not a determining factor for application approval.

faqs.question: Is the IWR scheme applicable to widows of any age?
faqs.answer: The scheme does not specify an age limit for widows, focusing more on the legal marriage age criteria for the bride (18 years) and bridegroom (21 years).

name: Destitute Differently Abled Pension Scheme
description: The "Destitute Differently Abled Pension Scheme" was launched by the Social Welfare and Nutritious Meal Programme Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide a pension of ₹1,000/- to differently-abled persons with disability 60% and above. One free saree to females and one free dhoti to males is given on Pongal and Diwali. A nutritious meal is provided to the beneficiaries.
benefits: Pension: ₹1

000/- per month.Free Clothes during Pongal and Deepavali:One free dhoti to a male pensioner.One free saree to a female pensioner.Free Rice in Anganwadi Centres:2kg/month to those who are taking nutritious meal.4kg/month to those who are not taking nutritious meal.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a hearing and speech-impaired person.The applicant's age should be 45 years and above.The applicant should have a disability of 60% or above.The applicant should not have any source of income or means of subsistence to support.The applicant should not be a habitual beggar.The applicant should not be supported by a son or son's son aged 20 years or above.The applicant should not possess property valued at more than ₹5000/-.﻿
required_documents: Aadhaar Card.Proof of age.Bank Passbook.Disability Certificate.Any other document if required.

faqs.question: Who are the beneficiaries of this pension scheme?
faqs.answer: Destitute differently-abled persons aged 45 years and above, with a disability of 60% and above, including those who are hearing and speech impaired.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: 41000 per month is provided as pension.

faqs.question: What are the age criteria for eligibility in this scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary must be 45 years of age or above.

faqs.question: Can someone with any source of income apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant should not have any source of income or means of subsistence.

faqs.question: Is a habitual beggar eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, habitual beggars are not eligible.

faqs.question: What provision is there for age limit relaxation?
faqs.answer: The age limit can be relaxed by the District Committee, consisting of the District Collector, District Social Welfare Officer, and District Medical Officer.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this pension scheme?
faqs.answer: Applications can be submitted in white paper or in the prescribed format to the Special Tahsildar (Social Security Scheme) or the Village Administrative Officer.

faqs.question: What is the time limit for processing the application?
faqs.answer: The application should be processed within one month from the date of receipt.

faqs.question: Who should be contacted for further information regarding the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Special Tahsildar (Social Security Scheme) or the Tahsildar should be contacted.

faqs.question: To whom should grievances be reported if there are any issues?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the Revenue Divisional Officer or the District Collector.

faqs.question: Can the pension amount be increased in the future?
faqs.answer: The current document does not specify this, but any changes in the pension amount would typically be announced by the relevant authorities or government bodies.

name: Maternity Benefit Scheme - Telangana
description: The "Marriage Gift Scheme" is a welfare initiative implemented by the Telangana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (TB&OCWWB), LET&F (Labour) Department, Telangana. The scheme provides financial assistance to registered women workers, as well as the wives and daughters of registered workers, to support them during and after pregnancy.
benefits: Financial Assistance: A total amount of ₹30
000/- per delivery is provided
limited to two deliveries.﻿Payment Breakdown:₹10
000/- is paid during the 7th month of pregnancy to compensate for wage loss during the later stages of pregnancy.₹20
000/- is paid after the delivery.
eligibility_criteria: For construction workers themselves (Women only)The construction worker should be registered under the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. The construction worker should be a woman.The construction worker should have been registered for at least 12 months before the date of delivery.The construction work can get this assistance only twice.﻿For wife/daughters of construction workersThe construction workers should be registered under the Telangana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The construction worker can receive the scheme benefits twice for up to two daughters.The construction worker should have been registered for at least 12 months before the date of delivery.If both parents are registered workers
only one parent is eligible for the scheme amount.
required_documents: Passport-size Photograph.Registration Card under BOCW Act (Attested copy).Renewal Challan Copy.Delivery Certificate issued by the PHC/ Local area hospital or Medical Officer of the Pvt. Hospital (Attested copy).Pre-home Delivery Certificate issued by the Panchayat Secretary in case of delivery in a Village.Birth Certificate of the child.Advance Stamped Receipt.1st page of Bank pass book (Attested copy).

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the Maternity Benefit Scheme?
faqs.answer: Registered construction workers and their families, including the wife of a male worker and up to two daughters, are eligible.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹30,000 per delivery, limited to two deliveries.

faqs.question: What is the payment structure of the scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹10,000 during the 7th month of pregnancy and ₹20,000 after delivery.

faqs.question: Can a male construction worker's wife avail of this benefit?
faqs.answer: Yes, the wife of a registered male worker is eligible.

faqs.question: How many deliveries are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers up to two deliveries per woman.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum registration period required?
faqs.answer: Yes, the worker must have been registered for at least 12 months before delivery.

faqs.question: Can the benefit be claimed for more than two deliveries?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is limited to two deliveries.

faqs.question: Where can I submit the application?
faqs.answer: Submit the application to the concerned Labour Department officer.

faqs.question: Is the benefit amount in addition to other government schemes?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is in addition to any other similar schemes.

faqs.question: Who scrutinizes the application?
faqs.answer: The District Scrutiny Committee, based on a report from the Assistant Labour Officer.

faqs.question: When will the benefit amount be disbursed?
faqs.answer: After approval, the amount will be transferred to the applicant's bank account.

name: Swasraya Scheme For Parents/Mothers Of Physically Handicapped/Mentally Retarded Persons
description: The scheme “Swasraya Scheme for Parents/Mothers of Physically Handicapped/Mentally Retarded Persons” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to women of Below Poverty Line (BPL) families to find self-employment, whose husbands have died/abandoned, and who have to take care of their sons/children with severe physical and mental challenges.Parents of severely mentally retarded and differently-abled persons require emotional strength and flexibility. Older parents can find themselves overwhelmed by various medical, caregiving, and financial responsibilities. Physically Handicapped/Mentally Retarded (PH/MR) persons always need special care and attention since they cannot perform their day-to-day activities without someone else’s assistance. Sometimes it can be quite challenging for older parents in BPL families, especially mothers, who have to take care of household tasks and work apart from taking care of MR persons.Looking after such a Mentally challenged/PH person is expensive. These expenses can arise from medical equipment and supplies, medical care, caregiving expenses, specialized transportation, etc. Even though an amount of ₹600/- is being provided as “Aswasakiranam Pension” to caregivers (family members) of bedridden PH/MR persons, it cannot cover the expenses completely. Single mothers face tremendous challenges. Often, a custodial parent must fulfill the roles of primary provider and caregiver without the benefit of a partner. It is a difficult task under the best of circumstances.
benefits: Under the scheme
a one-time financial assistance of ₹35
000/- will be provided to women of BPL families to find self-employment
whose husbands have died/abandoned
and who have to take care of their sons/children with severe physical and mental challenges.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State.The applicant should be from Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.The parents (mothers) with children having 70% or more disability / mental retardation are eligible to apply under the scheme.Single/Unwed mothers/Wives abandoned by husbands/Legally divorced women/Separated women are eligible to apply under this scheme.Close relatives (women- as mentioned in the above category) who act as caretakers of severely disabled/mentally challenged patients can also apply.Note 01: Mothers of severely disabled/mentally challenged bedridden patients will be given priority.Note 02: Beneficiaries of the “Aswasakiranam Scheme” can also apply under the scheme.
required_documents: Copy of Aadhaar Card of Person with Disability Mobile numberEmail idPassport size photoCopy of Disability Identification Card Death/Divorce Certificate Copy of Income Certificate/Ration CardCopy of Parent's Aadhaar CardNon-remarriage certificate from Village OfficerBank account detailsCopy of bank passbookOther documents
if any

faqs.question: What is the “Swasraya Scheme”?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, financial assistance is provided to women of Below Poverty Line (BPL) families to find self-employment, whose husbands have died/abandoned, and who have to take care of their sons/children with severe physical and mental challenges.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A woman belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL) family is eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a member of the Below Poverty Line (BPL) family?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for a member (Woman) of the Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: What should be the minimum disability required to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The parents (mothers) with children having 70% or more disability / mental retardation are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Who else can apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Single/Unwed mothers/Wives abandoned by husbands/Legally divorced women/Separated women are eligible to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: Can a close relative who acts as a caretaker of severely disabled/mentally challenged patients apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, close relatives (women) who act as caretakers of severely disabled/mentally challenged patients can also apply.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, a one-time financial assistance of ₹35,000/- will be provided to women of BPL families to find self-employment, whose husbands have died/abandoned, and who have to take care of their sons/children with severe physical and mental challenges.

faqs.question: Who will get preference under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The mothers of severely disabled/mentally challenged bedridden patients will be given priority.

faqs.question: What is “Aswasakiranam Scheme”?
faqs.answer: The “Aswasakiranam Scheme” envisages assisting the caregivers of physically and mentally disabled bedridden patients, who are their family members or relatives. This scheme intends to provide a monthly assistance of ₹600/- to those caregivers who are unable to take up employment for self-sustenance. The scheme came into effect from 02/08/10 and all those who have been providing caregiving service to patients since 02/08/10 will be paid monthly assistance with retrospective effect.

faqs.question: Can the beneficiaries of the “Aswasakiranam Scheme” apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the beneficiaries of the “Aswasakiranam Scheme” can also apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant should visit the Official Portal- SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.  https://suneethi.sjd.kerala.gov.in

name: KULAVILAKKU
description: "KULAVILAKKU" is a scheme for pregnant women by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Puducherry. This scheme aims to enhance the nutritional status of Pregnant Women. ₹500/- assistance is provided to eligible beneficiaries during their pregnancies. The scheme is a crucial step towards ensuring the well-being of both mother and child. The benefit will be provided for upto two pregnancies only.
benefits: ₹500/- financial assistance during pregnancy.* The benefit will be provided for upto two pregnancies only.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should be a native of the Union Territory of Pondicherry by birth or by continuous residence of not less than 5 years.The applicant should be a woman.The applicant should be pregnant.The applicant should have attained the age of 18 years.The applicant should have crossed seven months of pregnancy.The annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹24
000/- per annum.The benefit will be provided for upto two pregnancies only.
required_documents: Passport-sized Photograph.Aadhaar Card.Residence Certificate from the Revenue Department.Income Certificate from the Revenue Department.Declaration/Undertaking (if any).Medical Certificate from a Competent Authority.﻿In the absence of an Aadhaar Card; the applicant is required to provide his/her Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with ANY ONE of the following documents - 1. Bank or Post Office Passbook with Photo.2. Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card.3. Passport.4. Ration Card.5. Voter Identity Card.6. MGNREGA Card.7. Kisan Photo Passbook.8. Driving license issued by the Licensing Authority under the Motor Vehicles Act

1988 (59 of 1988).9. Certificate of identity having a photo of such person issued by a Gazetted Officer or a Tehsildar on an official letterhead.10. Any other document as specified by the Department.﻿

faqs.question: Can an applicant below the age of 18 apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant should have attained the age of 18 years to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: How many pregnancies are considered for benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Benefits are provided for up to two pregnancies only.

faqs.question: What department oversees the "KULAVILAKKU" scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is managed by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Puducherry.

faqs.question: Can an applicant provide an Aadhaar Enrolment ID in place of an Aadhaar Card?
faqs.answer: Yes, an applicant can provide Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with specified alternative documents in the absence of an Aadhaar Card.

faqs.question: What is the maximum annual income for eligibility under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant's annual income should not exceed ₹24,000/-.

faqs.question: How can one track the status of their application?
faqs.answer: Application status can be tracked at https://edistrict.py.gov.in/User/TrackApplication.aspx.

faqs.question: What is the grievance redressal mechanism for the "KULAVILAKKU" scheme?
faqs.answer: Grievances can be addressed at https://wcd.py.gov.in/ta/central-public-grievance-redress-and-monitoring-system.

faqs.question: How is eligibility proven in the absence of an Aadhaar Card?
faqs.answer: In the absence of an Aadhaar Card, the applicant can provide Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with specified alternative documents like Bank Passbook or PAN Card.

faqs.question: What documents are required for scheme application?
faqs.answer: Required documents include a passport-sized photograph, Aadhaar Card, Residence Certificate, Income Certificate, Declaration/Undertaking, and a Medical Certificate.

faqs.question: When does the applicant become eligible for consideration under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant is considered only when she crosses seven months of pregnancy.

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance provided to eligible beneficiaries during pregnancy?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries receive ₹500/- during their pregnancies.

faqs.question: How many pregnancies are eligible for benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefit will be provided for up to two pregnancies only.

name: Financial Assistance For The Marriage Of Daughters Of Poor Widows And Orphan Girls
description: The scheme of "Financial Assistance for the Marriage of Daughters of Poor Widows and Orphan Girls" is the welfare scheme by the Government of National Capital Territory of Delhi to provide financial assistance to poor widows for performing the marriage of their daughters (up to two daughters) and to provide financial assistance to the guardians including Homes/Institutions or foster parents of an orphan girl or an orphan girl for her marriage. ﻿Note: This scheme was been transferred from the Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC/Min. to Social Welfare Department from the financial year 2006-07.
benefits: The quantum of Assistance is one-time ₹ 30
000/- up to two daughters only.
eligibility_criteria: Financial assistance can be granted for performing marriage up to two daughters only. Residence of a minimum of 5 years in Delhi before the date of application. The income of the applicant should be less than ₹ 1
000/-per year from all sources (including rent
interest/dividends on savings & investments
earnings from the farm
property sale proceeds

etc.) of the applicant. Applicant should have an Aadhar number The Applicant should have a single-operated Aadhaar-linked account with any bank in the NCT of Delhi only. The applicant should not be in receipt of any assistance from the discretionary fund of the Lt. Governor or the Chief Minister of Delhi for the same purpose. The girl whose marriage is to be solemnized should be major on the date of marriage i.e. above 18 years of age. The application must be submitted within a period of sixty days
before or after the date of the marriage being solemnized.
required_documents: The application shall contain the recommendation from the Member of the Legislative Assembly of the National Capital Territory of Delhi or the Member of Parliament of the area concerned. The following self-attested documents shall be scanned and uploaded/attached with the application:- In the case of the Widow applicant a copy of the death certificate of her husband issued by the Registrar- Births & Deaths; A copy of the Ration card or voter identity card or any proof of residence; A self-declaration with regard to the income of the applicant Age proof of the girl in the form of a school leaving certificate or date of birth certificate issued by the Registrar of Births & Deaths In the case of an orphan girl growing up on her own

an affidavit on stamp paper duly attested by a Metropolitan or Executive Magistrate or a Notary or a certificate from a Gazetted Officer to the effect that she is an orphan. In the case of a girl brought up by a guardian or foster parent or relative

such persons or guardians should submit the affidavits to the effect that the girl is an orphan and he/they have brought her up. A marriage invitation card for the marriage for which financial assistance is sought. Self-declaration to the effect that no financial assistance has been received by the applicant from any other Govt. organization
Non-Govt. organization
Municipal Corporation of Delhi or New Delhi Municipal Corporation

or any other statutory or non-statutory agency for this purpose. Aadhar Card Residence proof of last 5-year residence in Delhi. Bank account details (Single –operated Aadhar linked) in Delhi only. Bank passbook/statement for the last year. In the case of SC/ST applicants
a caste certificate in the name of the applicant issued by a competent authority

and in the case of minority applicants self-declaration of the religion of the applicant duly verified by the religious institution has to be submitted. One passport-size photo of the applicant. One photograph of the Marriage Ceremony.

faqs.question: Is Aadhaar Number Necessary For Applying For WDM?
faqs.answer: Yes, an Aadhaar number is mandatory for filling up the application- without the Aadhaar number, the application portal will not work.

faqs.question: What Kind Of Bank Account Is Required To Avail Of WDM Benefits?
faqs.answer: Single operated Aadhar-linked bank account of any bank in Delhi only.

faqs.question: What are documents required for residential proof for WDM benefits?
faqs.answer:
1. Widow as an applicant want to apply for the marriage of her girl under the scheme, then The Aadhaar card of the widow as the applicant is mandatory and the Aadhaar card of girl whose marriage is being performed is optional. 
2. Orphan Girl as applicant want to apply for her marriage under the scheme then the Aadhaar card of the orphan girl as the applicant is mandatory. 
3. Proof of Identify (anyone) 
• Voter ID card 
• Pan card 
• Driving License 
• Aadhar Card 
• Passport 
• Insurance Policy Documents 
• Electricity Bill/ Water Bill/ Telephone Bill/ Gas Connection receipt 
• Bank passbook 
• Caste Certificate issued in Delhi 
• Service identify card of public/private sector company/established concerned. 
• Property Document. 
• Any other document which clearly shows at least 5 years of residence in Delhi

faqs.question: What Are The Documents Required For Proof Of Age For A Girl Whose Marriage Is Being Performed?
faqs.answer:
• Birth Certificate issued by MCD/Registrar-Births & Deaths 
• School leaving certificate of class last attended 
• Matriculation/10th Certificate 
• Hospital discharge slip at the time of birth of the child 
• Voter ID card 
• Pan card 
• Driving License 
• Aadhar Card 
• Passport 
• Age assessment medical certificate 
• Any document issued by the Government/Govt. recognized body stating the date and place of birth

faqs.question: Can An Applicant Apply For Financial Assistance Under WDM Who Is Not A Resident Of Delhi?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for the residents of Delhi, residing for the last 5 years.

faqs.question: Is There Any Annual Income Limit For Getting Financial Assistance WDM Scheme?
faqs.answer: The income of the applicant should be less than Rs 1,00,000/ per year from all sources of the applicant.

faqs.question: What Is The Quantum Of Financial Assistance Under The WDM Scheme?
faqs.answer: Rs 30,000/- One time.

faqs.question: Is Any Recommendation Or Attestation Required?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application should be attested by Gazetted Officer or area MP/MLA.

faqs.question: Is There Any Verification Required Before Getting WDM Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer:
• Yes, the District Officer, WCD will verify the documents and if the required home visit will be done before sanctioning assistance or the beneficiary may be called for document verification in District Office (if needed). 
• SIR Report to be submitted on e-district at the district level.

faqs.question: What Is The Procedure To Change The Bank Account Details?
faqs.answer: Application to be given to the concerned District Office, WCD to change the Bank Account. However, Department is remitting Direct Benefit Transfer (Aadhar Based) payments. Payment of Widow Pension is remitted in Aadhar linked bank account only.

faqs.question: What Is The Procedure To Change The Address? If The Applicant Shifted Within Delhi.
faqs.answer: Application has to be given along with documentary proof of changed address to the concerned District W&CD Office.

faqs.question: Is There Any Provision For Punishment? If Anyone Tries To Get Financial Assistance Through Forged Documents.
faqs.answer: If the assistance was sanctioned on the furnishing of false documents, penal action will be initiated and appropriate liability levied against the beneficiary for furnishing false documents. Recovery of the amount shall also be done.

faqs.question: What Is The Prescribed Timeline Of Acceptance/ Rejection And Sanctioning For Payment Of The Application Form?
faqs.answer: 60 Days for sanction of application at the District Level.

faqs.question: How Can I Check My Aadhar Linking Status?
faqs.answer:
Follow the following steps 
Step 1: Go to https://uidai.gov.in 
Step 2: Choose Aadhar services 
Step 3: Choose Aadhaar Linking Status 
Step 4: Enter your 12-digit Aadhar number. 
Step 5: Enter Security Code and click on Send OTP 
Step 6: After receiving OTP on the registered mobile number, enter OTP. 
Details of Aadhar/bank lining status will be available as active and inactive status. 
 If your Aadhar linking status is seen as:
1)   Inactive: Kindly contact your concerned bank branch for further processing of Aadhar linking. 
2)   Active: Kindly inform the concerned District Office for further processing.

name: Marriage Assistance (O.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The “Marriage Assistance” scheme by the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Odisha, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this scheme, the Board shall provide marriage benefit to the unmarried female member on her marriage or marriage of two unmarried girl children who are of above 18 years of age subject to a minimum of one year as registered beneficiary. ﻿
benefits: Quantum of Assistance: ₹50
000/-.Note: Assistance shall be given for a maximum of two children.In case both spouses are registered beneficiaries
the benefit will be extended to one spouse only.﻿
eligibility_criteria: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:The applicant should be a resident of Odisha.The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.The applicant should not be a member of any other Welfare Fund established under any law.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:The applicant should be female.The applicant should be a registered member of the Odisha Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board or an unmarried girl child aged above 18 years of the member.The member should be registered for a period of one year or more under the board.
required_documents: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:Aadhaar Linked Bank Passbook Front Page Copy (Allowed file types: PNG
JPG
PDF. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).Passport Size Photo (Allowed type: PNG
JPG. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).Aadhaar Card (Allowed file types: PNG
JPG
PDF. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).Signature of Applicant (Allowed type: PNG
JPG. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).Employment certificate (Allowed file types: PNG
JPG

PDF. Allowed size: less than 500 KB).For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:Photograph of the Couple.Copy of the Money Receipt of Annual Contribution.Copy of the Marriage Certificate issued by the concerned Authority or Certificate by Sarpanch/ Chairman of Panchayat Samiti/ Zilla Parishad Member/ Municipal Counsellor/ Corporator/ Executive Officer of Local Bodies regarding solemnization of the marriage.An undertaking from the applicant ( Stating that either his/her spouse is not a registered beneficiary under the Board or if registered
his/her spouse has not applied for such benefit separately. In case
the spouse is a registered beneficiary
the registration number of the spouse should be mentioned).Any other documents if required.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for registration as a beneficiary under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Odisha?
faqs.answer: The building worker must be at least 18 years old and not older than 60 years old.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: Who is responsible for registering a worker as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: The District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors are acting as Registering Officers for the registration of beneficiaries under the Board.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Every building worker who is between the age of 18-60 years and who has been engaged in any building or other construction work for not less than 90 days during the preceding one year is eligible for registration as a beneficiary of the BOCW Welfare Board of Odisha.

faqs.question: Can Odia migrant workmen be registered as beneficiaries under the Odisha Building & Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, Odia migrant workmen engaged in building and other construction works in other states can be registered as beneficiaries under the Odisha Building & Other Construction Workers’ Welfare Board.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for applying for the registration?
faqs.answer:
To register as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board, an applicant worker should download Form-XXVII and attach all the mandatory documents (self attested, if required) and a fee of ₹20/- to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.
Alternatively, registration can also be done through the official website of the Odisha BOCWW Board: https://nirmanshramik.odisha.gov.in/obocwwb/public/cwLogin .

faqs.question: Is there a specific form for the registration through offline mode as a beneficiary under the BOCW Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application for registration must be made in Form-XXVII. You can obtain this form from the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors in your area.

faqs.question: How much is the fee associated with the registration process?
faqs.answer: The registration fee is ₹20/- which is payable during the registration.

faqs.question: What happens after I pay the application fee?
faqs.answer: After you pay the application fee of  ₹20/-, your application will be reviewed by the registering officer. The decision to approve or reject your application will be based on the merits of your application.

faqs.question: Who decides whether my application will be approved or rejected?
faqs.answer: The registering officer is responsible for deciding whether your application will be approved or rejected based on its merits.

faqs.question: Can my application be rejected even if I have paid the application fee?
faqs.answer: Yes, your application can be rejected even if you have paid the application fee. The final decision is made by the registering officer based on the merits of your application.

faqs.question: How much is the fee associated with the renewal of the registration?
faqs.answer: The renewal fee is ₹50/- which is payable during the renewal process of the registration.

faqs.question: What criteria must an applicant meet to be considered for this benefit?
faqs.answer: The benefit is available to unmarried female members or two unmarried girl children of the member who are above 18 years of age. To be eligible, the beneficiary must have been a registered member for a minimum of one year.

faqs.question: What kind of assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance provided under this scheme is ₹50,000/-.

faqs.question: How many children of a member can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers a maximum of two girl children per eligible female beneficiary.

faqs.question: What if the applicant is a woman and has indicated as married at the time of registration?
faqs.answer: If a woman applicant has indicated as married at the time of registration, she is not eligible to apply for marriage benefit for herself.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to how many times the marriage benefit can be availed?
faqs.answer: For self-marriage, the benefit can be availed by any beneficiary only once during her lifetime.

faqs.question: Can both spouses apply for the marriage benefit if they are both registered beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Yes, if both spouses are registered beneficiaries, either of them can apply for the marriage benefit.

faqs.question: What form needs to be used to apply for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: The application must be made in the prescribed Form-XLV. The form can be downloaded from https://bocboard.labdirodisha.gov.in/Building/homecontent/BeneficiaryForms/MARRIAGE%20ASSISTANCE%20FORM.pdf or can be collected from the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors of your area.

faqs.question: Where do I submit the application for this welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Application can be submitted online on: https://nirmanshramik.odisha.gov.in/obocwwb/public/cwLogin . Alternatively , the offline application for this welfare scheme should be submitted to the District Labour Officers (D.L.O)/ Asst. Labour Officers/ Rural Labour Inspectors in your area.

faqs.question: What happens if the application is rejected?
faqs.answer: In case of rejection, the applicants would be intimated about such rejection, with due intimation to the Board.

faqs.question: What are the consequences of submitting fraudulent documents for assistance?
faqs.answer: In case of receipt of assistance on the basis of fraudulent documents, the amount released towards any assistance would be recovered from the applicant under the provisions of the OPDR Act, and his/her membership would be ceased.

name: ARAVANAIPPU
description: The scheme "ARAVANAIPPU" is a financial assistance scheme by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Puducherry. This scheme aims to improve the status of the girl child and provide nutritious food; financial assistance of ₹1200 is offered to lactating mothers. The girl child of the applicant should be born after 1-4-2005. This assistance is provided only for upto two girl children.
benefits: ₹1200 financial assistance to lactating mothers.*The selection is periodical and depends on the availability of funds.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should be a native of Puducherry by virtue of birth or continuous residence of not less than five years.The applicant should have an annual family income not exceeding ₹24
000.The applicant should be at least 18 years old.The girl child of the applicant should be born after 1-4-2005.The assistance is provided only for two girl children.
required_documents: 1. Aadhaar Card.2. Residence Certificate from the Revenue Department.3. Income Certificate from the Revenue Department.4. Voter ID Card.5. Passport-sized Photograph.6. Declaration/Undertaking (if any).7. Birth Certificate of the Girl Child.﻿In the absence of an Aadhaar Card; the applicant is required to provide his/her Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with ANY ONE of the following documents - 1. Bank or Post Office Passbook with Photo.2. Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card.3. Passport.4. Ration Card.5. Voter Identity Card.6. MGNREGA Card.7. Kisan Photo Passbook.8. Driving license issued by the Licensing Authority under the Motor Vehicles Act
1988 (59 of 1988).9. Certificate of identity having a photo of such person issued by a Gazetted Officer or a Tehsildar on an official letterhead.10. Any other document as specified by the Department.

faqs.question: How can individuals contact the relevant authorities for queries?
faqs.answer: For queries, individuals can contact the Department of Women and Child Development at https://wcd.py.gov.in/contact-us.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum residency requirement for the applicant in Puducherry?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should have continuous residence in Puducherry for not less than five years.

faqs.question: Are there any exceptions to the annual family income criterion?
faqs.answer: No, the annual family income should not exceed ₹24,000 for an applicant to be eligible.

faqs.question: Can applicants appeal delays in regions other than Pondicherry?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants in Karaikal/Mahe/Yanam can contact the relevant Regional Administrator for grievance redressal.

faqs.question: What happens if the girl child's birthdate falls before 1-4-2005?
faqs.answer: The scheme applies only to girl children born after 1-4-2005; earlier births are not eligible.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the number of times financial assistance is provided?
faqs.answer: Assistance is provided periodically, and the number of times depends on the availability of funds.

faqs.question: Where can one raise concerns or seek assistance regarding delays?
faqs.answer: In case of delays, contact the Director, Department of Women and Child Development, Sithankudi, Pondicherry, or the relevant Regional Administrator.

faqs.question: What is the grievance redressal mechanism for the scheme?
faqs.answer: For grievance redressal, visit https://wcd.py.gov.in/ta/central-public-grievance-redress-and-monitoring-system.

faqs.question: What is the specified birthdate criterion for the girl child?
faqs.answer: The girl child of the applicant should be born after 1-4-2005 to be eligible for assistance.

faqs.question: Can non-residents of Puducherry avail of the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant must be a native of Puducherry by birth or continuous residence of not less than five years.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The applicant's annual family income should not exceed ₹24,000 to qualify for the scheme.

faqs.question: What are the key benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Lactating mothers receive ₹1200 financial assistance, and the selection is periodical based on fund availability.

faqs.question: Who administers the "ARAVANAIPPU" scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is administered by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Puducherry.

name: Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-II
description: The "Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-I" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme provides financial assistance to the orphan girls for their marriage. The bride should have completed 18 years of age at the time of marriage.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹25
000/-.One sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam. Mode of Disbursal: Through Electronic Clearing Service.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a girl. The applicant should be an orphan. The bride should be 18 years or above at the time of marriage. The applicant should have a degree passed from regular colleges
distance education/government-recognized open university.The applicant should have a diploma passed from the Institution recognized by the Directorate of Technical Education
Government of Tamil Nadu.
required_documents: 1. Death Certificate of Father & Mother or Orphan Certificate (Issued by a Member of Parliament (MP)/ Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA)).2. Income Certificate from Tahsildar.3. Marriage Invitation.4. Age Proof of the Bride.5. Bride’s Photograph.6. Bills towards the Purchase of Marriage Articles for ₹1
000/-.7. Any other document as required by the Department.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls?
faqs.answer: The objective is to provide financial assistance to orphan girls for their marriage.

faqs.question: What assistance is provided under scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹50,000 is provided through Electronic Clearing Service along with 1 Sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit for eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit for eligibility.

faqs.question: What is the time limit for submitting an application before the marriage date?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted 40 days before the marriage date. In exceptional circumstances, it can be submitted one day prior to the marriage date.

faqs.question: Who should be contacted for assistance regarding this scheme?
faqs.answer: District Social Welfare Officers and Extension Officers (Social Welfare) should be contacted for assistance.

faqs.question: What is the probable time limit for processing applications?
