000/- during the period of maternityPayable for up to two adult daughters of registered workers.﻿
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Arunachal Pradesh.The applicant should be a woman.The woman worker must be employed in the Building and Other Construction works.The woman worker should be registered with Labour Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).The applicant's membership must be active at the time of application.﻿Note: The woman worker is not to be entitled to the benefits in case of second marriage.﻿
required_documents: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card
Voter ID card
etc.Xerox copy of the registration cardMedical CertificateBank Account number/ front page of the passbookComplete application formPassport-size photographsAddress proof

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to mitigate the suffering of women in the course of delivery and to supplement well upbringing of the infant.

faqs.question: By which department was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: Department of Labour and Employment, Government of Arunachal Pradesh

faqs.question: What is the full form of APB&OCWWB?
faqs.answer: Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

faqs.question: What is the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Cash assistance of ₹1000/- during the period of maternity will be paid to the registered women worker under Board.

faqs.question: Who is eligible under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The women workers employed in the Building and Other Construction works who are registered under APB&OCWWB are eligible to take benefit of the scheme.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to register under Board as a labour/worker?
faqs.answer: Yes, the labour/worker must be registered under the Board to take benefits of the scheme.

faqs.question: Can I also apply for the scheme if my membership has expired?
faqs.answer: No, membership must be active at the time of application.

faqs.question: Am I eligible for the scheme after my second marriage?
faqs.answer: No, after the second marriage, the woman worker is not to be entitled to the benefit under this scheme.

faqs.question: How can I register myself under the Board?
faqs.answer: The applicant needs to visit the nearest Registered Office of the District/Sub-Division, APB&OCWWB for registration under Board.

faqs.question: Can I also get the application form online for registration?
faqs.answer: Yes, an Offline Mode of application form to register as a labour/worker under the Board can also be downloaded from the official website of the Labour Welfare Board, Department of Labour and Employment.

name: West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Maternity Benefit
description: The “West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme: Maternity Benefit” by the Labour Department, West Bengal, provides financial assistance to a beneficiary on successful delivery of a child or miscarriage by such beneficiary or his wife. The benefit is limited to two instances per beneficiary to promote maternal health and provide support during critical times.﻿
benefits: Financial Assistance: ₹6
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be between 18 and 60 years of age at the time of enrolment.The applicant must be an unorganized worker employed in the operation of commercial vehicles
such as cars
taxis
luxury taxis
light commercial vehicles
vans
auto-rickshaws
tempos
lorries
trucks
or buses.The applicant’s vehicle must be used for commercial purposes and not solely for personal or family use.
required_documents: For New Registration:Certification by Prescribed Authority in the Prescribed format

Passport Size Photo (self and for each dependent member).Age Proof Document.Driving Licence in case of Drivers.EPIC/ AADHAR Card.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:Certificate from a registered Medical Practitioner.Any other documents (if required).

faqs.question: What is the “Maternity Benefit” scheme under the “West Bengal Transport Workers’ Social Security Scheme”?
faqs.answer: The “Maternity Benefit” Scheme is a government initiative that provides financial assistance of ₹6,000/- to beneficiaries for childbirth or miscarriage to support maternal and child health.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is available to pregnant women or their spouses who meet the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: How many times can a beneficiary avail of the scheme?
faqs.answer: A beneficiary can avail of the financial assistance a maximum of 2 times, either for childbirth or miscarriage.

faqs.question: Does the scheme provide benefits for miscarriages?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme provides financial support for miscarriages, subject to the submission of a valid medical certificate from a registered medical practitioner.

faqs.question: How can a beneficiary apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries can apply for the scheme through the online e-District portal.

faqs.question: Is there an income limit to qualify for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no income limit to qualify for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can both spouses claim the benefit separately?
faqs.answer: No, the financial assistance is granted to the family and can only be claimed by one beneficiary per instance.

faqs.question: What is the process to obtain a medical certificate?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries must visit a registered medical practitioner who will issue the required certificate confirming childbirth or miscarriage.

name: Theka Shramik, Gharelu Mahila Kamgar Evan Hamal Shramik Prasuti Sahayta Yojana
description: Labor Department of Chhattisgarh State started this scheme "Theka Shramik, Gharelu Mahila Kamgar Evan Hamal Shramik Prasuti Sahayta Yojana" for unorganized worker on 05 June 2018. The main objective of the scheme to provide pregnancy care.
benefits: Female employees will receive a financial assistance of ₹4
200 in the third month of pregnancy and ₹2
800 in the eighth month of pregnancy as maternity benefit.Male employees will receive a financial assistance of ₹3
000 as paternity leave after the birth of the child.
eligibility_criteria: Applicant(Male or Female) must be registered worker.Benefits will be provided only for two children.
required_documents: Aadhar card.Labor registration Card.Permanent Residence Certificate.Copy of ration card.

faqs.question: What is this scheme ?
faqs.answer: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "Theka Shramik, Gharelu Mahila Kamgar Evan Hamal Shramik Prasuti Sahayta Yojana" for unorganized worker on 11 March 2015.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective of the scheme to provide financial assistance to the women during their pregnancy period.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance during pregnancy.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits?
faqs.answer: All eligible unorganized worker from Chhattisgarh State.

faqs.question: What is the eligible age to get the benefits?
faqs.answer: Applicant must be between 18 and 60 years old.

faqs.question: For how many children can it be availed?
faqs.answer: Benefits will be provided only for two children.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicant must be registered under "Chhattisgarh Unorganized Workers State Social Security Board". Only than applicant can apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: How can applicant register under Chhattisgarh Unorganized Workers State Social Security Board" ?
faqs.answer:
1. All the applicant have to visit the official website Chhattisgarh Labour Department. 
2. On the home page click on "Apply" under "Chhattisgarh Unorganized Workers State Social Security Board". 
3. Enter the following details, 
Select Group Name : "Asangathit Marmakaar Mandal" 
Select Service : "Asangathit Shramik Panjikaran" 
What do you want to do :  "Aavedan"Click next.
4. Check the eligibility criteria for registration in Chhattisgarh Unorganized Workers State Social Security Board and click next. 
5. Fill out the online "Registration form".
6. Submit.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer:
1. All the applicant have to visit the official website Chhattisgarh Labour Department. 
2. On the home page click on "Apply" under "Chhattisgarh Unorganized Workers State Social Security Board". 
3. Provide the required details.
4. Fill out the application form.
5. Submit.

faqs.question: What is the official website to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: URL : https://cglabour.nic.in/

name: SERB - POWER Fellowship
description: SERB - POWER (Promoting Opportunities For Women in Exploratory Research) Fellowship was launched by the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India to mitigate gender disparity in science and engineering research funding in various S&T programs in Indian academic institutions and R&D Laboratories. The fellowship is aimed to enhance diversity in research to ensure equal access and weighted opportunities for Indian women scientists engaged in research and development activities.Objectives:The fellowship is designed to identify and reward excellent women researchers in Indian academic institutions and R&D laboratories, holding Ph.D. degrees in any branch of science and engineering.Duration of Fellowship:Fellowship duration will be fixed for three years, without the possibility of extension.Successful POWER Fellows cannot be re-nominated for the second time.
benefits: Fellowship of ₹15
000/- per month in addition to regular income.Research grant of ₹10 Lakhs per annum. Research grants can be used for minor equipment
research personnel
consumables
contingencies
and domestic travel.Overheads for the host institute.
eligibility_criteria: The nominee should be an active woman scientist with an excellent record of research performance as an independent investigator.The nominee should be an outstanding woman researcher and innovator working in Indian academic institutions and R&D laboratories

holding Ph.D. degrees in any branch of science and engineering.The nominee should be in regular service throughout the duration of the Fellowship.The nominee should be an Indian citizen between 35-55 years of age working in institutions in India.The nominee should not be receiving any other fellowships from Government sources during the tenure.
required_documents: 1.	Identity proof of candidate2.	Passport size photograph3.	Proof of age4.	Educational Qualifications certificates5.	Details of Professional awards/recognition/fellowship6.	Bank Details (Bank Account Number
Name of the Bank
Bank Branch
and IFSC Code)7.	Any other document
as required

faqs.question: Who is eligible for SERB Power Fellowship?
faqs.answer:
Those who are eligible for SERB Power Fellowship are:

Outstanding women researchers and innovators working in Indian academic institutions and R&D laboratories, holding Ph.D. degrees in any branch of science and engineering.
The nominee should be an active scientist with an excellent record of research performance as an independent investigator or innovator.
The nominee should be in regular service throughout the duration of the Fellowship.

faqs.question: Is there any age limit for PI to be eligible for the award?
faqs.answer: PI should be within 35-55 years at the time of submission of proposal.

faqs.question: I am already availing another Fellowship. Am I eligible for SERB Power Fellowship?
faqs.answer: No, you can avail only one fellowship at a time from government source.

faqs.question: Is the Fellowship received under SERB Power Fellowship taxable?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Fellowship received under SERB Power Fellowship is taxable as per I.T. rules.

faqs.question: What are the areas covered under SERB Power Fellowship?
faqs.answer: All Areas of Science (in the broadest terms) are covered by this Fellowship.

faqs.question: What is the nature of support the SERB Power Fellow is entitled for?
faqs.answer:
Nature of Support SERB Power Fellow is entitled for are:

Fellowship of ₹15,000/- per month in addition to regular income.
Research grant of ₹ 10 lakhs per annum.
Overhead for the institute.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the SERB Power Fellowship?
faqs.answer: The SERB Power Fellowship duration is for 3 years only, without any possibility of extension.

faqs.question: How many times a person can avail SERB Power Fellowship?
faqs.answer: A person can avail SERB Power Fellowship only once. Successful POWER Fellows cannot be nominated for a second time.

faqs.question: When can a person apply for the SERB Power Fellowship? What is the last date of acceptance of the application?
faqs.answer: The nominations for the SERB Power Fellowship are accepted throughout the year through online portal only(www.serbonline.in) and there is no last date of acceptance of the nomination.

faqs.question: Who can nominate for SERB Power Fellowship?
faqs.answer: Heads of Institutions or Fellows of National academies can send the nominations.

faqs.question: How does a SERB Power Fellow get her subsequent Grant?
faqs.answer: The Grant for the subsequent years is released after receiving the two hard copies of Statement of Expenditure (SE) and Utilization Certificate (UC)in the prescribed format (available in the website). The SE and UC are to be submitted financial year wise i.e. from 01stApril to 31stMarch. For the first year it would be from the Date of Start (DOS) to 31stMarch and subsequently from 01stApril to 31stMarch.

faqs.question: Can a fellow change the host institute during implementation of SERB Power Fellowship?
faqs.answer: A SERB Power fellow can change the host institute during implementation of SERB Power Fellowship. She has to forward NOCs from both the Institutes along with final financial papers indicating balance unspent grant from the old institute, undertaking certificate and appointment letter from the new Institute indicating the joining date and duration of the appointment.

faqs.question: Is there a provision for extension of the fellowship?
faqs.answer: No, there is no provision for extension.

faqs.question: What is the selection criteria of POWER Fellowship?
faqs.answer: Selection of POWER Fellows will be made twice a year by a specially constituted Search-cum-Selection Committee.

faqs.question: Under which heads research grant can be used?
faqs.answer: Research Grant of ₹10 lakh per annum can be used for minor equipment, research personnel, consumables, contingencies, and domestic travel.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to apply for a SERB Power Fellowship?
faqs.answer: In first step, an applicant will fill the application form on online portal. After submission of the form, a mail containing a link will be sent to the nominator by SERB. In second step, nominator will click on the link as provided in the mail to find the details of the application. After verification of the details he/she will forward the nomination to SERB.

faqs.question: Can SERB POWER Fellowship research grant be used for international travel?
faqs.answer: No, SERB POWER Fellowship research grant can not be used for international travel.

faqs.question: I am away from my institute/university for more than 6 weeks. Do I have to take permission from SERB?
faqs.answer: Yes, you have to take permission from SERB.

faqs.question: I am a SERB-POWER fellow, and I am visiting abroad for more than 8 weeks. Can I avail the fellowship amount and research grant for my duration of visit?
faqs.answer: The PI will not be eligible to avail the fellowship amount or receive the research grant and overhead charges under SERB POWER Fellowship during the tenure of visit (if no student is drawing fellowship/salary/emoluments from the project).

faqs.question: I am travelling abroad to attend a conference. Can I use the research grant for the travel expense?
faqs.answer: The travel expenses related to foreign assignment will not be covered from the research grant under the SERB POWER Fellowship.

faqs.question: I am a SERB POWER fellow, and I am planning to visit abroad for a certain period as part of one collaboration work. Can I get an extension for that period after the completion of the project?
faqs.answer: The PI will not be allowed any kind of extension based on the claimed visit in the SERB POWER Fellowship.

name: Mahila Kisan Yojana (Maharashtra)
description: The scheme "Mahila Kisan Yojana" is implemented by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Government of Maharashtra, in collaboration with the National Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (NSFDC). The scheme aims to uplift the lifestyle of economically disadvantaged Charmakar communities (such as Dhor, Chambhar, Holar, and Mochi). The scheme promotes educational, economic, and social development to ensure a respectable place in society. Additionally, it supports the production and sale of various types of footwear and leather articles to government departments and the open market.
benefits: Total Loan Amount: The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹50
000 for eligible female beneficiaries.Subsidy Provided: A subsidy of ₹10
000 is granted
reducing the effective loan burden on the beneficiaryLoan Component: The remaining ₹40
000 is provided as a loan with an affordable interest rate of 5% per annum.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Maharashtra.The applicant should be a female.The applicant should belong to the Charmakar Community.The applicant's age should be between 18 to 50 years.The applicant must have knowledge of the business for which they are applying for a loan.The applicant must have her own name
or joint name with her husband
or her husband’s name (with affidavit) on the 7/12 land extract for agricultural project loans.For the 50% Subsidy Scheme and Margin Money
her annual income must be below the poverty line.For the NSFDC Scheme
the income limit is ₹98
000 for rural areas and ₹1
000 for urban areas.
required_documents: Completed application form from the LIDCOM District Office.Recent passport-size photograph.Valid Income Certificate (issued by an authorized government officer).Caste Certificate (Charmakar Community).Proof of Residence (Maharashtra).7/12 Land Extract:Applicant’s name
joint name with husband
or husband’s name (with affidavit) for agricultural loans.Knowledge or experience proof relevant to the proposed business/project.

faqs.question: What is the Mahila Kisan Yojana?
faqs.answer: It is a scheme aimed at economically empowering the Charmakar community through financial assistance for agricultural projects.

faqs.question: Who can apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Female beneficiaries of the Charmakar Community aged 18 to 50 years.

faqs.question: What is the total loan amount available under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A total loan amount of ₹50,000 is available.

faqs.question: What portion of the loan is subsidized?
faqs.answer: ₹10,000 of the loan amount is provided as a subsidy.

faqs.question: What is the interest rate on the loan?
faqs.answer: The interest rate is set at 5% per annum for the loan component.

faqs.question: What are the income criteria for applicants?
faqs.answer: Annual income must be below poverty line for the subsidy scheme, and below ₹98,000 in rural areas or ₹1,20,000 in urban areas for NSFDC Scheme.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply?
faqs.answer: Income Certificate, Caste Certificate, 7/12 land extract, and a completed application form.

faqs.question: Where can I obtain the application form?
faqs.answer: The application form can be obtained at the District Office of LIDCOM.

faqs.question: How do I submit my application?
faqs.answer: Submit the completed application form along with required documents at the District Office of LIDCOM.

faqs.question: Is there a specific deadline for submitting applications?
faqs.answer: Applicants should check with the District Office for any specific deadlines.

faqs.question: What happens after I submit my application?
faqs.answer: You will receive an acknowledgment receipt from the District Office.

name: Gaon Ki Beti
description: This scheme aims to provide financial assistance to talented girls from rural areas to encourage them to pursue higher education. It seeks to motivate young girls to continue their studies and build a bright future.
benefits: Each year

girls who pass the 12th standard with first-class marks from a village will be eligible.Selected students will receive a scholarship of ₹500/- per month.The scholarship will be provided for a maximum of 10 months per year.
eligibility_criteria: The student must have secured 60% or more marks in the 12th standard.The girl must reside in a rural area and possess a "Gaon Ki Beti" (Daughter of the Village) certificate.She must be enrolled in a recognized institution for higher education.﻿
required_documents: Class 12 marksheet.Age certificate.Domicile certificate.Caste certificate.Income certificate of parents.Village daughter certificate.Samagra ID.Current college code and branch code.Mobile number and email id of the candidate.Passport-size photograph of the candidate.﻿

faqs.question: What is Madhya Pradhesh Goan ki Beti Scheme ?
faqs.answer: Madhya Pradhesh Gaon Ki Beti Yojna scholarship is an initiative to support the education of girl children from rural areas.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme ?
faqs.answer:
1. Provide financial assistance to girls in rural areas.
2. Encourage girls to pursue higher education.

faqs.question: What is benefits amount under the scheme ?
faqs.answer: Every year, the girl students who pass class 12th in first division from each village are given scholarships at the rate of Rs.500 per month for 10 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme ?
faqs.answer: The girl Student should have secured 60% or more marks in the 12th examination and living in a rural area.

faqs.question: Is this scheme for girl's students only ?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for the girl's students.

faqs.question: May Other state gild student apply ?
faqs.answer: No. This is only for Madhya Pradesh Girl Student.

faqs.question: What is the minimum marks required in 12th standard ?
faqs.answer: Minimum marks should be 60% in 12th standard.

faqs.question: May Urban Areas girl student  apply ?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only for rural areas.

faqs.question: What is the application process ?
faqs.answer:
1. First applicant needs to register herself.
2. Then log in again with credentials and complete the application process.

faqs.question: What documents are required ?
faqs.answer:
1. Class 12 marksheet.
2. Age certificate.
3. Domicile certificate.
4. Caste certificate.
5. Income certificate of parents.
6. Village daughter certificate.
7. Samagra ID.
8. Current college code and branch code.
9. Mobile number and email id of the candidate.
10. Passport-size photograph of the candidate.

name: Mamata Scheme
description: In order to improve the process in curbing the high rate of mortality and infant mortality rate, the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Odisha introduced a scheme named "MAMATA" - a conditional cash transfer maternity benefit scheme in 2011. Aim of the scheme:Contribute in reducing the maternal and infant mortality.Improve the health and nutrition status of pregnant and lactating mother and their infants.Objectives of the scheme:To provide partial wage loss compensation for the pregnant and nursing mothers with the aim to provide complete rest before and after the child birth.Increase in utilization of child health services especially immunization. Improve mother and child care practices.
benefits: Rs.3

000 shall be given during the third trimester of the pregnancy of the mother till delivery on completing the following 5 conditions:Pregnancy registered at AWC/Mini AWCReceived at least 2 antenatal checkup (ANC)Received IFA and calcium tablets.Received at least 1 TT vaccination (out of optimal 2)Received at least 1 counselling session at AWC/Village Health/ Home Visit.The first 4 conditions shall be verified from MCP Card. On completing the above requirements first instalment shall be released. Rs.2

000 shall be after completion of 10 months after delivery on fulfilment of following conditions:Child birth is registered at AWC or HSC. Child has received BCG vaccination.Child has received Pentavalent 1 & 2 & 3 vaccinations. Child has received Polio 1 & 2 & 3 vaccinations.Child has received Rotavirus 1 & 2 & 3 vaccinations.Child has received Measles vaccine before attaining 1 year of age.Child has received Vitamin-A first dose before attaining 1 year of ageMother has attended at least six Growth Monitoring and IYCF counselling sessions after delivery till 9 monthsChild has been exclusively breastfed for first six months (self-certification by the beneficiary)Child has been introduced to complementary food on completion of six months of age (self- certification by the beneficiary)Child is being fed age-appropriate complementary feeding and continuing (self- certification by the beneficiary)Note: Overall
Rs.5
000 in two instalments as incentive is provided to mothers.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Odisha.The scheme is primarily aimed at pregnant women. Pregnant & Lactating women of 19 years of age and above for the first two live births
except all Government/Public Sector Undertakings (Central and State) employees and their wives will be covered.
required_documents: Proof of Identity (any 1 of the following):Aadhar CardVoter IDPassportPAN CardProof of Residence (any 1 of the following):Ration CardUtility Bill (Electricity
Water

Gas)Rent Agreement or Property Tax ReceiptProof of Pregnancy:Medical Certificate or Pregnancy Record from a government health center or Anganwadi centerIncome Certificate:Certificate issued by a government authority proving your family's income (if income criteria apply)Bank Account Details:Bank passbook or a recent bank statement for the account where the financial assistance will be creditedAadhaar Enrollment Slip or Acknowledgement (if Aadhaar card is not yet received)Photographs:Recent passport-sized photographs of the applicantMaternity Record:Maternity registration record or any relevant documents from health services.Previous Beneficiary Status (if applicable):Any documentation if you have received benefits from similar schemes previously.﻿

faqs.question: Is this scheme a Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Are applications for this scheme open throughout the year?
faqs.answer: Yes.

faqs.question: Where the beneficiaries will register?
faqs.answer: Pregnancy registered at the AWC/Mini AWC.

faqs.question: What is the First Instalment?
Waht is Second Instalment?
How many antenatal check-up(ANC)?
faqs.answer: Received at least 2 by ANM by using MCP Card and Mother andChild Tracking System(MCTS)/Reproductive and Child Helath System(RCHS).

faqs.question: How to Receive IFA tablets?
faqs.answer: Through ANM  by using MCP Card and MCTS/RCHS.

faqs.question: how to get counseling session?
faqs.answer: Receive at least one counseling session at the AWC/Village Health and Nutrition Day (VHND)/Home Visit by Scheme and ICDS Register.

faqs.question: How to get Child BCG vaccination?
faqs.answer: By ANM through MCP Card, MCTS/RCHS.

faqs.question: How to get Child  Polio-1 & 2 & 3 vaccination?
faqs.answer: By ANM through MCP Card, MCTS/RCHS.

faqs.question: How to get Child Rotavirus 1 & 2 & 3 vaccinations?
faqs.answer: By ANM through MCP Card, MCTS/RCHS.

faqs.question: How to receive Child Mealses vaccine before attaining 1 year of age?
faqs.answer: By ANM through MCP Card, MCTS/RCHS.

faqs.question: How to get more details about Mamata Scheme?
faqs.answer: To get more details, Please visit https://wcd.odisha.gov.in/ICDS/mamata

name: Marriage Assistance (K.B.O.C.W.W.B)
description: The "Maternity Benefit/Delivery Assistance'' by the BOCW Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Karnataka, is a welfare scheme for the registered workers of the board. Under this Scheme, financial support shall be provided to registered construction workers who have one (1) year of membership with the Board before the marriage, to cover expenses for either their own marriage or their two (2) dependent children's marriages.﻿
benefits: Financial Assistance: ₹60
000/- for the worker's own marriage or their two (2) dependent children's marriages.Note: The family of a registered construction worker can avail this assistance only twice
However
there shall be only one claim in respect of a given marriage irrespective of the number of registered construction workers in the family.﻿
eligibility_criteria: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker (Unorganised Worker).The applicant should be a minimum of 18 years of age.The applicant should have engaged in building and construction work for at least 90 days in a given year.For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:The applicant should be a registered construction worker Under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Karnataka or a dependent child of the worker.The membership with the Board should be at least one (1) year before the marriage.The family can avail of this assistance only twice.The son or daughter must be of legal age for marriage.
required_documents: For Registration as a Building/ Construction Worker:Employment Certificate/90 Days Work Certificate (Form V(A)/V(B)/V(C)/V(D)).Aadhar Card (Self-Attested).Ration Card(non-mandatory).Age Proof (Voter ID Card/Aadhar Card).For the Application of the Welfare Scheme:Beneficiary/original Identity card (Issued by the board).Employment Certificate.Bank Account details.Marriage Certificate by Registrar of the marriage.Marriage Invitation Card.Affidavit if marriage is outside of Karnataka state.Ration Card.For the Renewal Process:Employment Certificate/90 Days Work Certificate (Form V(A)/V(B)/V(C)/V(D)).

faqs.question: Who can register as a beneficiary under the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Karnataka?
faqs.answer: Any construction worker whose age is minimum 18 years of age and has worked in any construction work for a minimum of 90 days in a year, are eligible to register as a beneficiary under the Board.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum service requirement to register as a beneficiary?
faqs.answer: Yes, the building worker must have completed 90 days of service as a building worker in the preceding 12 months.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the welfare scheme?
faqs.answer: Any registered worker of the Board can apply for the welfare scheme.

faqs.question: What are the mandatory documents for the registration?
faqs.answer: The documents required for registration are: Employment Certificate (Form V(A)/V(B)/V(C)/V(D)), Aadhar Card (Self-Attested), Ration Card(non-mandatory), Age Proof (one of them Example: Voter ID Card, Aadhar Card).

faqs.question: How often must a construction worker renew their registration with the Karnataka Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: A construction worker must renew their registration every 3 years.

faqs.question: What happens if a worker doesn't renew their registration within the 3-year period?
faqs.answer: If a worker doesn't renew their registration within the 3-year period, they are granted a 1-year grace period to complete the renewal.

faqs.question: What happens if a worker doesn't renew their registration during the grace period?
faqs.answer: If the worker fails to renew their registration during the 1-year grace period, their registration will become invalid.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee required for the registration under the Karnataka Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: No, as per the guidelines, there is no fee required for the registration.

faqs.question: How to enroll as a beneficiary under the Karnataka Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Applicants can visit the official Website of Karnataka Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (KBOCWWB) to enroll themselves as a beneficiary under the board: https://kbocwwb.karnataka.gov.in/login

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the “Marriage Assistance” scheme?
faqs.answer: To be eligible, the applicant must be a registered construction worker under Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of Karnataka with at least one (1) year before the marriage for which assistance is sought. Dependent children of the worker are also eligible for this assistance.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided under the Marriage Assistance scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, ₹60,000/- is provided to help with marriage expenses.

faqs.question: Can the assistance be used for multiple marriages?
faqs.answer: The assistance can be claimed only once per marriage. A family can avail of this support twice in total.

faqs.question: What is the minimum registration period required to apply for assistance?
faqs.answer: The worker must be registered for at least one year before applying for assistance.

faqs.question: Are there any age restrictions for children's marriage?
faqs.answer: Yes, the son or daughter must have reached the legal age for marriage i.e. 18 years for women and 21 years for men.

faqs.question: How to apply for the assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants should visit the official Website of Karnataka Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (JKBOCWWB) to avail the assistance under this scheme: https://kbocwwb.karnataka.gov.in/login

name: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme (Jammu and Kashmir)
description: Launched on 15th August 1995, the "Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme" is a welfare scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir. The scheme provides ₹1,000/- per month to widows aged 40 and above from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families. The pension is funded 70% by the Centre and 30% by the Union Territory.
benefits: The widow will receive a monthly pension of ₹1
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Jammu and Kashmir.The applicant should be a widow.The widow's age should be 40 years or older.The widow should belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.The applicant should not be receiving pension benefits under any other social security scheme.
required_documents: Aadhaar Card Passport-size PhotographIdentity Proof (e.g.
Voter ID Card

Driving License)Proof of AgeBelow Poverty Line (BPL) Card / Ration CardCaste Certificate (if applicable)Address ProofDeath Certificate of the husbandBank passbook / Bank account detailsAny other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the main benefit of the Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme?
faqs.answer: It provides a monthly pension of ₹1000 to widows aged 40 years and above from BPL families.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Widows who are residents of Jammu and Kashmir and belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.

faqs.question: What is the age criterion for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant must be 40 years or older.

faqs.question: How is the pension disbursed once approved?
faqs.answer: The pension is disbursed either through a bank transfer or by money order.

faqs.question: What is NSAP?
faqs.answer: NSAP (National Social Assistance Programme) is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme aimed at providing social assistance to the vulnerable sections of society.

faqs.question: When was NSAP launched?
faqs.answer: NSAP was launched on 15th August 1995 to support economically disadvantaged individuals.

faqs.question: How is the widow pension scheme funded?
faqs.answer: The scheme is funded 70% by the Central Government and 30% by the State Government.

faqs.question: What amount is provided as a pension under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A monthly pension of ₹1000 is provided to eligible widows.

faqs.question: Is the scheme only for rural areas?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is implemented in both rural and urban areas.

faqs.question: What is the role of the District Level Committee?
faqs.answer: The District Level Committee, headed by the District Development Commissioner, reviews and sanctions the applications

name: Mukhyamantri - Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana
description: The "Mukhyamantri - Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana" scheme was launched by the Women and Child Development Department, Government of Maharashtra. The scheme aims to give economic freedom to women in the state age group of 21 to 65 years, improving their health and nutrition and strengthening their decisive role in the family. The women will get a financial benefit of ₹1,500/- through direct benefit transfer (DBT).
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹1
500/- per month.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a female.The applicant should be a resident of Maharashtra state.The applicant's age should be between 21-65 years.The applicant should have their bank account with an Aadhaar link.The annual income of the applicant's family should not exceed ₹2
000/-. Outsourced employees
voluntary workers
and contract workers with income up to ₹2
000/- are eligible.The applicant should be any one of the following:Married Woman Widowed Divorced WomanAbandoned and Destitute Women One Unmarried Woman in the family
required_documents: Photograph of the Beneficiary WomanAadhaar CardDomicile Certificate (If the Domicile Certificate is not available
any one of the following can be submitted: Ration Card issued before 15 years
Voter ID card issued before 15 years
Birth Certificate
or School Leaving Certificate).For Women Born Abroad (Submit the Husband's Ration Card issued before 15 years
Voter ID card issued before 15 years
Birth Certificate
School Leaving Certificate

or Domicile Certificate).Income Certificate (Not required if the woman has a Yellow or Orange Ration Card. Required if the woman has a White Ration Card or no Ration Card).Marriage Certificate (If your name is not listed on the Ration Card and you are newly married
your husband’s Ration Card can be used as proof of income)Bank Account Details (account should be Aadhaar-linked)Affirmation Letter

faqs.question: What is the Mukhyamantri - Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana?
faqs.answer: This scheme is aimed at providing financial and social support to economically weaker women in Maharashtra, especially those facing hardships.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Women who are residents of Maharashtra and belong to economically weaker sections are eligible, provided they meet the scheme's specific criteria.

faqs.question: Is there any fee to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the application process is free of charge. No money or fee should be paid to anyone for applying.

faqs.question: How will I know if I am selected for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Selected beneficiaries will receive an SMS notification. The final list of beneficiaries will also be published at the local level.

faqs.question: How are the benefits disbursed?
faqs.answer: Benefits are disbursed through direct bank transfers to the beneficiaries' accounts.

faqs.question: Is there a helpline for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the women's helpline toll-free contact number is 181. The Women and Child Development Commissionerate Pune will set up a call center to assist applicants and resolve any issues related to the scheme.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applications can be submitted online through the official portal. You must register on the portal, complete your profile, and fill out the application form with all the required details and documents.

faqs.question: What documents are required for the application?
faqs.answer: Essential documents include an Aadhaar card, domicile certificate, income certificate, marriage certificate, and bank account details. Additional documents may be required depending on the specific circumstances of the applicant.

faqs.question: What is the process after submitting the application?
faqs.answer: After submission, applications are scrutinized by a Taluka/Ward level committee, and a provisional list of eligible beneficiaries is prepared. Applicants will be notified via SMS.

faqs.question: Who reviews the applications at the local level?
faqs.answer: Applications are reviewed by a Taluka/Ward level committee, which includes non-governmental members selected by the district's guardian minister.

name: Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme - II
description: The scheme "Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme - II" was launched by the Social Welfare and Nutritious Meal Programme Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide assistance of ₹50,000/- to poor parents in getting their daughters married and to promote the educational status of poor girls. The bride should have completed 18 years of age at the time of marriage.﻿
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹50
000/-.One sovereign (4gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam. NOTE: The benefit will be given in the bride's mother or father's name. In case of the death of the parents
it will be given to the bride.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a girl.The bride should be 18 years or above at the time of marriage.The bride should be a degree holder from a regular college
Distance Education / Government recognized Open University Or diploma holder should have qualified from Institutions recognized by the Directorate of Technical Education
Government of Tamil Nadu.The bride's family income should not exceed ₹24
000/- per annum. The assistance is given to only one girl in a family.
required_documents: Copy of School Transfer Certificate.Copy of Degree / Diploma Certificate.Income Certificate.Marriage Invitation.

faqs.question: What is the Moovalur Ramamirtham Ammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme?
faqs.answer: It is a scheme designed to assist poor parents in getting their daughters married and to promote the educational status of poor girls.

faqs.question: What kind of assistance is provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Scheme-II provides ₹50,000 and a 4 gm (½ sovereign) 22-carat gold coin.

faqs.question: Can multiple daughters from the same family benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only one girl from a family is eligible for the benefit.

faqs.question: When should the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted within 40 days before the date of the marriage. In exceptional circumstances, applications can be accepted up to one day before the marriage.

faqs.question: How long does it take to process the application?
faqs.answer: The application is processed within 15 days from the date of receipt.

faqs.question: Will belated applications be accepted?
faqs.answer: No, applications received on or after the date of marriage will not be entertained.

faqs.question: Where should grievances be reported?
faqs.answer: At the district level: District Collector or District Social Welfare Officer. At the state level: Director of Social Welfare, Chennai.

faqs.question: Is there any upper age limit for the bride to be eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no upper age limit.

faqs.question: Is the scheme applicable to brides from all communities?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is intended to assist poor families regardless of community, provided they meet the eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Can a bride apply for both Scheme-I and Scheme-II?
faqs.answer: No, the bride can only apply for one of the schemes based on her educational qualifications.

faqs.question: Can the scheme benefit be transferred to someone else in the family?
faqs.answer: No, the benefit is strictly for the bride's parents or the bride herself if the parents are deceased.

name: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme- Bihar
description: The scheme "Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme" is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Bihar. Under this scheme, a monthly pension is provided to widows in the age group of 40 to 79 years who belong to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families to support them financially. This scheme is centrally sponsored.Objective:The objective of this scheme is to provide social security to the widows of poor families of the society by providing them financial assistance.
benefits: Under this scheme
eligible widows will receive a monthly pension of ₹400/-. Note: The pension amount is being paid to the beneficiaries under the Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) process. In this process
the pension amount is paid directly into the accounts of the beneficiaries through PFMS from the state level on the basis of the account number provided by the beneficiaries.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Bihar.The applicant should be a widow.The widow's age should be between 40 and 79 years.The widow should belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.The widow should not be receiving pension benefits under any social security scheme.
required_documents: Aadhaar card of the applicantPassport-size photographIdentity proof i.e. Voter ID Card
Driving LicenseDeath certificate of husbandResidence ProofProof of ageBelow Poverty Line (BPL) Card/related documentsCaste certificate
if applicableAddress proofBank Passbook/Bank account detailsAny other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide social security to widows from poor families by offering them financial assistance in the form of a monthly pension.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this pension scheme?
faqs.answer: Widows residing in Bihar, aged between 40 and 79 years, belonging to Below Poverty Line (BPL) families, and not receiving pension benefits under any other social security scheme are eligible.

faqs.question: How much pension is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible widows receive a monthly pension of ₹400/- under this scheme.

faqs.question: How is the pension amount disbursed to beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The pension amount is disbursed directly into the beneficiaries' bank accounts through the Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) process via the Public Financial Management System (PFMS).

faqs.question: What is the age criterion for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The widow's age should be between 40 and 79 years to be eligible for the pension.

faqs.question: Can a widow receiving another pension apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, widows who are receiving pension benefits under any other social security scheme are not eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any income criterion for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, the widow must belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family to be eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply by submitting a duly filled and signed application in the prescribed format, along with required attachments, at the Right to Public Service (RTPS) counter located at the block office level.

faqs.question: Where should the application for the pension scheme be submitted?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted at the Right to Public Service (RTPS) counter at the block office level.

faqs.question: What happens after submitting the application?
faqs.answer: After submission, applicants receive an acknowledgment receipt. They will be notified of the application's approval or rejection via SMS or email.

faqs.question: What if an application is rejected?
faqs.answer: If an application is rejected, the applicant will be notified of the reasons for rejection. They can reapply after addressing the issues or contact the grievance redressal system for further assistance.

name: E.V.R. Maniammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Daughter’s of Poor Widows: Scheme-II
description: The "E.V.R. Maniammaiyar Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Daughters of Poor Widows: Scheme-II" was launched by the Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The aim is to help poor widow mothers who face financial hardship in conducting their daughter's marriage. The scheme provides financial assistance ₹50,000/- along with one sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam for the marriage of their daughters.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹50

000/- for marriage expenses.1 Sovereign (8gm) 22-carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam.Mode of Disbursal: Through Electronic Clearing Service.﻿NOTE: The benefit can be given to the bride in case of the death of the widowed mother.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a Widow.The applicant should be the mother of a girl child.The annual income of the family should not exceed ₹72
000/-.The age of the bride should be above 18 years.The allowance is granted for the marriage of one daughter only.The bride should be one of the following:A degree holder from regular colleges
distance education/government-recognized open university.A diploma holder from the Institution recognized by the Directorate of Technical Education
Government of Tamil Nadu.
required_documents: 1. Death Certificate of husband (to be obtained from Corporation / Municipality) 2. Widow Certificate (to be obtained from Tahsildar) 3. Income Certificate (issued by the Tahsildar) 4. Passport-size photograph of the Applicant. 5. Age Certificate of the Bride.6. Marriage Invitation.7. Bills towards purchase of marriage articles for less than ₹10
000/-NOTE: Beneficiaries getting a widow pension under the Social Security Pension Scheme don't need to provide a window certificate and income certificate.

faqs.question: Who does the scheme aim to assist?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to poor widow mothers for conducting their daughter's marriage.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance is provided in Scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹50,000 is provided along with 1 Sovereign (8gm) 22 carat gold coin for making Thirumangalyam.

faqs.question: What is the income limit for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The annual income of the family should not exceed ₹72,000/- to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any conditions regarding the number of daughters eligible for assistance?
faqs.answer: Assistance is provided to one daughter of the widowed mother.

faqs.question: What happens if applications are submitted late?
faqs.answer: Applications received after the marriage date will not be entertained.

faqs.question: What is the probable time limit for processing applications?
faqs.answer: Applications are typically processed within 15 days from the date of receipt.

faqs.question: What certificates need to be enclosed with the application for Scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries receiving a widow pension under the Social Security Pension Scheme are exempted from obtaining a widow certificate and income certificate, Others need to obtain these certificates from the concerned Tahsildar. A copy of the daughter's age certificate is also required and education certificate.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for the bride?
faqs.answer: The bride should have completed 18 years of age at the time of marriage, with no upper age limit.

faqs.question: Who should grievances be reported to at the district level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the District Collector/District Social Welfare Officer at the district level.

faqs.question: Who should grievances be reported to at the state level?
faqs.answer: Grievances should be reported to the Director of Social Welfare 2nd Floor, Panagal Maaligai, Saidapet, Chennai – 600 015. Phone No. 044-24351885 at the state level.

faqs.question: Can the benefit be given to the bride if her widowed mother passes away?
faqs.answer: Yes, the benefit can be given to the bride if her widowed mother passes away.

name: Widow Pension-West Bengal
description: In 2010, the West Bengal state government, through the Women and Child Development and Social Welfare Department, launched a compassionate initiative called the "Widow Pension" scheme. This program aims to provide financial support to widows facing economic hardship within the state.﻿﻿
benefits: Financials assistance of ₹1
000/- per Month through DBT mode to the beneficiaries.
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary must be widow girl/woman.The beneficiary should attain the age of 60 years or more.The beneficiary must be a citizen of India and a resident of West Bengal.The beneficiary family income must not exceed ₹ 1

000/- per month.The beneficiary must not be maintained by any of her relative.The beneficiary must have been a resident of West Bengal for at least ten years on the date of making the application.Professional beggars and mendicants are not eligible for the pension.
required_documents: Copy of Aadhaar self-attested.Copy of Ration Card.Copy of Voter Id.Copy of Disability Certificate.Copy of Income Certificate.Copy of Husband’s Death Certificate.Copy of Bank Pass Book.Nomination Form (In case of death).Passport Size photograph.

faqs.question: What is Widow Pension scheme ?
faqs.answer: N 2010, the Women and Child Development and Social Welfare Department of the West Bengal State Government introduced the "Widow Pension" scheme.

faqs.question: What are the benefits ?
faqs.answer: Financials Assistance will be provided.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits ?
faqs.answer: All the eligible  widow girl/woman.

faqs.question: What is the financial eligibility criteria ?
faqs.answer: Family income must be upto ₹1,000/-

faqs.question: Can widows from other states also get the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: No.

faqs.question: What is the minimum number of years of residence required?
faqs.answer: She must have been a resident of West Bengal for at least ten years on the date of making the application.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme ?
faqs.answer:
1. Get the application form.
2. Fill out the application form with required details.
3. Attach documents.
4. Submission of form.

faqs.question: How to get the application form ?
faqs.answer:
1. Office of the Block Development Officer or the Executive Officer of the concerned Panchayat Samity in case of the applicant resides in the rural areas under the said Panchayat Samity.
2. Office of the Sub-Divisional Officer in case of the applicant resides in Municipal / Notified areas outside the areas of Kolkata Municipal Corporation, and
3. Office of the Controller of Vagrancy, West Bengal situated at Purta Bhawan, Bidhan Nagar, Kolkata-700091, in case of the applicant resides within the areas under Kolkata Municipal Corporation.

faqs.question: Can applicant download the application form online?
faqs.answer:
Yes, from the below URL.
https://wbswpension.gov.in/readwrite/miscellaneous/form-P.pdf

faqs.question: What documents are required ?
faqs.answer:
1. Copy of Aadhaar self-attested.
2. Copy of Ration Card.
3. Copy of Voter Id.
4. Copy of Disability Certificate.
5. Copy of Income Certificate.
6. Copy of Husband’s Death Certificate.
7. Copy of Bank Pass Book.
8. Nomination Form (In case of death).
9. Passport Size photograph.

name: Mahila Nirman Shramik Vivah Yojana
description: The "Mahila Nirman Shramik Vivah Yojana" was launched by the Tripura Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department Tripura. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to registered female construction workers and maximum of two daughters of registered construction workers for marriage purposes. The registered beneficiary will apply in the prescribed form through electronically.﻿
benefits: A one-time grant of ₹50
000/- is provided to meet the marriage expenses of the female registered construction worker and a maximum of two daughters of a registered construction worker.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a female registered construction worker. The female construction worker should have been registered for at least one year continuously.The family of a registered construction worker can avail of this assistance only twice: however

there shall be only one claim in respect of a given marriage irrespective of the number of registered construction workers in the family.The registered construction workers should not have any dues payable to the Board.The registered construction worker's daughter should have attained the age prescribed by law for marriage for whose marriage the assistance is sought.  The registered construction worker's daughter should not be an employee in government or quasi-government.
required_documents: Copy of BOC Worker Registration Card.Bank Account Details.Marriage Certificate by Register of the Marriage.Affidavit (if marriage is outside Tripura State).Marriage Invitation Card.Ration card.Any other documents if required.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the Mahila Nirman Shramik Vivah Yojana?
faqs.answer: A registered construction worker who has been a continuous beneficiary for at least one year is eligible.

faqs.question: Are there any dues payable to the Board by the registered construction worker?
faqs.answer: No, the registered construction worker should have no dues payable to the Board.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for the daughter of the registered construction worker?
faqs.answer: The daughter should have attained the age prescribed by law for marriage.

faqs.question: Is the benefit applicable for remarriage?
faqs.answer: No, the benefit is not provided for remarriage.

faqs.question: When should the application be submitted?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted within six months of the marriage.

faqs.question: How can a registered beneficiary apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary can apply in the prescribed form electronically. The Labour Inspector will process and verify the application, and the Labour Officer will review and approve it.

faqs.question: What is the amount of the grant provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A one-time grant of ₹50,000 is provided for marriage expenses.

faqs.question: Is there any financial assistance for the marriage of male construction workers' daughters?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme specifically provides assistance for registered female construction workers and up to two daughters of registered construction workers.

faqs.question: What is the process for verifying the application?
faqs.answer: The Labour Inspector processes and verifies the application, and the Labour Officer reviews and approves it.

faqs.question: Can the benefit be availed if the marriage takes place outside Tripura State?
faqs.answer: Yes, but an affidavit must be provided if the marriage is outside Tripura State.

faqs.question: What happens if the application is submitted after six months of the marriage?
faqs.answer: The application may not be considered if submitted after six months of the marriage.

name: Integrated Social Security Scheme - Women In Distress
description: Launched in 1995, ISSS (Integrated Social Security Scheme) is a State Sponsored Scheme by the Social Welfare Department of the Govt. of Jammu and Kashmir where financial assistance is provided to Old Age Persons, Widows, Divorcees, Women in Distress, Transgenders, and Physically Handicapped Persons. The scheme is funded through Plan and Non-Plan on the basis of a 50:50 sharing pattern. ﻿The scheme has the following components - a) Pension for Old Age Personb) Pension for Women in Distressc) Pension for Physically Challenged Persond) Pension to Transgenders﻿Under the "Women in Distress" component of ISSS, a pension of ₹1,000 per pensioner per month is deposited directly into their Bank Account through DBT mode. The aim of the scheme is to provide monthly financial assistance to destitute widows/divorced/deserted women with no source of income.
benefits: A pension of ₹1
000 per pensioner per month is deposited directly into their Bank Account through DBT mode.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a destitute widow/divorced/deserted woman.The income of the applicant should be less than ₹ 75
000/- per annum or the applicant should be from the "Below Poverty Line (BPL)" Category.The age of the applicant should be between 40 and 79 years.
required_documents: Proof of Residence (Ration Card / Voter Card
etc.)Death Certificate of the Husband in case of WidowIncome Certificate (of less than ₹ 75
000/- per annum or BPL Category)Copy of Aadhaar CardCopy of Bank PassbookPassport Sized Photograph

faqs.question: Which Are The Components Of The ISSS (Integrated Social Security Scheme)?
faqs.answer: The ISSS (Integrated Social Security Scheme) has the following components - a) Pension for Old Age Persons b) Pension for Women in Distress c) Pension for Physically Challenged Persons d) Pension to Transgenders

faqs.question: What Benefits Are Provided Under The "Women In Distress" Component Of ISSS?
faqs.answer: Under the "Pension to Women In Distress," component of ISSS, a pension of ₹1000 per pensioner per month is deposited directly into their Bank Account through DBT mode.

faqs.question: What Is The Aim Of The "Pension To Transgenders" Component Of ISSS?
faqs.answer: The aim of the scheme is to provide monthly financial assistance to destitute Widows/divorced/deserted women with no source of income.

faqs.question: Is ISSS A Central Scheme Or A State Sponsored Scheme?
faqs.answer: ISSS (Integrated Social Security Scheme) is a State Sponsored Scheme by the Social Welfare Department of the Govt. of Jammu and Kashmir

faqs.question: Who Are The Beneficiaries Of ISSS?
faqs.answer: The Beneficiaries Of ISSS can be Old Age Persons, Widows, Divorcees, Women in Distress, Transgenders, and Physically Handicapped Persons

faqs.question: Is There An Income Criteria For ISSS "Pension To Women In Distress"?
faqs.answer: Yes, the income of the applicant should be less than Rs. 75,000/- per annum or the applicant should be from the "Below Poverty Line (BPL)" Category.

faqs.question: To Whom Shall The Application Be Addressed?
faqs.answer: The applicant shall submit the duly filled and signed application form (https://jkdswdj.jk.gov.in/pdf/FORMISSS1.pdf) to the concerned Tehsil Social Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: Is there an age criteria to this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the age of the woman should be between 40-79 years.

faqs.question: Who is the Chairman of the Pension Sanctioning Authority?
faqs.answer: The Chairman Of The Pension Sanctioning Authority shall be the Director General, Social welfare Department, Kashmir

faqs.question: Who Is The Member Secretary Of The Pension Sanctioning Authority?
faqs.answer: The Member Secretary Of The Pension Sanctioning Authority Shall Be The District Social Welfare Officer.

faqs.question: Who are The Members Of The Pension Sanctioning Authority?
faqs.answer: The Members Secretary Of The Pension Sanctioning Authority Shall Be The Assistant Commissioner (Development), and the Chief Medical Officer.

name: Marriage Grant for the Marriage of Daughters of Widows of Ex-servicemen (other than War Widows)
description: The "Marriage Grant for the Marriage of Daughters of Widows of Ex-servicemen (other than War Widows)" scheme is implemented by the Sainik and Ardh Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹11,000/- is provided to the widows of ex-servicemen (other than war widows) for the marriage of their daughters, for up to two daughters who are at least 18 years old.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹11
000/- is given to the widows of ex-servicemen (other than war widows) for the marriage of their daughters.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.The applicant should be the widow of an ex-serviceman who did not die in the war (other than a war widow).The daughter should be at least 18 years old.The widow can receive the benefit for up to two of her daughters.The widow should not have remarried. If remarried

she should only have married the real brother of her late husband.Note: The entire verification of claimants will be carried out at the level of the Secretaries of Zila Sainik Boards as hither-to-fore.
required_documents: Identity proof of widow of ex-servicemanParivar Pehchan PatraOriginal Discharge Book of ex-serviceman (Complete)Domicile Certificate of HaryanaCopy of Bank Passbook linked with Aadhaar CardApplicant’s Photo ID Proof (Ration Card/Driving Licence/ Voter ID Card/PAN Card etc.)P.P.ODeath Certificate of Ex-servicemanAadhaar CardAge Proof- Matric Exam Certificate for Date of Birth verification (attested)Wedding CardAny other documents as required

faqs.question: What is the primary benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary benefit is financial assistance of ₹11,000/- for the marriage of up to two daughters of widows of ex-servicemen (other than war widows).

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The widow of an ex-serviceman who did not die in the war, is a resident of Haryana, and whose daughter(s) are at least 18 years old.

faqs.question: Does the widow need to be a resident of Haryana to be eligible?
faqs.answer: Yes, the widow must be a resident of Haryana.

faqs.question: Can a widow who has remarried apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, but only if she has remarried the real brother of her late husband.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for the daughters to receive this grant?
faqs.answer: The daughter should be at least 18 years old.

faqs.question: How many daughters can receive this grant under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The widow can receive the benefit for up to two of her daughters.

faqs.question: How can eligible applicants apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants can apply online through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal at https://saralharyana.gov.in/

faqs.question: How can applicants track their application status?
faqs.answer: Applicants can track their applications through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal by entering their Department Name, Scheme Name, and Application Reference ID at https://status.saralharyana.nic.in/

name: Pension To Widows And Destitute Women-Chandigarh
description: The Pension to Widows And Destitute Women scheme under the Social Welfare, Women & Child Development Department of Chandigarh Goverment provides financial assistance to widows and destitute women to alleviate their economic hardship and provide a semblance of stability in their lives. This support often comes in the form of monthly stipends or welfare programs designed to meet their basic needs, including food, shelter, and healthcare. By extending financial aid, governments or charitable organizations seek to empower these vulnerable individuals to become more self-reliant and regain their footing in society.Additionally, such assistance may include access to vocational training or educational opportunities to enhance their skills and employability, fostering long-term independence. Ultimately, these initiatives contribute to fostering social inclusion and reducing poverty among widows and destitute women, ensuring they have the necessary support to rebuild their lives with dignity.
benefits: Pension Amount To Widows And Destitute Women - ₹1
000/-  per month
eligibility_criteria: The applicant women's age should be 18-60 years.The applicant should be a resident of UT
Chandigarh for more than 3 years.The applicant's family's annual income should not exceed ₹1
required_documents: Residence proof of three years (Voter Card
Ration Card
Electricity Bill etc).Death certificate of husband (In case of widow).Aadhar Card.Mobile Number.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide financial assistance to Widows and Destitute Women.

faqs.question: How often are pension payments made to beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Pension payments are typically made every month to eligible beneficiaries.

faqs.question: How much amount can be given as an old age pension?
Is There An Income-Related Criterion For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Family income of the applicant should not exceed ₹1.50 lacs annually.

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The women of the age group 18-60 Years.

faqs.question: How do a applicant know if a field in the application form is mandatory?
faqs.answer: The mandatory fields have an asterisk (*) mark at the end.

faqs.question: Can applicants from outside Chandigarh apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only for Chandigarh.

faqs.question: How can applicant apply online?
faqs.answer: Applicants visit the e-District http://admser.chd.nic.in/marriage/PortalUser/PortalLogin.aspx

faqs.question: What documents are required ?
faqs.answer:
Residence proof of three years (Voter Card, Ration Card, Electricity Bill etc).
Death certificate of husband (In case of widow).
Aadhar Card.
Mobile Number.

faqs.question: Under which department does this scheme come?
faqs.answer: Social Welfare, Women & Child Development.

name: Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme
description: "Lakshmir Bhandar" Scheme is a flagship program launched by the West Bengal Government in February 2021, to provide financial assistance to women from economically weaker sections of society. For the empowerment of women in the age group of 25-60 years and enrolled in ‘Swasthya Sathi’, ₹ 1,200/- every month to women SC/ST households and ₹ 1,000/- per month to other beneficiaries are provided. The scheme aims to empower women and make them financially independent by providing them with a one-time grant to buy essential goods and services.
benefits: For women from Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribes households: ₹ 1
200/- per monthFor women from other category: ₹ 1
000/- per month.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of West Bengal.The applicant should be a woman.The age of the applicant should be between 25 - 60 years.The household of the applicant should be enrolled under the "Swasthyasathi" scheme.The applicant should not be a government employee in permanent employment/ retired government employee of Central/ State Government
Statutory Bodies
Government Undertakings
Panchayats
Municipal Corporations/ Municipalities
Local Bodies
teaching and non-teaching employees of Government aided Educational Institutions
etc. receiving regular salary/ pension.
required_documents: Swasthyasathi CardAadhaar CardSC/ST Certificate
if applicableBank Account Details: Self-attested photocopy of the page of the bank book which provides details of the account holder's name
account no.
bank address

IFS Code and MICR No. The bank account should be a single bank account in name of the eligible adult female member only.Colored passport-size photograph of the applicant.Self-declaration duly signed by the applicant to the effect:          a)  That she is a resident of West Bengal          b)  That she does not earn any monthly remuneration/pension from any regular job of State Government
Statutory Bodies
Government Undertakings
Panchayats
Municipal Corporations/ Municipalities
Local Bodies
Government aided Educational Institutions
etc.          c)  Information furnished by her in the application form is true

faqs.question: What Is The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: The Lakshmir Bhandar scheme is a financial assistance program launched by the government of West Bengal to provide a one-time grant of Rs. 1000 to women from economically weaker sections of society.

faqs.question: Who Is Eligible For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: Women from economically weaker sections of society who are permanent residents of West Bengal and are not beneficiaries of any other similar government scheme are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Fee To Apply For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: No, there is no fee to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: What Is The Grant Amount Under The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: The grant amount under the scheme is Rs. 1000.

faqs.question: Can I Use The Grant Amount For Any Purpose?
faqs.answer: Answer: The grant amount can be used to purchase essential goods and services.

faqs.question: How Will I Receive The Grant Amount Under The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: The grant amount will be transferred directly to your bank account.

faqs.question: How Long Does It Take To Receive The Grant Amount Under The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: If your application is approved, you will receive the grant amount within a few days.

faqs.question: Can I Apply For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme If I Am Already A Beneficiary Of Another Government Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: No, you cannot apply for the scheme if you are already a beneficiary of another similar government scheme.

faqs.question: What Is The Age Limit To Apply For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: There is no age limit to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: What Is The Objective Of The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to women from economically weaker sections of society and to help them become self-sufficient and independent.

faqs.question: What Is The Deadline To Apply For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: There is no deadline to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can I Check The Status Of My Application For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: Yes, you can check the status of your application on the official website.

faqs.question: What Should I Do If My Application For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme Is Rejected?
faqs.answer: Answer: If your application is rejected, you can reapply after correcting the errors or providing additional documents.

faqs.question: Can I Apply For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme If I Am A Student?
faqs.answer: Answer: Yes, as long as you meet the eligibility criteria, you can apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can Men Apply For The Lakshmir Bhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Answer: No, the scheme is only for women.

faqs.question: Can I Withdraw The Grant Amount In Cash?
faqs.answer: Answer: No, the grant amount will be transferred directly to your bank account.

name: Grant-in-Aid Scheme To Provide Financial Assistance To The Mahila Mandals/ Women’s Self-help Groups (SWAWLAMBHAN)
description: The scheme "Grant-in-Aid Scheme to Provide Financial Assistance to the Mahila Mandals/ Women’s Self-help Groups (SWAWLAMBHAN)" by the Directorate of Women And Child Development, Govt. of Goa, provides financial assistance to Mahila Mandals/Self-Help Groups for training/orientation for members of the Mahila Mandal/ Self Help Groups for generating their own activity for self-employment. This Scheme is applicable to all the Mahila Mandals/Women's Self-Help Groups duly registered before the competent authority within the territory of Goa.
benefits: Financial Assistance: ₹ 20
000/- sanctioned as annual grants.Purpose: For successful functioning in the state of Goa.﻿Financial Assistance: ₹ 5

000/-.Purpose: For undertaking any gainful self-employment activity training orientation in the activities.﻿For the Master TrainersThe Directorate may provide resource persons/ Master Trainers/Instructors for each course of activity through CDPOs.A fixed honorarium of ₹ 5
000/- will be paid per course..Actual Travel Allowance (TA) incurred shall be paid if travelling in the Taluka outside his/her jurisdiction.
eligibility_criteria: The Mahila Mandals/Women’s Self-Help Groups should have valid registration with the Department of Women & Child Development

Panaji-Goa.The Mahila Mandals/Women’s Self-Help Groups shall be operating successfully for their members within the State of Goa.There shall be a minimum of 20 members for training/orientation.NOTE: The compulsion of 2 years of registration is deleted.
required_documents: Mahila Mandal/ Self Help GroupsCopy of Registration Certificate.Last Two Years' Statement of Accounts.Project Report

Specifying the Activities/training.Detailed List of Prospective Beneficiaries With Educational Details.﻿For the Master Trainer/ InstructorBirth Certificate.Education Qualification.Marriage Certificate.Certificate of Course attendedDocument of ID Proof.﻿NOTE: All documents submitted should be self-attested by the applicant.

faqs.question: How Can Mahila Mandals/Women's Self Help Groups Make The Payment For Registration, And Where Should They Submit The Confirmation Of Payment?
faqs.answer: The registration amount of Rs. 1500 can be paid through Demand Draft (DD) or E-payment modes like NEFT, RTGS, OTS, Debit Card/Net Banking. The confirmation of payment should be submitted at the respective taluka level office for the issuance of the Registration Certificate.

faqs.question: What Are The Steps To Register A Mahila Mandal/Women's Self Help Group Under The Department Of Women And Child Development To Avail Benefits Under The Scheme?
faqs.answer: The MM/SHGs need to fill the prescribed application form for registration, pay the registration amount of Rs. 1500, and submit required documents like registration certificate, member details, and bank passbook copy to the taluka level office.

faqs.question: Who Is The Implementing Authority Of The Scheme, And What Responsibilities Does This Authority Have?
faqs.answer: The CDPO of the concerned block is the implementing authority of the Scheme. Their responsibilities include ensuring effective implementation, conducting monthly meetings, and maintaining records of the Scheme.

faqs.question: Within What Timeframe Should The CDPO Submit The Utilization Certificate, And What Additional Report Should Be Submitted On A Monthly Basis?
faqs.answer: The CDPO should submit the utilization certificate within one month. Additionally, the CDPO should submit a monthly progress report for effective implementation of the Scheme.

faqs.question: What Happens To The Registration Certificate If The Mahila Mandal/Women's Self Help Group Dissolves Or Ceases To Exist?
faqs.answer: If the group dissolves or ceases to exist, the Registration Certificate issued to avail benefits under the Swawlamban Scheme shall be treated as canceled.

faqs.question: What Is The Process For Replacing Members In Case Of Their Resignation Or Death In The Mahila Mandal/Women's Self Help Group?
faqs.answer: In the case of resignation or death of a member, new members can be added by the group through a recorded resolution and intimation to the respective taluka.

faqs.question: How Can The Annual Grant Of Rs. 20,000 Be Utilized By Mahila Mandals/Women's Self Help Groups?
faqs.answer: The annual grant of Rs. 20,000 should be used for the purchase of Assets/Infrastructure for the Mahila Mandals/Women's Self Help Groups, such as electronic items, furniture, machinery, or equipment, benefiting the group.

faqs.question: What Records Need To Be Maintained By The Mahila Mandal/Women's Self Help Group Concerning The Training Program And Annual Grants?
faqs.answer: The Mahila Mandal/Women's Self Help Group must maintain proper records of bills and vouchers related to the training program and submit them to the CDPO within a week after completion of the program.

faqs.question: What Expenses Are Not Covered By The Government Under The Scheme, Apart From The Financial Assistance?
faqs.answer: The government does not cover additional liabilities such as House Rent, Electricity Bill, or Water Bill under the Scheme.
